YOU CAN'T HAVE A FIVE STAR HOTEL WITHOUT FIVE STAR GUESTS EITHER!

First, I would like to apologize to the maids that had to clean our suite. It was my first trip to Vegas. Enough said. 

The poolside nap and strawberry daiquiri may be the only reasons I lived, and for that, I thank you Encore. 

We never made it to the official beach party, but the European pool was packed Saturday and perfect for recovering on Sunday. 

The casino floor was nice and all the staff was super helpful as I tried to figure out how in the world to play craps. 

We didn't visit any of the clubs in the hotel, but everyone was looking super sexy standing around in the lines crossing through the casino floor. 

The view from the room was amazing and the curtains (that can be controlled by remote) were the best black out curtains I've ever seen. When we got back after sunrise we were able to shut the curtains and sleep until the second round began...

My stay at the extraordinary Encore\/Wynn Las Vegas came up in a conversation I had with a friend, when comparing it to my stay at the equally extraordinary Palazzo Hotel.  So here is my review...

This is a masterpiece of a hotel! It simply does not get better than this for Prestige, entertainment, location, and overall splendor! The luxuries and amenities at this superlative property cannot be overstated. Let's just say that the service was impeccable, the surroundings completely luxurious, and the rooms were big yet cozy and designed with a wonderfully contemporary flair.

On another note, the encore Beach party was a party that felt like it was for the lifestyles of the rich and famous! The world famous Zed was actually the DJ!  If you like an extraordinary party, and swimming pools and alcohol, with hundreds of people, then this is your ticket! It was an absolute blast. There were plenty of places in the hotel that you could find that were quiet, and reserved, if that is your preference, but the beach party was for loud fun! 

To say I recommend this extraordinary hotel casino resort would be an understatement. If you have the means, give this hotel a stay, it is well worth it!  Bravo!

The hotel itself was amazing. The decor beautiful, room nice and big with a even bigger beautiful luxurious bathroom. The beds feel like your sleeping on a cloud. And very convenient for those going to the club XS to see Diplo like we did. 
But there was a huge fault in this perfect stay. The room was paid for as a gift and all I had to do was put a $150 deposit which would be returned minus $28 for resort fees in 4 days sense I used my ATM. I only stayed for 1 night but they took for the first day $150 as expected then the next day $179 and then another charge for $270. For what reason I still have no clue sense the room had already been paid for. All of the charges got refunded one at a time after the 4 days but sense it was my ATM account it messed with all of my bills sense it was right at rent time. 
So sense they took that money out for no reason I did not have enough in my account at the time for a couple of bills to go threw and was charged late fees. Thanks ENCORE!!!
So be careful and make sure to check your charges for they might pull a fast one on you. It's not the first time either for something similar happen to a friend of mine. 
Don't think I will go back and stay there for the fear they will mess up my bank again.
First time here. Popping with young people. The suite was pretty spacious and modern. Bathroom was huge. Housekeeping was fabulous. Easy garage parking.

couple of concern, charging for wifi in Vegas?
Then Encore tried to charge me for early checkout. yup, early checkout. Like booking for 3 days, they will charge u the third day even u check out the second day.

By far my Favorite restaurants and casino and rooms are at this hotel
I love Surrender
I love XS 
I love the lounge bars and Sinatras. 

LeReve is amazing
Room Service is punctual and rooms aren't a mile away from elevators 
Higher class of people 

Love this place!

The Encore is by far my favorite place to spend a weekend on the strip. The casino is very clean and the staff is friendly. They cater to a variety of crowds including the 21-30 year old club types for XS and the day club. There are also many business convention types here and a nice mix of different types of people. There are also normally a fair amount of kids\/families here. 

If you are familiar with the Palazzo rooms, these are very comparable in size. The rooms are bigger & Nicer than Aria's.

Don't miss:
The Spa. It is absolutely amazing and worth every penny! 
The buffet. Variety Variety Variety! Who knew they could master so many different types of cuisine?
The Pool. Very relaxing
La Cave. Amazing wines and bacon wrapped dates!! 
The Gardens.

Halloween weekend for a gathering of bachelor's as one prepares to share his life with the woman of his dreams...dramatic enough? This was a celebration to the fullest. I can't say enough how impressed I was with the customer service of this hotel. The room itself was alright but everything from the front desk, valet staff and housekeeping were top notch. The room served its purpose as a lair for The Karate Kid to rest while Cobra Kai chased him around the hotel. Mr.Miyagi couldn't have that and had Daniel San crane kick em into a body bag... This place is on hit for sure.

The last time I stayed here I gave this place two stars.  Now, I'm dropping it to one star.  Like I said last time, the place is beautiful and a great hotel.  However, the rules have gotten worse.  I've been coming to The Encore for over 5 years now.  I never pack anything other than shorts and tank tops since Vegas is hot.  So, I'm wearing my Baron Davis Warriors jersey and the lady at the lounge says to me that she can't serve my girlfriend food with me standing next to her since tank tops on men are banned.  My girlfriend was wearing a tank top too and  her nipples were poking through the shirt pretty good.  I asked what's the difference if my shoulders were showing.  I said my girldfriends nipples are showing and that would normally be a problem in many bars\/restaurants.  She said men have to wear shirts with sleaves and women can wear anything they want.  Wow!  

Later at the European pool, my girlfriend was topless and in her thong\/g-string.  She wanted to buy me a beer at the bar by the topless pool.  We both walk up there and they say they can't sell her a beer because she is topless.  My girlfriend says it's a topless pool and you are the bar at the topless pool.  Why can't you sell me a beer?  Their response was we have rules.  Mind you, I was wearing my basketball jersey and at the topless pool they can serve me, but not a topless woman.  

The Encore makes no sense to me.  A great hotel that doesn't cater to its customers.  I will stay there again because it's nice and the best hotel on the strip.  However, I will never hangout there and spend money.  I would rather go to other hotels where things are more laid back.  

Sorry Encore, you only get one star.

I stayed at the encore from 07\/4\/2013-07\/8\/2013 this is hotel is gorgeous in and out I I'll definitely not say anything negative about that... My few complaints are the way I was treated when I went to a craps table here. I was sitting at a slot machine enjoying a beer when I heard a lot of cheering going on at a craps table so I decided to go check it out and maybe jump in the game.. When I go over there and start watching the pit boss asked this "high roller" I guess if he was going to Make a bet and the exact words that came from this guys mouth was "yeah I will make my bet when you get this as*hole outta here" (he was talking to me but I didn't even know at first) then the pit boss asks me to leave and says its a "private" game... 

1. There were no stantions blocking it off
2.No one said anything besides this douche who was dressed like a slob
3. All because you have money doesn't mean you talk to people like that especially a paying guest

The pit boss then Denies he called me a "as*hole when everyone clearly heard him!

I'm basically told the guy (the shaggy dude) if he wanted to find out who a real ahole was we can go outside and he just stood there ...

That's my MAIN complaint.. They did nothing to fix the situation you don't let people be treated that way who are paying over 1000 dollars to stay there...


Overall the hotel charges WAY too much for EVERYTHING like come on 19.65 for two coronas at the bar? What are they smoking ... I refused to pay that..

The room itself was really nice .. 21st floor strip view.. Can't complain..

Overall my opinion save your money and go somewhere with LESS RESORT FEES... These hotels are getting insane..

This place will wow you. It has amazing decor, the rooms are beautiful. The shops are nice. The buffet is amazing. The spa is second to none. There's just so much good about this hotel. I stayed at venitian after staying at Encore, which is another 5 star VIP hotel and let me tell you it is a world of difference. This hotel is really expensive though, my wife and I spent an average of 500 bucks a day just in this hotel. But you really do get what you pay for. They didn't take any shortcuts when they built this hotel, they spent a lot of money and it shows. Also the poker room is beautiful, the best I have ever seen, makes other nice poker rooms look like poker rooms at a bowling alley. Only complaint would be that it's so far from everything else. Bellagio and Aria, which are comparable in price and amenities are located in the middle of the strip. Encore\/Wynn is all the way at the end if you want to get to the middle of the strip you'll likely need a cab, unless your willing to walk for a while (depending on how hot it is that walk could start to feel like what you expect out of hell).

Gorgeous, Beautiful, Luxurious.  These words can not even begin to describe this new LV addition.  It is smaller than the Wynn but I love its intimate feel.  Even the restrooms are spectacular.  The tile floors had many many butterfly designs which made me a quick fan.  There is also a Botero restaurant in there that is absolutely beautiful ( I guess similar to the Picasso in Bellagio).  I loved all the red and was very impressed with the air in there.  It smelled of flowers and you do not smell cigarettes even though they are present.  The Asian fusion restaurant has the most beautiful dragon sculpture I've ever seen.  Oh how do I love thee...

best hotel ever!
nice room nice service nice restaurants nice casino nice buffet

My favorite hotel in Las Vegas for multiple reasons!

First off, location. I'm a pretty young gun (for now, at least) so my friends and I like to go clubbing at night and the Wynn\/Encore has a lot of the major nightclubs\/dayclub like Intrigue, XS, Surrender, and Encore Beach Club. It's always a plus staying here so we don't have to taxi out to another hotel to see one of our favorite DJs and once the night is over being able to walk back up to our hotel room is a life saver. 

Secondly, decor and atmosphere. Whenever you stay here it's very contemporary and modern and the buffet (not a great buffet, but nicely decorated) is so colorful it looks like a movie. The main entrance has a colorful, beautiful almost little forest area that people love taking pictures in. It's iconic. 

Third, the staff. Everyone from the second you check in is amazing and friendly. Even the guys that check your cards on your way up to your room are sweet and will crack jokes! Never hesitant to ask for anything here because everyone is so sweet and attentive. 

Fourth, the room. Rooms are always clean and the housekeeping staff are amazing at their job. Truly attention to detail here and the rooms are spacious and beautiful. Lights and drapes open and close by the press of a button and air conditioning? A+

Thank you Encore\/Wynn for an amazing experience these past three years, I'll definitely be back sometime soon!

My partner and I enjoy coming to Vegas for a fun getaway. The Encore is by far #1! We checked in on a Monday and when we arrived we waiting in line maybe five minutes. The rooms are spacious, clean and relaxing. Soft bedding, large soak tub, couch and flip tv. Oh and of course a tv in the bathroom for when you're rexlaxing in a bubble bath. Lets not forget the bedside light\/shade touch pad. Even the small things such as shoe polish and q-tips in the bathroom were such a lovely touch. The windows are floor to ceiling, so its really an incredible view. We stayed on the 14th floor. Wish we would've gotten a higher floor though. The staff was incredibly friendly and accomodating. Shout out to Carol n the casino floor at Wynn. She was awesome. We didn't play at the Encore, but my partner enjoys poker, so he hit up the poker room at Wynn.The only negative for me was the walk. Its a pretty good one. All in all, the Encore is an excellent place to stay!
My and my wife enjoyed our stay, very luxurious atmosphere, especially when you want to feel like you have money :)

I am honestly not that big of a fan, after finally having stayed a few nights. 51st floor, north facing, king suite. Was I wowed? Nope. Mind you, we were not guests at the Tower Suites, or their apartment\/villas.. I heard the experience there is like a whole different kind of property.

Yes, there are floor to ceiling windows. Yes, they are big. Yes, the general overall quality of the furnishings and upholstery, bed quality above average. But surprised there were....

SHARP (!!) TVs that are used to partition the sleeping from the lounge area (which was fine.. no wow factor)...no coffee anywhere in the room. What!!!! No coffee, just so you, Steve, can force us to give you even more of our $ and head to the 24 hour Cafe strategically positioned at the corner of the Wynn and Encore? So apparent, and soooo cheap of him.

A minor threat (things are spring loaded) in form of sign that if any item either atop the fridge or inside it is moved or displaced after a period of 60 seconds, patron will be charged a $25 restocking fee. 118F weather. Not able to even chill anything purchased. Just so foolish and ridiculous.

Chinese have a word called " DAI FONG". That means, more or less, big-hearted\/generous\/not displaying stinginess n penny-pinching. Mr. Wynn, for having blown $2 BILLION (not to mention the $60 million it took to make the Beach Club and pool materialize to stay competitive), is...

NOT THIS DESCRIPTOR! at least he's not showing it in the small stuff. I was very, very put off by this. 

Facial bar of soap doesn't even lather or possess any kind of emollience. Reminded me so much of those dermatological soaps\/fragrance free, etc... and did not speak "luxury" to me; rather, medicine soap! No thanks. Must say, tho,their BAMBU line of lemongrass citrus was off the hook... in the way of shower gel and shampoo, etc.  No daily paper to room. urgh.

The gym. let's not speak of the poor, shoddy ventilation, low ceilings, etc. Though those Cybex machines i enjoy so much are present, and there are chilled water bottles and towels (like other high end hotels.. i.e. Ritz, Aria), it appeared like another room of the spa\/salon area. Strange to work out in such a space. And again.. that
sucky ventilation. Overheard 2 other gentlemen complain about it audibly. 

The gym and spa bathroom are shared. As such, welcome to total luxuriance... a living room, large TV, sofas, faux fireplace, and tea and spa water, fruit found inside of the bathroom.. Yep! and staff linger there too. 

Pool... mostly adults were there. The pool shape and lack of en masse peeps was nice. relaxing to swim and sun... Drinks here were major weaksauce and were made poorly. Mojito and an Arnold Palmer. Ratios didn't balance on either drink. Dont' ask the prices. GULP.

Another separate European pool adjacent. These are completely separate entrances than the Beach Club, with all those famed lilypads and cabanas. 

PS most comical moment: watching Cantonese soap operas and serials (both olden style and contemporary) from the bathtub. I had to LOL on that one... such a total novelty and weird experience!!! There are about 6 channels all dedicated either in Canto or Mandarin. The vice of my people........ sigh

I just got back from Vegas a couple of days ago and me and some friends got a suite here! Everything and every part of this place is decorated and designed beautifully. 

When I walked into our suite the first thing that came to mind was WOW!!! Our view was beautiful and everything about the room was beautiful, especially the bathroom. I really loved the glass shower and I loved how there were two sinks and a huge mirror, they even provided a light up vanity mirror. Another thing I loved about our room was that the curtains, privacy notification (aka the please do not disturb sign) and I believe the lights were all remote controlled! LOVE IT, because I'm too lazy to get up and do things when I'm on vacation! 

We called house keeping quite a few times, okay okay MANY TIMES and they were pretty slow with bringing things up, the only time they came up quickly was when we asked for a bunch of band-aids and security brought that up to us. But with my experience house keeping at most hotel aren't instantaneous because they have other guests they need to take care of as well.

On a lighter note, staying here was so convenient because you have XS and Surrender right downstairs and plenty of good restaurants to dine at, PERFECT. If you're heading downstairs be sure you have your room key with you because if you don't the security will not let you get to the elevators until they see your room key! Oh, and I believe when you check-in, you need to put down a $250 deposit. Which you will get back minus the hotel fees. 

I'll be back the next time I'm in Vegas! I can't imagine staying at any other hotel.
Total class and top notch service

We had some out of town guests that have stayed at their fair share of Rosewoods, Four Seasons, Ritz-Carlton's, et al. who decided that this year would be a time to visit my family.

They chose to stay at the Encore Tower Suites as the venue of choice, and they were very summarily impressed from their point of arrival to the rest of their stay. I can't speak for their departure experience, as we had already left town before then.

We got an opportunity to tour out guests' suite, and I must say from the moment that we were greeted by the lady usher at the Tower Suites entrance, and all of our interaction with the staff, and the overall decor and amenities; I just can't help but be in awe of how well executed everything was.

The classic, yet ornate elegance, the courtesy and friendliness of the staff, and the view were just stupendous.

We no longer have any reason to stay at any hotel in Las Vegas as we have a beautiful and large home with many rooms. 

However, if we ever had a need to stay in any hotel - it would definitely be here!

There is definitely no doubt that this property's awards are well deserved.

I have so much good to say, that I could just continue on with all that we had experienced.

The only, and I must emphasize the word only, negative experience we had was with their Valet service. 

They have to anticipate busy weekends and should have enough Valet help to move the cars along. 

Furthermore, they should not direct Valet parked cars towards a lane that the taxis obviously consider as their thoroughfare. Our car nearly got clipped multiple times by irate taxi drivers that insisted that we were in the wrong even though we were simply following the Valet's traffic guidance and direction.

Aside from the horrendous experience, everything after that was definitely a wonderful and  memorable experience.

Just simply a fabulous hotel!

***Best Hotel I've Ever Had***

The Encore is the best hotel in Las Vegas, handsdown! I would live here if I could. If it's your first time to Vegas or your 100th time, from the moment you walk into the lobby of Encore, you know you've arrived! 

There's nothing negative to say about this hotel, they have great rates, fabulous rooms, and luxurious accommodations. Steve Wynn knows the experience that guests want and he definitely delivers! 

The gym and spa here are also fabulous so definitely check them out!

Tip:
*Guests have access to discounted admission and the guest list for XS (but you must arrive by 10pm)

Bottom line, I can't wait to return the next time I'm in Las Vegas!

Everything about my experience at the Encore this past November was great! Parking was a breeze in the parking garage located between the Wynn and Encore, and check-in was quite easy despite our initial struggle finding the check-in area.

Our room was great and the staff were all so friendly and helpful, always greeting us in the hallways, making sure we had everything we needed, and telling us to enjoy! They were also great on bringing in extra towels if requested, etc. The beds were super comfortable and they remote controlled blinds was awesome! 

The dining options inside the Wynn and Encore are great I loved going to Society Cafe for breakfast and getting their blood orange mimosas. And the clubs are just right downstairs so no waiting in the cab lines and standing in the cold waiting to get into the club.

The casino areas were also beautiful, and while like most casinos smoking is allowed everywhere my only gripe is that there wasn't a non-smoking area like the other resorts so our clothes consistently smelled of cigarette smoke throughout our stay here.

The only improvement I can offer is the friendliness of the concierge staff, as they were very short and rude in assisting other guests and myself . As paying guests of the hotel it seemed odd to me that they couldn't help me reserve seats at the lounges in the Wynn\/Encore. They told me multiple times that they didn't do reservations for the lounges, but when I arrived at the lounges there were tables with reserved placards on them for people who were able to make prior reservations as I had originally hoped.

Beautiful Hotel Stunning visual delights for your senses..Very quick early check-in lovely room with an awe inspiring view..Customer service was top notch  So when you leave your money behind in Vegas at least you have gotten a nice experience to make up for your losses.Just walking through the Encore is a happy feeling,friendly staff ,colorful surroundings, fantasy peacocks and dragons,garden of blooming flowers.

I had the pleasure of staying at the Encore three nights comped by Mr. Wynn. Thank you Mr. Wynn!

The hotel room itself is beautiful kind of like a Miami meets Paris fusion 2009 style. Large spacious rooms and state of the art tvs and lamps and shades that close completely so you can go to sleep at 8am when the suns out LOL.

The pool is supposed to be amazing and topless. I was busy for I came up there for the Pacquiao vs Ricky Hatton fight so unfortunately I could not hit the pool but next time I definitely will!

Mr. Wynn feel free to comp me at any of your casinos any time!
Best in Vegas, bar none.  Thanks Mr. Wynn for repeated great stays and memories.  We'll keep coming back.

If I had a choice between the Wynn and Encore I'd select the latter. I've stayed at the Wynn and wasn't impressed at all. During my recent trip to Vegas, I walked through the Encore and it had a much better vibe...more light and happier staff.

My first visit to WYNN Properties but will definitely not be my last. I have always played a little when in Vegas but never had stayed as I'm belong to another group of hotels. I received an offer so I decided I needed my "End of the Semester" reward.  First of all property is beautiful every detail immaculate no feel of Vegas crowds. The receptionist was friendly helpful and she was excited about being a new Encore employee. She was a "Great Ambassador" for the hotel. My room\/suite 745 sq ft was "Gorgeous" I could make it my "European Stadwohnen" probably why I took such detailed pictures. I usually travel alone so I appreciated the Extra control going up the suite elevators. The gambling floors were were lighted machines I like in abundance and I was comfortable in my new found hotel. It's connected by a shopping gallery to the WYNN were All√©gro is located. I was able to eat a EXCELLENT late night pasta. Dan the experienced and attentive bar master realized that 1\/2 portion would be more than enough and recommended it for my  pasta. He was RIGHT!! I enjoyed my Sauvignon Blanc at the right temperature and had a good conversation with a lightning specialist of one of the shows on the property. Bar was lively and perfect for my taste. I ate at Sinatra's also great service food was exceptional only that night my Sauvignon Blanc was really to warm. I immediately gave back and my waiter brought a fresh glass from the bar which was perfect. He had opened the first from a bottle in hand which hadn't be tempered. The music of course was perfect. I will be coming again!

Stayed here for a conference, booked the King Suite....it was GORGEOUS!! Way more spacious than a lot of one bedroom apartments I've seen.  Very well lit rooms (I'm a stickler for lighting in hotel rooms! it's usually way too dark\/dim), and I LOVED that there were tons of mirrors...really makes a place look elegant. Unfortunately, I stayed on a low floor so I didn't have the greatest view....but honestly, the room was so nice I actually didn't mind. 
Everyone from the concierge to the doormen to the people at the check in\/out counter were very professional, courteous and pleasant. 

The place itself is HUGE...like, be prepared to do some serious walking....it has a big casino and restaurant, and it connects to the Wynn, which has its own separate huge casino and dining areas.

I was only there for a few days, for mainly business, so I didn't get to explore and enjoy all that the resort has to offer...but am strongly considering returning for a longer trip for leisure.

The only negative thing about the place was that smoking is allowed in all the restaurants and casinos. I know that's to be expected in a place like this, but for those of us who don't ascribe to cancer sticks, nor do we like being exposed to the fumes created by others who do ascribe to cancer sticks, it's a big turn off to be hit in the face with a cloud of smoke as soon as you walk into the lobby. Just sayin.

The best luxury hotel I've stayed to so far. The hotel paid a lot of attention to detail and the view was awesome. We were on the 20th floor and could see the strip from our room. Also the location was next to a pretty good and price reasonable taco shop. The beach club was just downstairs and their spa was amazing. 

FYI Men and woman are separated at this spa and also looks like they are registered so Canadian health plans seems to cover this (at least mine did).

Their gym lacked a bit of free weights so there was an occasional wait but the cardio equip was well enough. There were free lockers, water and towel.

only problem was friday night \/ sat ... you could hear the music from the club in my room. I was able to sleep but my gf was unable to due to the noise. This was already warned to us at the check-in so we were already expecting it.

Also a little distant from the core of the strip but still at a decent location I think.

==Encore Las Vegas==
Located almost in the center of the Strip, this place is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. If you catch the deals on the right days, you will barely pay over $140 a night here and it's well worth it. The decor is just stunning in the lobby and in the rooms. The room is just jaw dropping as you enter and has a very warm modern look. The lights and drapes are all electronic with a push of a button, and the bed is REALLY comfortable. I want to buy the mattress!! There's a little living room with a small L shape couch and a table for workspace. The bedroom is divided with a small wall and a LCD TV sits there. You have spacious dressing drawers and the bathroom is very nice with an outside bathtub with a standing\/sit down shower WITH an almost rain forest type shower head! I saw "like" a rain forest type shower head :) Close enough. Everything is so spacious here, you and your lover will love it!

One tip is that you should get a map from the lobby so you know where everything is in the lobby. Many restaurants to choose from and it will help you know which way to exit to the closet bus stop if you're busing it down the strip. 

And btw: To the people lowering stars because they think the room is too small. Really? Who stays in the hotel room more than to just sleep anyways? VEGAS BABY - you should be at the night clubs and gambling the night away! . lol..

PROS::

1] Spacious enough! Do you expect to do a marathon around your room?
2] Remote control drapes and lights for the lazy
3] VERY VERY comfortable Bed
4] Decor has a very nice modern feel and appeal
5] Free WIFI.

CONS::

1] Hotel is huge, Get a map from the lobby :) Be smart

One word....AMAZING. This is the absolute BEST hotel in Las Vegas in my opinion. My friends and I just got back from Vegas for Labor Day Weekend. As soon as we got in (around 10pm) on a Thursday, we went straight to registration and Mitchell helped us out. He was an absolute doll! He helped us check in and provided us with OUTSTANDING customer service. Our check-in was a breeze. As soon as we stepped into our room we were in awe. It was all that we wanted and more! Bathroom was HUGE...enough mirrors in the place for all the girls to get ready. We loved how everything was remote controlled from the drapes to the lights. The bed was huge and so was the Sony t.v. It was LAVISH. We couldn't have asked for more. We went downstairs and enjoyed hummus and ba ba ganoush from their lobby bar. Kyle was our bartender and was very entertaining. He was another plus to our stay. We loved the pool! They have a d.j. and a nude pool in another area. We went to club XS on Friday night and it was off the hook! We LOVEEEEE that place. It wasn't my first time there so I already knew what I was getting into but after a night of drinking walking up to your hotel and passing out is the best! Seriously...you have to stay at Encore...it's worth every penny!  The ONLY bad thing I'd have to say about this hotel is that you aren't allowed to wear your bathing suit in the lobby area or throughout the hotel...one of our friends had to get escorted to the room! They are pretty strict about that and also about not wearing any shoes. Luckily I brought a pair of slippers in my clutch which I suggest EVERY girl to do so you aren't walking around barefoot on the nasty ground.

Wow! Everything they screwed up at the Wynn, they got right here. It's a little smaller and more intimate and it is just perfect. The red chandeliers are super sexy and everything just exudes style.

Stay here, play here, party here... but save up your money to do it.

When I received a call from my company's travel agent telling me that I'd be staying at The Nguyen this time, I said "cool, I love Vietnamese food."

As I entered Encore, I was seeing LOTS of red, and definitely got the sense of an Asian theme.  But, when I looked up and saw the word "Wynn" pop up, I was shocked! What, there's another way to spell Nguyen? I gotta run and tell all my Asian friends in Little Saigon...

So, 3 stars? I'm not hating on Encore, but I'm not really digging it either.  This review is for it as a hotel & casino to stay ONLY, as opposed to a certain attraction (like Wazuzu, XS, Lobby Bar & Cafe, etc.). Specifically, my thoughts on the room (that's what we all go to Vegas for, right? To stay in a room for hours...sarcasm, yes).

Likes:
-the layout and size of the suite
-you can leave the TV facing the bed, or spin it around to face the lounging area where the couches and desk are
-the control panel near the bed that operates the shutters, drapes, etc.
-hearing Steve Nguyen's, I mean Wynn's, voice when turning on the TV

Dislikes:
-while the room was nice, and the art was intriguing, the overall appearance was not too extravagant or distinguishable.  I felt it lacked the "it" factor
-that shower head sure starts off awfully hard and on blast every time!
-after being in my room for about 5 minutes, I noticed an unpleasant smell.  It was like the bionic, the blow, the bad, the buddha, the homegrown, scooby doo, backyard boogie, or whatever you want to call it.  I wondered where it was coming from, walked towards the adjoining door, and yep, it was the smell of weed from my neighbors.

Nice to know that I was staying at a real classy joint.  Pun unintended, actually.

We have stayed here twice now.  First time was seven years ago when Husband surprised me for my birthday with a few nights here.  The first room on that first stay had a soaking wet mattress, so we had to move, and our next room was just fine.  Beautiful!  But boy did I come down with a terrible virus and ended up sick in the suite for the duration of our stay. I will say I counted my blessings that if I had to be sick, at least it was somewhere really nice.

Fast forward to this October.  Had one night to kill, so I put on my bargain-hunting hat (yes deals can be had for this 5-star...seek and ye shall find!), and that's how we landed here again seven years later.  

This was our first time dealing with a car in Vegas, so do know there are two lots close by...one for the Wynn and one for the Encore.  We ended up at The Wynn one (oops), which meant we also found ourselves at the Wynn registration rather than the Encore.  Oops again!  No wonder it looked different than we remembered.  Luckily our check-in guy could not have been more friendly and helpful...didn't make us feel like the fools we were for checking in the wrong hotel.  Instead he gave us as high up as he could considering the deal we had gotten, and off we went through the Wynn to the Encore, lugging our luggage.  Our mistake, but it worked out just fine.

Likes:  Great security!  They check your room key every time at the elevators.  Room itself was the same suite elegance we had had seven years ago.  Showing slight signs of age, but still 5-star amenities. All the necessities supplied.  Bed was very comfortable.  Nice shower.  TV in the bathroom as well as the one that swivels between the bedroom and living room.  

Location is definitely North Strip...you get used to the long red carpet walkway through the casino and shops to get to the Venetian and beyond.  Restaurant choices are very expensive.  Casino is on the quiet side with high limits.  In other words, we went elsewhere to eat and play.

Dislikes:  Hate the resort fees that all the Vegas resorts charge.  Inevitable I know, but it makes a person feel ripped off.  All the hotels should up their rates, imho and do away with the stupid extra fees.  That being said, no one is hiding from it.  Go in knowing that fee is coming.

Speaking of fees...parking!  There were signs saying to pay inside before leaving the garage.  We did.  (I believe it was $15)...then lo and behold the lever was UP.  We didn't have to pay anything.  Wah...not fair!

high limit lounge has the best decor of all the casinos in vegas!!!!

slots are super lucky too... i love playing baccarrat and penny slots here!!!

and this place is home to my favorite club in las vegas! havn't stayed here yet, but i love to gamble here!

This is my 2nd stay at Encore in two years. The rooms are fantastic! 90 minute in-room deep tissue massage was pure luxury..very upscale hotel. Great people watching! Service was a little inconsistent in the restaurants and on the casino floor but this is a great place to stay!

I am totally impressed with my stay there!

What a top notch place to stay on the strip!

The pool n spa are incredible and you never want to leave!

So many restaurants and so much good food!

Love play slots on the floor, I seem to be lucky and win!

Great job to the entire staff!  Very personable and professional

If you like luxury & high class hotel service, this is the  BEST hotel in Vegas, but folks over 50 that want this without elbowing their way amongst massive throngs of 20-30 yr olds on Saturday nights may not be too happy. I can't give Encore 5 stars, although I wish I could.  The place has become a swarming sea of club hoppers, cruising back and forth between Wynn & Encore. (Think fish tank & schools of minnows everywhere). I wish Steve Wynn had thought of his baby boomer friends & guests, and built a cool Rat Pack club with llive Sinatra type music. LaCave seems like a perfect spot for it.  Also beware...if you don't want to hear the booming sound of the clubs all, and I mean all night long, ask for a room on an upper floor not facing inward above the pool & clubs.

This review is for the Encore Tower Suites, which is part of the Encore Resort. Basically it's a boutique hotel section of the larger hotel. The Tower Suites have some of the nicest, cleanest, most tasteful rooms I have ever experienced in Las Vegas. And the entire experience is great and relaxing. I actually enjoyed checking in. The Tower Suites has its own private valet drive up entrance "porte-coch√®re". The valet were super nice and courteous. Since you have to pay for parking (a new thing for Vegas) at least this valet experience is five star. They couldn't be nicer and it's quiet as it's only for the Tower Suites. The check in is in a small and beautifully decorated lobby, done in a calming and relaxing shade of jade green, rather than the vibrant red that is present in the rest of the hotel. It really feels like a boutique hotel even though you are in the middle of this immense property. The private entrance opens right into the casino behind glass doors. The reception at check in was fast, personal and so nice. They offer to show you to your suite if you desire. The view from the Las Vegas strip side is amazing. Everything is controlled electronically, including the lighting and the dramatic curtains that open to your view of the city. The bathroom is marble and gorgeous. Super "free" bathroom amenities include nice brushed steel handled toothbrushes and razors. It's all really well done and the only problem is you may not want to leave the room and enjoy the Tower's private pools or the adult pool at the Encore. You also have access to the Wynn hotel pools. Really cannot fault much. There is a turn down service included in the evening with Belgian chocolates. Room service breakfast was not spectacular for the price but it was very good. There is a "continental breakfast" offer for the Tower Suites but you will still be paying more if you order anything other than the bread, jam and coffee. I had an excellent eggs benedict. It is beautifully presented and the rooms are spacious with a fantastic view to enjoy your breakfast. Everything is new and clean. Really gorgeous. Treat yourself here once, in the Tower Suites; it's the best that I have seen in Las Vegas and beats many five star resort hotels for quality and service.

This place was everything I imagined it would be. Beautiful property both inside and out. 

I'm actually a Vegas local so decided to do a little Stay-Cation over Memorial Day weekend. The rates were high-ish ($400 a night or so all told) but you truly get what you pay for. The rooms are really amazing. We didn't have any upgrade or anything and the standard room is still the equivalent to a presidential suite at many chain hotels. 

From the brilliant 65" tv to the stunning view from the floor to ceiling windows to the automatic curtains and more, everything was great. 

I used the gym all 3 days. Huge facility with ample equipment even for the fitness enthusiast like myself. They provide complimentary fresh fruit which was really nice. 

The staff was great from check-in to the ice cream shop to the gym to check-out.  

Really can't say enough nice things about this property. Give it a shot for sure!

I thought this hotel was lovely. The decor is extreme with lots of drapery and tassels and fringe.

Red red. Nice casino floor layout. I especially like the west, east, north south bars.

 Check in was easy. I did notice at certain times of the day when the lobby was jammed with people all trying to check in at the same time. I also noticed during this time some upset clients. After observing, I saw that they were trying to upgrade their room or get better pricing. Visitors to Vegas have been trained to haggle. This just isn't the place to do it. 

The adult pool was nice. The service varied from day to day, one day there were many servers, and the next we had to self serve. It was obvious they were training and testing the services in this area. 

I will say if you want to enjoy Encore, be prepared to spend money. The spa, gambling, shows and tipping are a must. If you want to save money, go to Luxor or Mirage. Still nice, but not this nice!

I attended the opening ceremony and opening night of Encore.
The crowd waiting to enter encore at 8 PM for the grand unveiling was in a festive mood.
The crowd was festive even though the line to get in snaked through the entire Wynn.
The mood began to dimish as 8:15, 8:30, 8:45, 9PM started to roll around and the line had moved a grand total of 45 feet.
The employees of the Wynn spent the entire day promoting the 8PM start and invitation to experience the new hotel an casino.
Then they treated it like entrance to Tryst. 
Opening the line a few "guests" at a time so as to not impeded on the "total experience" of the Encore for all the others.

Please - - - it is another huge addition to the Vegas strip and there was nothing magical to it..........
The hotel is pleasing, the casino is very similar (obviously) to the Wynn-although there is a touch more red in the decor and the experience should be wonderful once the staff is on the par with the Wynn.

I do not think, as a whole,  there is an entire staff that can match the quality of the people that work in the Wynn.
Encore will get there .........  the place looks great.
Soon the quality of the staff will catch up as well.

By the way ...... The casino was very enjoyable about 2 AM on opening night ( or morning).

Great Hotel.  You definitely feel like you're stepping into a hotel with a Middle Eastern \/ Far Eastern flare.  Room was great, clean and the view from the 56th floor was spectacular.  

Only gripe was the long check in.  Encore could do something about how they check people in.  There were 4 people helping a line of 50+ people check in (our check took 45 minutes) and 7 people helping their elite customers (if you were elite, your check in was less than 5 minutes).  So being elite has it perks, especially in Vegas but I would have hoped they could have made the ratio of people checking guest in more proportional.  When I mentioned this to the front desk person, she upgraded us to a tower suite at no additional cost (a $60 value).  So the wait suddenly was a non issue.

Valet Parking - great.  Self parking very close so you can do either.  Slots paid out better than some other places I've been to on the strip.

Pool is great.  Fitness center is large.  Your room key doubles as a playing card.  

Great place.

Definitely my favorite hotel in Vegas.  I don't stay there every time I go to Vegas (as it can be pricy) but when I get the chance it's an absolute treat. The hotel inspires me and its amazing what a couple days there can do to uplift me!

AMAZING HOTEL.  AMAZING SERVICE.  BEAUTIFUL BEYOND BELIEF.
I can't wait to go back to Vegas just to stay at The Encore.

i've been spoilt. it's gonna be hard staying anywhere else on the Strip.  the casino is very sexy - dig the red motif.  the service was excellent, the employees at the craps table were very fun and lively, and the "free" drinks were stiff.  my room was off the hook. while the rooms at the Palazzo are a bigger, the "suites" here are still quite large and are definitely a touch above Palazzo\/Venetian.  The floor to ceiling windows meant the pre-party in our room was so good that we almost didn't even make it XS downstairs (almost, but we finally did).  i'm definitely goin back.

This was my favorite place to stay in Vegas.  Now most of the time I'm at a rented house or off the strip.  However, I was here for a specific meeting\/event and had Impeccable service and ate many of my meals on the property.  The food at every restaurant I ate at was terrific and the staff were really attentive.  Having used the meeting spaces I think my experience was a little different from the typical "what-happens-in-Vegas-stays-in-Vegas" crowd, but if you are looking for a nice pampering place to stay, I'd say Encore is a nice option!

I've always been a fan of the Wynn Towers and stayed at the Wynn back in 2008 with my husband. Since then, I've tried other hotels and fell in love with Mandarin Oriental so I never felt the need to stay anywhere else. However, my girlfriends from MA were visiting Vegas and their timeshare was near the Wynn, so I took it as an opportunity for me to try out Encore.

I was not disappointed, in fact, I signed up for the Wynn's Insider club because I was impressed. However, it lost a star because of certain things that irked me, but don't get me wrong, this is worth 5 stars, to each their own, right?

Here are the pros of this place:
-beautiful place
-beautiful decor
-casino doesn't have loud, obnoxious people...all the time
-you can't smell smoke in the hallways and the shopping areas
-lots of shops, bars, restaurants to choose from
-connection to the Wynn for more dining options
-nightclubs and different pools to choose from
-room service is top notch and very fast
-great service
-bell guys are very friendly
-everything looks pristine
-personalized name on your room key
-check out was a breeze

CONS:
-to upgrade to a higher floor than the 30th floor, you'd pay $30 a night (this is important if you don't want to hear the noise from the nightclubs every night)
-WIFI is only allowed for 2 devices
-valet defeats the purpose when you still have to walk to the valet area and then have them pull your car out 10 feet
-the noise all hours of the night if you're not on a higher floor and even on the 50th floor, you can still hear it
-the walls are paper thin, I can hear my neighbor flush his toilet and brush his teeth while I'm trying to sleep
-the lobby bar wreaked of smoke, which means if you're staying there and walking by there to get to the elevators, you're inhaling a lot of smoke.
-far from the strip
-view from our windows were great on the left side where it shows a bit of the strip and their golf course, but on the right, it was just dirt. Not worth it to get a view of the strip, I should have gotten view of the golf course. 

So that's how I felt about it overall. Would I stay here again? Probably, and would recommend anyone who wants to stay at a nice place without needing to go on the strip everyday.

I've stayed at Encore twice now, and it's a lovely high-end hotel. The rooms are comfortable with simple yet posh decor. The spa is one of my favorites along with Qua at Ceasar's Palace. The citrus\/fruit water and teas at the spa are delicious. While I loved the spa, I must say the gym was so-so. Much of the weight equipment is outdated, so that was a bit of a bummer. I do most of my gambling at The Venetian so it's a toss up at which one I'll stay at next time. I only wish Encore wasn't such a far walk from the other hotels I like to visit.
One of the most beautiful hotels in Las Vegas. Spacious rooms and excellent accommodations. Really really love this place.
Beds are horrible!!! They need to start swapping out the mattresses from opening day!!everything else was great. But for good night sleep. Don't think so.
Such a beautiful hotel! Never a dull moment. They have shopping, pools, clubs, fine dinning, workout facilities, and relaxation treatments\/spa. Luxury at it's finest!

One of my favorite hotels in Las Vegas.  Five star property. Hotel rooms are suites. They always give you full amenities including bedroom slippers. Great customer service. Great food and bars.  Drink service is always good when playing table games or slot machines. It almost, almost, makes it painless to lose.

It's not as decked out as the Venetian, BUT I love how clean and straight forward the hotel was. Very easy to navigate. The casino area was more family friendly than other hotels because of lighting, friendly staff, and how guests carried themselves. Of course there was the occasional guest that dropped F-bombs in front of my little sister during elevator rides, but hey I didn't raise them. lol It's still a fairly new hotel, so the carpets and floors don't smell too heavily of smoke. 

The rooms are clean. (We stayed on a non-smoking floor. Ususally there is still a certain stench, but to my surprise the Encore was true to their word! Smoke-free = smoke-free!) The hotel is still young. Couchs are still firm, as well as the beds and pillows. Even the roll-in bed was comfortable!! The toilet is awkwardly high, but it didn't pose a problem. I wished the bathroom was like the Ritz where the toilet was separated by a door from the shower\/sink area. We had a spectacular view of the strip (which we had to pay more for, but that's not a problem). 

I will definitely be back!

Recently we stayed at the Encore for our first visit back to the Vegas area in about 12 years.  We were pleased BEYOND our expectations of the room, pools, restaurants and grounds. Special kudos goes out to their dinner buffet as the vast variety certainly did not impact the quality.  We were less pleased with the amount of "play time" seen in both the Wynn and Encore casinos, but that's gambling!  

The suite with it's ceiling to floor glass looking over the strip and golf course provided outstanding views 24 hours a day.  The large marble bathroom and extensive seating area gave the room that overly large feeling.  As a person who travels extensively for business, it certainly was a pleasure to be in a room that didn't fit the cookie cutter mold of most hotel chains.  It was a bit loud when the Beach Club was thumping away beginning on Thursday afternoon, but it still didn't damper our experience.

We got great rates on the room as this trip was planned well in advance, allowing us to take advantage of the 60+ days notice.  Plans are already in the works to revisit Vegas in another year and the Wynn\/Encore has already been selected as our destination.

OK, the hotel is wonderful. The food and restaurants are great. Too old for the clubs! My problem is that the staff only comes in two varieties - extremely friendly and helpful or arrogant and rude. At this level, everyone should be happy clients are in their hotel. 

Many have talked about the resort fee - it sucks. You get nothing for $28 per each day of your stay. It is going to be a class action law suit someday soon. It is so obviously a gimmick. Everyone complained about this concept and penalty. 

For gamblers, I can warn you that each of the casino hosts gives you different info. One tells you that you need to earn 3000 points each day to get your room comped, while others tell you it is 5,000 points. The Caesar's Total Reward is much better for those who do heavy gambling. 

I won't be coming back to a Wynn property - I was there on opening week at Bellagio because I had so much confidence in Steve Wynn, but things have changed. Too bad for everyone. Lastly, I was comped for rooms, but was short changed on food and other charges based on how much I ran though the slots. Yes, if they had given me what I felt I deserved, I would have not left with such a poor taste in my mouth. The person who took care of my comps was the one who insisted that the comp rate was 5,000 points per day, instead of the 3,000 points like I was first quoted by another casino host - please get your stories together!

Great Hotel!! 
We got upgraded from the Wynn.  We were all very happy with our stay.  3 nights four days.  Included breakfast \/ brunch buffet.  
Room was clean and spacious.  
Great views from our room.

I don't even know where to start...I was very excited to come to Las Vegas to see the new Encore....We checked in at 3pm and didn't get our room till 5ish. so when i got to our room first i found out i got one king bed, when i clearly requested for two queens a month ago, and i also reminded them when i was there. i went downstairs to see what was going on an they told me there will be no more queens beds the whole week that i am going to be here for. so i was like so i book 1month ahead of time saying that i wanted to queen n i get 1 king bed. what the hell is that all about. although i know my room was free but i did have to pay for one night for it. she told me in her system that  it  show only have one paying adult on there not four. but i clearly said i wanted two queens bed so wouldn't that mean anything. To make it better, the registration desk girl was the biggest bitch ever. She said "a request is just a request," we never promised anything. No apology, just attitude!!
At 7pm the other half of our party checked in (couples) and they got 2 beds each. T  read more ¬ªhey were told that is all that is available.
i was so piss that i was like forget it i am done with this place. 

if you want to read more go Read Jen j. & Maria j we were all there

the rooms are great, even though each room is exactly the same no matter the price ir floor or anything else for that matter. the rooms are clean, nice decor, and you dont have to clorox wipe the entire room. 
room service on the other hand is a must SKIP, way too expensive. ordered 2 continental breakfasts which included 2 fruit plates,  2 muffins and 4 cups of coffee $80- ridiculous!
we then ordered a sorbee with was nasty, their chcolate shakes are ok, but still way too expensive.
and dont try to move their stuff from the fridge to put your own, they will charge you. you could have them bring up a seperate mini fridge for your stuff, but its $25 per day.
the bottom line is, you either choose a clean uber expensive hotel, or an old hotel like Caeser's Palace where there are nasty spots all over the floor and furniture and even the bedsheets.

Stayed here this past weekend and had a great time. I went to Vegas but only once left the hotel (somehow I ended up on the strip outside the wynn after a night of hard partying...still no idea how that happened). Our daily routine was order lunch via room service at 3pm (waking time) then champagne, then champagne again then have the minibar restocked from the previous nights damage....and  proceed to clean it out again. Around 10-11ish we would leave the room to go to XS and around 4am we would hit the tables. Would have been nice to see more (any) of vegas but we had a great time...until we got the room bill. Our hotel room fee was $700 and room service was $800...we didnt feel so big anymore....we transformed from rock stars to nervous teens who had crashed the family car.
anyway if you choose to go down the same path we did - get the burger sliders (they are ground beef at its finest) with perfect onion strings, also every bottle of champagne was delish and im sure if you want to save some money (in retrospect, always a good idea) you probably wouldnt be able to differentiate the champagne from the sparkling wine. oh, and they have a room service "happy hour" with corona's $5 each and some of the food for $10 a plate which is not bad compared to the regular price, trust me...

I love the layout of the room, and how the sofas are actually REALLY comfortable to sleep on! Their spa\/fitness level is so luxurious as well, and staff throughout the hotel is very hospitable. Toiletries are nice (Bambu), however I found their late night room service options to be lacking and the wait time is ridiculous (1 hour+).

Stayed here 3 nights. Checking in was a breeze and the service was great. I was expecting the room to be a little bigger, but overall it was nice.  I forgot my contact lens solution and toothbrush and they brought it up to my room immediately. A couple days later I decided to recheck my hotel bill and saw a mistake, I called them an they fixed it.

Sharon was working as the "boss" of the blackjack area where we were playing this evening. I have NEVER encountered a more disrespectful woman. When my wife accidentally gave her my red card - she became very rude and a gave my wife a very difficult time. After the money we have spent\/gambled this evening - I felt it was especially uncalled for.
Lovely place to stay! Food, shopping ,ambience you name it  they've got it pegged . So come see for yourself! I guarantee you'll be back

The wife and I just returned from the Encore, and I have to say it was a tremendous experience, all the way.

The hotel itself is gorgeous, draped in various shades of red, everywhere.  And one of the yelpers mentioned the downbeat chill music....very nice touch, it added quite a bit to the experience.

And for a casino, not too smoky.........very elegant.

Everywhere we went within the hotel, we found employees willing to help, even in small ways.   The hotel staff seemed eager to please.

And I must confess that I might have raided a maid's cart for a few extra bars of the most sublime, amazing soap I have ever used...it's lemongrass scent was freaking money.  I left behind a few bucks, so it was an even trade.   Damn....that soap was good enough to eat.

Three free nights at this place?  Very nice indeed.  I hope they invite us back......

Service: 3S
Rooms: 4S

We've stayed here a few times and this is the first time that I've had a problem.  We checked into the room and settled in. Hung up our clothes, put our belongings where they belong. Mixed ourselves a drink. No problem so far.

I decided the jump into the pool for a swim, wait a minute I meant sit on the couch. Yes, the couch was wet as if it was a swimming pool.  I immediately call the front desk and they apologized and said that they just finished cleaning the room and the couch was dry and they didn't fully dry it yet.  The asked if I wanted to be moved to a different room.  Excuse me? If you knew this, then maybe you should've gave us another room to begin with?  

I informed them that we are all already settled in and I suggest that they just bring two couch cushions  from another room and simply swap it.  They said they couldn't do that.  They will send room service with towels to dry the couch.  15 mins later, room service came with towels and some crazy loud fan to dry to couch.  I expressed my disappointment.  The cleaning guy said he will try to get two couch cushions and swap it for us, sounds like an idea that I heard somewhere before.

I tipped the guy for swapping my couch cushions.  I am utterly disappointed in Encore staff for failing so many ways.  I expect this from Imperial Palace or even Harrahs, not Encore. Shame on you. Probably the last time I stay at Encore, back to Cosmo.

For the boyfriend's birthday, we decided to go big and try out the Encore.
Really glad we did.

The room was beautiful. The bed was big, plush, and lush, sleeping was a dream. I really liked the mirror walls, made getting dressed so much easier. The living room area was cute. Loved the modern couch. 

The view from the window couldn't have been better. Over looked the strip, we did not even request this.

The bathroom was great! Loved the double sinks, the zoom mirror and the tv I could watch from the tub. 

Boyfriend's favorite part, the remote control next to the bed that controlled everything.

Cannot wait to return, and really want to try the Wynn as well!

best vegas trip evvaaarrrr!!

first off, the bribe thing at reception worked. best $50 spent all trip. thanks buddy! started off w\/ a single, but was upgraded to 2 queen beds, 1 roll away, 1 fridge, and an awesome, and i mean, AWESOME view of the strip.  the room was absolutely amazing. we had a freakin doorbell, a door bell! the decor of the room was very nice as well. had some interesting art work.. but everything else was pimp. we went to the club at encore sat night, xs. lets just say, if you're a group of single guys (or girls), having a room right upstairs from the club is a big PLUS.

the last few times i've been to vegas i've stayed at the palazzo across the street.  tho they are comparable in opulence, i think encore is gonna b my new hotel 'spot' for the next few years.

btw, the hotels proximity to the mall & walgreens is a big plus.

all in all, an absolutely beautiful casino\/hotel. definitely recommend to anyone going to vegas. jus one thing tho, i wish they had thicker walls cause we had security come to room a couple times sat night around 4am because of noise complaints... i mean, we were just yellin "woo boys!"... swearz :)

Stayed @ Encore this past  Memorial Day weekend for 4 Nights.. Sealed the deal with three girls in this room, they agreed the rooms here are mint.. My room was on the 59th floor with Panoramic Views of the Strip. Got a sick deal off Travelzoo.com, my best friends each were in the far more expensive tower suites.. One has more money than god(were talking dropping 5000 grand on slots\/losing 50k for the weekend), his room could sleep 8plus people but wasnt that much better than the 250(regularly 500plus) a night room I stayed in.One of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in, especially considering how cheap it was. Definitely reaping the benefits of this recession.

The decor of the room was top notchj, lots of marble\/granite, most of the colors in the suites were of red, white and black tones. All the Jacky chans seem to love the Wynn & Encore, they must dig the lucky red coloring..Huge but oddly situated plasma sat in the middle of the room that swiveled when you needed to watch it from either the bed or the couch. Bed was a dream, perfect to sleep on as well as pound some broads head into a pillow as you lay the root.

Some nice personal touches, include being able to hit one button and turning off the TV,all the lights,shades and other various things all at once as you fall asleep, truly came in handy after I pounded my cheeseburger from room service and was too drunk to stuble around the room to flick off switches. The Bathroom was bigger than most hotel rooms, it had a TV to watch as you disinfect and try to clean the bodily fluids off the animal prostitue you just slayed.. The tub was a monster and the steam shower was great. Also nice that the toilet is in its own separate room inside the bathroom, even had a phone conveniently located next to the toilet. Perfect for giving your mom a ring as you drop the Cosby Kids off at the pool. 

Room Service was sick here.. Amazing food.. Being a Native NYer I am impressed with just how good the chicken salad, wraps and desserts were.. Semi Pricey but fair in my opinion considering the quality, portion size and service that comes with it. Highly recommend ordering while staying at the hotel. Just about everything on the menu is good. WIll run you a solid 60 bucks for two people.

The pool at Encore isnt anything special, not much talent, lots of washed out cougars, old guys with gold watches & there bought Dime pieces.. Most of my friends went to the Wynn's pool instead and I personally just hit up Wet Republic each day...

The downsides to this hotel are its at the South End of the Strip, most cab rides run a minimum of 10-20 to get anywhere decent. Unlike the Hotel at Mandalay Bay there is no Starbucks in the lobby, no day time pool party and this place could almost be too luxorious\/pretentious for some hard partying animals like myself. No cheap food around either for when you just want to grab a quick sandwich or slice of pizza.. For that Id walk across the street to the mall to get your coffee or junkfood fix...

My complaints are small and this is one of the best places to stay in Vegas. For the hard partying types like myself its a toss up, definitely gentlemanly  and classy. Will be staying here again.

My first stay at the Encore during Veteran's Day Weekend significantly raised the bar and set the new standard for hotel-ing in Vegas. After years of enjoying the swankiness of Aria, I was ready for a new change of pace and Encore was everything I expected.

Rooms - 5 stars all the way. 
Spacious, lovely decor, great view of the Wynn and TI facing the strip southward, enormous bathroom, and state-of-the-art amenities all around.... all this for the basic run-of-the-mill suite. If you're traveling with others, I recommend asking for conjoining rooms to enhance the size. The beds feel as if you're sleeping in a cloud. Comfort and elegance are the forefront of their design here.

Casino\/Gaming - 4 stars 
Never crowded, always clean, attentive cocktail waitresses, friendly pit crew and a plethora of games including War. Heads up though, the bars with Video Poker do not comp, I found this out after already donating my $20.

Dining - 5 stars
We only actually ate at the Lobby Bar but were very pleased with the breakfast we ordered, attentiveness of the staff and cozy setting. Sinatra and Costa di Mare are both on my immediate hit list to try out next time.

Check-in\/Check-out\/Front Desk - 5 stars
Staff was great on all fronts. The check-in line was speedy and the front desk was great about resolving an issue I had with a dispute. I don't recommend trying a $20 or $50 sand which here as I've heard it's frowned upon. That said, being polite and asking about better options doesn't hurt. 

Bottom line: at this price, I'd stay here again in a heart beat over others. Only gripe to walk away with is that it's at the North end of the strip and a bit of a walk. That said, the Valet pool has a designated Uber\/Lyft pick-up which was less than $10 to get us near the Mlife side of the strip.

I don't know what you heard about me 
But she can't get a dollar out of me 
No Cadillac, no perms you can't see
That I'm a  P-I-M-P
                                               -50 Cent.

The day after we got married we took a quick escape to Vegas and was thrilled to stay at Encore.  We've stayed at Venetian and Palazzo which we still love but the rooms here just make you feel like a dirty ass PIMP!

This hotel just makes you feel sexy.  From the music pumped into the Casino to the red decor in the lobby.  The hallway decor leading up to your room are so chic I wouldn't mind it if I got locked out of the room and slept in the hallway.  It's that good.

These are the differing qualities of the rooms here that make Encore stand out:

1. Doorbell! 
2. Centralized lighting, do not disturb notification and roman curtain control at your fingertips (on the nightstand).
3. Very posh beds and decor.
4. ihome station for your ipod or iphone.

If I could make a few changes I would take the spaciousness and  the number of TVs (there were only 2 TVs - the bedroom unit swivels to the separate living area) of the Venetian\/Palazzo rooms.  

Oh, and if you are staying during the weekend and if you for some wacky reason would like to get some sleep be aware of which side and floor of the hotel you are staying....XS goes until 4:30 am.

Until next time Encore.

By far by far my favorite hotel in Vegas. Ive stayed mostly in Venetian, Bellagio, and Aria. Decided to give this hotel a chance. Im glad I did. I've always had the impression as Vegas being so crowded and just over populated. This hotel totally delivered and totally a game changer in every possible way.  From the decor, organizations,  cleanliness, pools, and most importantly staff and service. Encore definitely knows how to make their guest feel at home. We were greeted by this genuine and charismatic front desk Nina who made us feel comfortable right away. She was very helpful,knowledgeable and funny. She gave us the different "expecations" of room placement according to the floors. So no surprises with views etc. Which we really appreciate.  We got to our room and its exactly what she have mentioned.  Lets talk about the room. Clean, classic , and contemporary with touch of modern technology and edgy look. Spacious and everything you need is there.  Were here for birthday celebration and we got back to our room later that night with a little birthday gift box. Of course from our friend Nina from the front desk. 
Next up pool. Love love the pool as it has intimate and boutique feel unlike this crazy massive pool in other hotels and can be filled up with so much people. We got there Saturday early am to get good tanning bed spots. Later that day the term "busy" is not shoulder to shoulder annoying experience.  Definitely has quality control.  Certainly a plus. Lets talk about service : EVERY little detail that we needed, encore has it and any issues they have promptly responded in the right time. Even housekeeping are all friendly here which is foreign in this type of large hotels.  We got back to our room that night and the turned down service made you feel like you are at a resort.  The housekeeping did a good job and was very detailed cleaning the room.  We had to made sure to make a phone call to let them know how happy we are with the service and of course leave a tip.  Veronica B is the name of our housekeeper. :) Stayed in 19th floor.  Overall experience was well executed and Encore definitely changed my view and perception about Vegas. Also my first time, not leaving the hotel at all through out my stay. Thank you Encore for a great experience.  Please keep this up!!!!! Will definitely come back here. Recommend to my friends and family.   the only last thing is I wished I couldve gotten some benefits from the Red card. Didnt know the benefits only good during your current stay.
-Fitz A.

This place has gone downhill with its level of service. Rooms and location are great, the Wynn \/ Encore is obviously a great property with great restaurants and venues, but this place is consistently understaffed. Wait 30 minutes in line to check in at the hotel. Wait another 20 minutes in line at the concierge to get your boarding pass (hotel kiosks were not working), wait 15 minutes at taxi line because there is only 1 guy working the taxi stand (plenty of cabs, guy just only loaded up one cab at a time AND gave me lip when I asked him why he wasn't moving up 2 cabs at a time for loading). 

In short, you'll have a good night but have a good shot of going postal by the time you leave.
Just love Hermes Store here lol

First off, I will say the hotel looks fabulous. The decor is amazing and it's connected to the Wynn with the La Reve show that you just cannot pass up. Unfortunately, my 2 stars only count for those two things. 

The party that I was with booked our flights and hotel through Expedia for convenience and price. We specifically picked the 2 queen beds which was more expensive on our Expedia reservation. When we checked in, the hotel said they could only give us the 1 king bed room. They said that Expedia only sent them the 1 king bed reservation and not a 2 queen bed room. But they would be able to give us a 2 queen bed room for an extra $50 a night. Fine that's fair. But we showed them the itinerary because we have proof that we PAID for that size room. Most hotels would give it to you because you have proof of confirmation. The front desk receptionist then pointed out that it's subject to availability. Well duh! You have it available, but still want $50 dollars??? That's BS. We also talked to the manager and refused to do anything about it until we called Expedia. So we called and had them talk to the front desk, and then the mgr agreed to give us the room, still charge us the additional money, but told us to have expedia call their accounting dept. It really wasn't that simple. 3 phone calls later and still nothing. Hoping they keep their word and will give us the credit back. When we checked out, I noticed there were many other ppl with very unhappy faces and a mile of complaints. I know ppl love to complain, but damn, that many ppl??

Other than that, the room had a wonderful view, bed and pillows were comfy, big bathroom (only housekeeping wouldn't refill shampoo and conditioner unless we asked), pool was great (there's a European pool too i.e. topless), XS nightclub (must check it out, expect a long line unless you know someone at the door).

However, I feel like I could've gotten those things at a different hotel. Next time, I'll spend my money elsewhere.

This Fabulous uber posh resort casino oasis is by far my favorite place in all of Vegas! I was lucky enough to stay in the tower suite on my last visit which is a five star hotel within a five star hotel (very exclusive)and I felt like I was living the life style of the rich and famous! Around every corner is world class dinning and beverages. Sinatra was tasty btw! Lastly my absolute favorite thing was the gorgeous fresh flower every were you turn! I actually had flower crowns made for me and my friends while I was there and they did not disappoint! Shout out to Fred Reyes who made my beautiful flower crowns that would make any coachella goer jealous! Worth every penny!!
Beautiul hotel or the north end of the strip.  All the luxuries you need spa, restaurants and pools.  Not to mention clubs and casino

Place is terrible.. The only good thing is decor. Stayed in resort suite that reeked like a sewer. They offered to move our room on the last night as if we wanted to pack up everything and move... We wanted to not be put in a room with nauseating smell from the toilet and shower, but don't worry I puked anyway from some gross food I had here. They had an excuse for everything.. Absolutely terrible

I've been to Vegas a couple times and usually stay at the Signature Suites at MGM. We decided to try something different and went with the Encore Suites for our 4 nights. I'm sure glad we did! This hotel is absolutely beautiful!!! Our room was amazing and I loved the floor to ceiling windows with a great view of the Vegas strip! The bathroom was large enough for 3 girls to get ready. The bed was huge and cozy. 
Service at check in and check out was exceptional. And the lady at the concierge desk was so nice and helpful. I definitely will be staying here from now on.
It's a beautiful hotel and the rooms are very nice. I'm so lucky to be able to stay at Encore. I really enjoy our view and it's the cleanest. I hope I can go back soon!

GGGGGRRRREEEEAAATTTT Hotel! I love this place. Very chic European feel. You better be ready to spend a pretty penny because everything is expensive here. The Wynn and Encore are linked together, but the Encore is more updated. The casino is beautiful, the architecture, the accessories. The pool has a French Riviera feel. There is a family type pool at the Wynn but the Encore is more for adults. They also have a European pool that is 21 and up that is topless. Concierge was very accommodating and made you feel like you were VIP! Love that. The people are hip and it was very exciting. The Beach Club pool party is off the hook on Sunday as well as Club XS being the hottest club in Vegas. Great hip loungy house music throughout the hotel. I loved it!

Our king suite was off the hook. Living room with separate sleeping area (360 degree swivel flat screen). Executive desk and chair area. Sick ass bathroom with separate tub and seating shower (another flat sceen in there). Full of glass and mirrors! Luxury at its best. We got a special deal to stay and see the show "La Reve." Look out for their offers. Again, be ready to spend a lot of money. If you don't want to spend soooo much, head over to the next block to the little strip mall. They have a liquor store, mexican food, pizza, etc. Check out my pictures!

Amazing hotel, very beautiful room, everything was wonderful. Only complaint is that the hotel isn't very well ventilated so it reeks like cigarette smoke and it's also very far from the main strip. Next time I would like to be closer. Would recommend is you don't mind cigarette smoke and walking a lot.

Amazingly fun!! Can't wait to go back! Fun atmosphere, great party!!! 
The staff was fantastic. The vibe was amazing! We met people from allover the world.
The daybeds were conformable. We had a blast!

This hotel is amazing to walk through and look at everything. I give it one star less than the Wynn because it does not have a free show like the lake of dreams at Wynn. It has a butterfly theme with butterfly Mosaic tiles in the marble floors. The casino is beautiful with the lighting fixtures and the sports area has pool tables and shuffleboard and you can watch the games in big screen TVs. Swimming pools and gardens are beautiful and the glass is antiglare so you can see it when it's really bright outside or dark at night from the inside. All of the restaurants and shops are super expensive.

Please see my other review, this is just some things I forgot on the other review

Quick adds: to check in there are several lines so don't get stuck on the first long line that everyone is on. 

2- be careful at the mini bar, you will be charged if the items is not placed back right away and the same way it came out

3- to check out you can have them email you a summary of room so you don't have to wait in line to check out. 

4- bath water runs blue so don't be afraid

5- bring slippers, the marble gets slippery when wet

6- room has Ihome so you can bring your Ipod

check out the video of the room on my you tube page

http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/triplefunlimited
Great service! Friendly staff! Happy people!  And the suites are gorgeous! It made my trip to EDC 2014 super comfy:) and live their late check out at 8 pm :)

Quite simply the nicest hotel in Las Vegas.  Attentive staff, super clean rooms and common area.  Once there, you don't need to leave the property.  Outstanding oasis with all the bells and whistles.  THE place in Vegas.

Amazing!
I came to this hotel with my family with high expectations and all of them were reached and more! The hotel itself is beautiful with pretty butterflies, etc. The resteraunts are amazing with great food and its very classy! Brilliant decor. And the rooms... Most hotel rooms are boring and plain but this one was very cool and cute! The long black couches were a fantastic touch. Go here! Great view from our hotel room... And its connected to the Wynn so there are a lot of shops and huge casinos. Service was also awesome.. Not to mention amazing room service! Would love to come back!

The rooms were 4 star as was the service, attentive but not too intrusive.  I was troubled by the boisterous people at nearly every place I went.  One morning when I got up in the morning early for a quiet breakfast before a meeting i encountered a person being mirandized by the police in the lobby bar.  At breakfast i was the only one who had been to bed as far as i could tell. 

 Another time a group of people doing shots of vodka in one of the main restaurants distrubing nearly everyone around them.   Maybe this is Vegas.  Also there was no place to have a quiet decent drink; the piano bar opened way too late and the smoke at one point slipped into my room (I believe people were smoking on my non-smoking floor).

Finally the checkin was a mess; i don't expect to wait 45 mins in a top flight hotel to check in. The excuse I got was 'they have 2000 rooms and everyone comes at the same time'.  I said if it is that predictable then they need to redesign the whole process.

Very nice. Everything you need in one spot.  A great party and great shopping, that's really what you go to Vegas for right? Stay there you will love it. Not the best hotel I have ever stayed at, but very good. Btw room service is off the hook
