I really enjoy this hotel mainly because of the rooms. I feel their layout and decor is modem and classic with lots of space. A standard room here feels bigger than the one you get at the Wynn. While I like the rooms here, I prefer to stay at the Wynn because it is closer to all the action of the hotel.

We stay here every visit to Vegas. We tried Bellagio once and you can tell it has lost the Wynn touch. This hotel is the place to stay in Vegas and keeps in line with high end boutique hotels across the country despite its size and location. The service here so impeccable, and that is what makes it great. Steve Wynn tells his employees that "people make people happy." They do, indeed. The selection of restaurants is fantastic as well. Costa Di Mare deserves a review of its own. Try the spa, I can hardly tear myself away. When you visit Vegas and stay here, there really isn't much reason to leave the property. We stayed at the tower suites on a recent trip and found it worth the extra money, if for the lobby alone, which is incredibly convenient to meet with a larger group and as a place to chill and plan for the day. The nicest thing about this hotel, aside from its sheer elegance, is that the staff genuinely cares about the hotel and your input on their performance, which was evident when the checkout staff insisted on a detailed explanation when I gave a less than enthusiastic review of my last stay due to one small blip in service experienced in another part of the hotel. I must stress that this error was rectified.

I'm a fan of Wynn\/Encore but had mixed results this trip. 
Insufficient bell staff on duty at check in. I am not a fan of rolling bags through casinos, degrades the resort experience.
Marijuana cigarette left behind by previous guest in our suite that was missed by the housekeeping department. 
Slot machines went haywire and had a lengthy wait for hand pay. 
We will be back but these issues really stand out, especially at a great place like the Wynn where issues like these never happen.

The Encore is our favorite place to stay and play in Las Vegas. This place really puts the rest of the strip to shame. And if you do get tired of the Encore, the Wynn and the Palazzo are all you need to add some variety. The buffet was the best I've been to, and their cafe has an amazing pumpkin cheesecake. The pool was beautiful and the Eastside lounge is a great place to have a smoke.

Can I get an encore I said do you want more? Why yes yes I do! But seriously from check in until check out this is by far the best stay I've had in Vegas. 

We arrived late Friday night probably around 10pm and we took advantage of valet parking. I've been inside Encore quite a few times between XS and Encore beach club. Anyway check in was a breeze! I've stayed at other hotels on the strip and waited up to an hour to check in because the line was so long. 

At check in they provided us with tons of options for rooms to upgrade to. We decided to stick with what we booked just two rooms next to each other since there was four of us. Great thing about Encore is that all the rooms are suites. The rooms were well kept and spacious. The beds are even more comfortable. 

Also the bathrooms were great double sinks which is always a good thing for us girls. The tub separate from the shower and deep which is perfect after a long night out. I must say it was definitely enjoyable. 

Not to mention you can pretty much control the room from the comfort of the bed. Whether you want to control the temperature or turn the lights off you can do so. I really like the fact that the control panels allow you to charge your phone so it's not in outlet clear across the other side of the room. 

We plan on staying here again once summer comes. Encore is definitely a win. From the customer service, the food, and the room it's an overall win.

This is a top notch hotel that separates itself in every way from the other resorts. The only comparable property in my mind is Aria and it's still not nearly as good as Encore. The rooms are clean, quiet and the service is excellent 24\/7. From the moment you walk in the door the atmosphere just feels different. It doesn't smell of smoke or make you feel like you have to keep an eye on your bags. The dealers are friendly, easy to talk to and make good conversation. Also, a very underrated quality, they are good about explaining the rules of the game. Every property has nuances to games like three card poker, ultimate hold em, etc. The dealers are always willing to help with no eye rolls or sighs. If I have my choice I will always be staying at the Encore in the future.

What can i say about the encore, its a beautiful venue, the details to the place are amazing, with butterfly accents, and contemporary chic feel. 
Now let's talk about the service, its a hit or miss here you will get someone who is very helpful and accomdating, or you'll get a stuck up bitach!
Booked a lovely king suite, and I can say that it was like a dream, the beds are amazing the bathroom with the t.v., the personalized greeting can a gal ask for anymore???? I'm comming back here for sure because lifes good when your staying at the encore!

The best thing about this hotel is the beds. They are amazing - I think the Wynn has their own brand of mattress and they have perfected it.

So why not a 5? or the 2 I was planning on giving the hotel after my stay?

I booked the hotel through Travelocity - it was a very nice room at $1,300 a night and it was to include WiFi and Breakfast.  

Upon check in I was told that I could have a $30 voucher towards in-room dining breakfast. Having stayed at the Wynn many times, and in Las Vegas at comparable hotels about 100 times over the years, and not being born yesterday, I know for a fact that a pot of coffee in in-room dining is close to $10, oatmeal runs at about $30. Toast and eggs are at least $25 for one person. Plus gratuity, delivery fee, tax, etc. So I told them that breakfast was included for two in the booking not discounted. Jee, who was checking me in, argued that I could order breakfast up to $30 for two people, and spoke to me like I was a gullible fool. So I asked for the manager. After speaking to the manager Jo, they did me a massive favor and gave me a $60 discount towards my "included" breakfast. Breakfast consisted of oatmeal, toast, a croissant and coffee and came to over $100 each of the 3 days of our stay. I was also told my "free" WiFi that was also part of our booking rate would be charged if we logged in on more than 2 devices. It's 2016. Some of us EACH have a phone and a laptop or iPad that need WiFi, so 2 devices per room is a joke. 

One evening I was about to enter the Tower from the casino, and my daughter distracted me with a quick question. We were close to the entrance but not blocking the entrance. After 30 seconds, a security guard literally shooed me away telling me I can't stand so close to the Tower entrance.

The air quality was not good. The room smells of smoke that comes through the vents.

I completed a survey at the end of my stay and the reason my review is a 3 and not a 2 is because I was contacted immediately and they refunded the money they had charged for the breakfast after I explained that, at ~$1,300 a night, it is not the $30 that I cared about. It is the principal - that an establishment like the Wynn\/ Encore would try and nickle and dime me like that - as if they are desperate for the extra $30, that they included as part of the package and then wanted to go back on their agreement.

In my opinion, I should not have been placed in a position to have to fight for what was agreed upon in the reservation in the first place.

We stayed here February 2009 and absolutely were in love. The last trip we took (a few weeks ago), we chose the Cosmopolitan (had to, it was the newest on the Strip!) but realize that as much as the Cosmo was awesome, Encore rocks it more. 

The lobby bar is my favorite place to hang, the bartenders are so cool, the servers are fast and efficient. 

The shopping is beautiful (way $$$, but window shopping is nice), and the restaurant choices are amazing). 

We saw La Reve (wowee), and ate at Switch for the night. The last trip we went to all of the restaurant during our 4 night stay....

The rooms are huge, modern, clean, spacious.  

I will be staying at Encore next time, what a beauty.

More like 4.5 Stars...

Encore is definitely better than Venetian and Wynn. (Tied w\/ Palazzo)

I have stayed at Encore at least 5-6x now and I would probably never pay more than $300 a night here. The hotel may impress some for the first time, but it's getting a little too old for me. I actually like the new rooms at Aria more, but checking in at Aria was absolutely horrible. If you do not mind staying off the strip, I would highly recommend staying at the M Resort. The hotel rooms are new and have more of a modern appeal over Encore. The only thing I don't like about the M Resort was the fact that they are priced around $175-200 for Fridays\/Saturdays (Californians get 30% off). That's pretty much the same as staying on a cheaper property like Paris on the strip. If you don't mind the drive to the strip daily, I would recommend staying at the M. The average rate for a King bed at Encore on Fridays\/Saturdays is around $300-$350.

Overall Encore is great for:
+Groups (People who stuff 8 people in 1 room - you know who you are)
+XS \/ Surrender - The option of just going back to your hotel room after a night out.
+Shopping - The mall is across the street.

If Palazzo was cheaper than Encore by $50 a night, I would rather stay there. However, I believe there are resort fees($10-15) at Venetian \/ Palazzo properties and there are no resort fees at Encore\/Wynn.

I have mixed emotions about the Encore hotel. Generally, the property is great--the rooms are spacious and well decorated, the Swivel TV\/bathroom TV were great and the food at their "Society" restaurant was delicious. BUT... the Steve Wynn lost my love when he decided to cheap out on the details.

If the Wynn\/Encore Hotels are competing with high-end 4\/5 star properties then they should actually COMPETE. Luxury shouldn't be extra. Want to use the gym? $30 (if not included in your package). Want to not sleep right above the thumping hotel nightclubs? You'll need to pay extra upon check-in to get a "view"(50th floor and above). Want turn down service or just fresh towels in the evening? Only upon request. --Heck, you want them to CHANGE YOUR SHEETS--EVER??- you'll  need to call housekeeping and request that they do so. Every time. Otherwise, they will keep making your bed with the same dirty sheets for the duration of your stay. There was no in-room "keep it green option" that allowed guests to make the choice. Ummm.. if I wanted my sheets changed only once a week, I would just stay home.

As mentioned, the space is really nice and the non-kid friendly atmosphere helps, but in the end, all of the nickeling and diming just left a bad taste in my mouth. Warning guests about fees at every turn for services that are included at hotels CLOSER TO THE STRIP seems like bad business. After the first day, I was afraid to wander around or to ask for an extra towel because I didn't want to get charged a mysterious fee.

I'm planning on returning to Vegas in a few months on business and I'm advising my company to book the team elsewhere. No more Wynn\/Encore for me.

What a fabulous hotel!!!! Best hotel room I've ever stayed in...period! I've flown well over a million miles and stayed many places including Ritz Carlton's, Four Seasons, 5-star resorts in Hawaii, and the room I stayed in here topped them all. The bed itself is to die for! You can actually buy it at the Home Store in the hotel and I plan on it. I slept better than I ever have before. Everything in the room was top notch, very high quality and great design, just like the entire hotel. I haven't stayed at the Venetian or Pallazo yet, so I can't compare. I am staying at Caesars now, and my room at the Encore was vastly superior in every way. The Encore is more expensive per night Han the other hotels on the strip, but you get what you pay for. You owe it to yourself to check it out at least once.

Superb. I was comped a three night stay and ended up paying for a fourth night.  I upgraded my free room to a nicer one for $20.00 per night. The room overlooked the strip and was 61 stories up with all windows over looking the awesome view.  The room was big with three different areas. The bathroom was at the entrance and was huge with two sinks, large shower And separate toilet.  Then the bedroom which has a swivel 42 inch tv that could point towards the bed or the other room which consisted of a big couch and desk looking out the window.  

The service was outstanding and you has to show your jet to security to enter the elevator going to your room. 

There are several restaurants and a great Buffett.  Three clubs that were all good with XS being the best.  Gambling tables everywhere so you can lose lots of money.  Several shows that are supposed to be outstanding. Just a great hotel

Encore is a great hotel with fantastic amenities. This place is gorgeous and really showcases its exquisiteness and beauty within all of the details of this hotel. This is the sister hotel to the Wynn and is essentially a newer slightly better version of its sibling. The staff here is rather educated with respect to the grounds and the rooms are modern and very nicely appointed. This hotel has a very clean interior complete with a nice done casino and a couple of really solid places to eat as well as nightclubs. Overall, Encore ranks up near the top with respect to hotels in Vegas. 5 stars all the way. 

Pros-
Appearance 
Cleanliness
Service
Conference rooms 
Decor 
Art
Nightclubs 
Restaurants 
Attached to The Wynn 
Near fashion show mall

Cons-
A bit from center strip
Red card doesn't offer that great of comps

Beautiful hotel with beautiful rooms.  I stayed on the 54th floor in a panoramic suite with views of the strip in front, the airport to my left and mountains to my right.  However, don't think you will be soundproofed from the club music on the 54th floor, OH Noooooooo!! I could still hear the "thump, thump, thuuuump, bump, bump, buuuump."

The other thing that annoyed me, upon stepping out of the elevator onto my floor was all the "Caution" floor signs throughout my floor.  Accompanying the floor signs was a wet dog smell that lingered throughout my stay.

Overall, I had a nice time in a room with remote controlled everything.  The bathroom was modernly classic.  The one thing I would have appreciated, other than more soundproofing, was that the A\/C could've reached the "sleeping quarters" and not just the "sitting area."

I didn't experience the casino because I went to the Wynn for that.

I had a weeklong stay at the Encore and really enjoyed every minute.  The tower was situated close to everything, the store selection was great and the various restaurants throughout the Encore & Wynn properties were top notch.

I would stay here again.
We had an amazing experience! Now my favorite hotel in Vegas. Till next time muuuuaaaah!!

I have to hand it to the Encore.  They did contact me after my previous challenges and they set everything straight- including dropping my resort fee after the 99 person line.   I really appreciate the follow up and customer attention and care.  Now I want to go back!

Wow!! my boyfriend booked a suite for just the two of us! and boy it was soooo divine! from check in, to walking to the elevators, to up the elevators, to the beautiful hallways, and to OUR ROOm!!! The decor is amazing! King size bed! never wanted to leave bed. sofa and a whole diff room. (look online if you want to see how it looks) but it will not diasspoint you! Bathroom is crazy!! you even get your own bath scale!

It was the best hotel we stayed in thus far! 2nd would be venetian!

I LOVE this hotel. Very friendly and welcoming staff, very plush interior, beautiful decor, classy restaurants, well decorated rooms, luxurious beds and a great pool (XS side is a European pool).  All I can say to sum it all is PLUSH and LUXURIOUS. This hotel is all about luxury and the little details to make everything spectacular.

I wish I was ballerific enough to stay at this hotel every time I go to Vegas. If you're in the mood to splurge or celebrating a special occasion like a birthday--like I did!--then please do so at The Encore. 

A big group of us stayed in the Resort Queen Suite. Soooo spacious, so much more spacious than the Resort King Suite I hear. 2 queen beds, a roomy L-shaped sofa, floor to ceiling windows with drapes you control from your bed. So baller. I would also recommend prompt check in at the designated check in time, 3pm, to snag a room that's high up facing the strip. You can only do this at check in time. The chic but not pretentious decor was a great backdrop to our fabulous weekend. It's decorated like a stylish, boutique hotel but on a grand scale--it's Vegas afterall. The hotel is friggin' beautiful. 

What I loved most about this hotel was the attentive and uber friendly staff. A tray of yummy chocolates with a birthday card 'from The Encore front desk' was delivered to our room. Almost everything is personalized. When you turn on the TV, a greeting with your name appears. Your name's also on each room card. It's the little things that make you feel special. 

One last thing, the Wynn properties are in close proximity to a ton of great places. Clubs XS, Blush, Tryst and Surrender are all there. The Fashion Show Mall is right across the street; about a 5-10 minute walk. And another big, huge plus: 99 Ranch, Pho (best hangover food ever) and other cheap asian eateries are at this end of the strip, a 5 minute drive away.

Stay here, it's AH-MAZING!!!!!

I am so disappointed with this place.  We spent $100s on drinks and quite frankly food as well (which never came).  Carolyn was our server and she never brought our food despite us paying for it.  After 90 minutes, we escalated to Ian, the pool manager and his resolution was to comp our food.  Really?  That's your resolution?  In parallel, the server walked by us 3 times when we asked for a copy of our receipt (which we had tipped 20%).  We were approached by another couple in the lobby who had the same experience a well!  We will never return.

Encore always impresses.  I've stayed here 3 times and will be going back again in February.  The rooms are nicer than The Wynn in my opinion.  I go to Vegas several times a year since it's only a 4 hour drive from Phoenix and this is the only place that makes going to Vegas feel like a real vacation.  Top shelf drinks are complimentary while playing slots or table games and they are served in real glasses.  Every inch of the property is taken care of to make it feel luxurious.  The staff is always polite and courteous and if you have a special request or find something is not to your satisfaction, they will make every effort to meet your needs.  The only drawback is that it is not centrally located on the strip.  If you have plans at other properties for shows, you might walk a little further or spend an extra couple bucks on cabs but you will be excited to return here afterwards.  The entertainment and food options are top notch, so don't hesitate to make all reservations either here or the Wynn.  You'll be glad you did, because this is the most beautiful and will kept hotel on the strip.

Staying at the Encore was very comfortable.  We upgraded our room to a panoramic view when we checked in for an extra charge.  The view during the day was nothing to rave about but it's a different story in the evening, which the night view was magnificent.  There's a divider in the room between the bed and the living room.  The d√©cor is beautiful.  Awesome!  There's a control panel next to the bed to operate the window curtains.  There is a refrigerator in the room but it was full of snacks to purchase.  It would've been great if there was a refrigerator for us to use in the room instead.   The bathroom is very nice.  

We ate at the buffet during lunch at the Wynn and the food was not that great, the service was terrible and I did not like the dining area where we dined at.  Don't know if we should go back to the buffet again on our next trip to Vegas.  

I actually want to give a rating of "excellent" for the Encore resort room because of the comfort, cleanliness and the beautiful d√©cor, but my rating is four stars because we cannot use the refrigerator, the agent who checked us into the resort was not friendly and helpful, and the buffet at the Wynn was disappointing. 

Overall, we would love to stay at the Encore again.

This review is for the nightclub at Encore.

My friends and I decided to choose to see RL Grime on the night of Friday the 28th of October for my 21st birthday.  We strategically planned to drive 5 hours after work to get there from Southern California, and knew that we would get in right away because we were on the guest list.  We were all extremely excited because this would be our first time going together and had heard so many great things about Surrender.
 
As we were standing in line, William (the bouncer), checked us one by one.  They got to my last friend, who clearly looked older than her driver's license and stopped her.  They asked her to open her phone up and go into her iCloud.  Her Russian name, Sasha, appeared on her iCloud, and from that they deduced that she was not the person on her ID (Alexandra).  Immediately they confiscated her REAL ID and stated that she had been using someone else's ID.  We tried to explain that her name on her iCloud is the Russian version of her American name, (Alexandra).  The bouncer William would not hear us out and stated that her hair was brown in the picture but blonde in person.  Also he stated that she was much skinnier than in the picture. 

Her ID was her own, valid, and not underage.  For about 20 minutes, we were arguing with the bouncer in order for him to give her real driver's license back because she needed to drive back the next day.  Once he realized he was clearly wrong, he handed it back to her.  He marked an X on her hand and said she still was not allowed in, reluctant to physically say he had been wrong.  I spent the rest of my 21st birthday equally as upset as her sitting in our hotel room, because by the time this whole ordeal was over, it was around 3 o'clock A.M.

Thank you, William, for ruining my 21st birthday by denying my best friend's real ID at the door, after we had been sitting in the car for 5 hours.  Thank you Encore for hiring a clearly unqualified man to be your bouncer.  PLEASE, please, please, I urge you all to go to a different nightclub and just hotel in general because of the sheer discrimination we faced.  I know Surrender is normally a great club, but if you have a chance of this every happening to you on you 21st birthday, just know that it is not worth it.

What a marvelous experience. This property is still the equal of the Four Seasons\/Ritz Carlton crowd, and of course you'll pay for it. A sausage and eggs breakfast in room will cost you $32 for the entree alone so a big breakfast for two will be $100. But when you consider that it arrives fresh and hot on fine linen with quality flatware, you see where the money goes.There are no little plastic packets of Heinz ketchup; its glass and china all the way.

Not quite as picky on the little touches as they were in the day Steve Wynn was more involved in the day-to-day operation (some lights were out in the suite), but problems were fixed quickly and correctly.

This is a great choice if you like elegance and things done right. The poker room is very nice; not the size of some more involved in the poker scene, but still a great place to play. 

Can't wait to go back.

Can I get an Encore\/do you want more"
- Jay Z

I found myself wanting more of the Encore because it is a very nice and cozy hotel. We walked into a room with a fabulous view of the strip with its sister hotel the Wynn across the way shining bright like diamonds. 

The room was spacious and clean. I always wanted a room with remote control blinds and finally got it here. The bathroom was perfect for taking care of the three S and for make up for the women folk. A safe in the closet kept my goods mine. 

The room service and concierge was on point. The housekeeping was standard. Nice flat screen tv, but it was annoying how Steve Wynn kept poppin up talking on the promo station that automatically pops up of the tv remotes is as much as looked at. 

The lobby and actual casino piece is not as good. The cocktail waitress are not as friendly as some others and the floor restrooms ate not as clean as some of the other luxury hotels. However, I am comparing them to luxury so that means its still better than most hotels.

This is my wife and mine's favorite place to stay in Vegas. We have stayed at many of the resorts in Vegas like wynn,  Venetian, MGM, cosmo and the encore is just prefect did us. We love how relaxing and clean everywhere is at the encore. Service is consistently great everywhere. The rooms are large and they have great rates at times and don't make you always pay the resort fee if you don't want to use this like the gym. This saves a great deal of money. It is easy to get to and is on the strip. The pools are nice and summer at very air and relaxing.

We've been to Vegas many times and were excited to try out Encore.  The physical hotel is the nicest I've stayed at so far in Vegas.  We tend to stay in the next level down, like Mirage, TI, Bally', etc.  

The room was almost as nice as the Cosmopolitan and a little nicer than PH Westgate.  We did have several issues we didn't like at Encore though.  At check in at the Encore desk they told us our reservation was for the Wynn and if we wanted to stay at Encore we would have to pay $25 more.  We showed them the Agoda email confirmation and they quickly said we wouldn't have to pay the extra money to stay at Encore since we could show them our receipt.  Not a huge deal for us but it seemed a bit odd that the check in rep didn't apologize or even think it was odd that our reservation was messed up.  We sort of suspected that they were just overbooked at Encore.  

Now for the nickel and diming.  We knew this going into it but the $25 mandatory resort fee is very annoying.   To me these resort fees are just a way of lying about the actual cost of the room.  Mandatory fees should just be considered part of the room's rate.  You get nothing for it other than WifI access.  They say you can use the wifi and it will show up on your bill then you will get a credit for it.  Seriously why bother to charge you if it's mandatory that you buy the Wifi anyways?  There is a sign on the fridge in the room that you can't use it for your own things or you will be charged $25.   

My last comment is that we couldn't find any reasonably priced place to get a small breakfast or lunch in the hotel.  We had to walk down to the Venetian if we wanted to eat.  I'm fine paying a lot being on the strip but their prices were a bit obscene.  Since this is suppose to be a 5 star hotel though, my last point about the food costs isn't that important.

AVOID AVOID AVOID. I don't know what happened to this place. Their standards used to be so high. Im here for my wedding and I check into my room and it was falling apart. The control panel doesn't even work. I can't control the curtains or air conditioner. The vanity chair is ripping apart. The curtains are coming off the track. When I went to complain to the lobby they accused me of lying. I have never experienced such disrespect from such an establishment. I will NEVER come back here again. This place is a dump. There are definitely better places to stay here. Take your money else where. 

I guarantee the motel 6 would be better functioning than this place as well as better customer service.

During my 4 nights at Encore Casino the front desk manager in charged of the hospitality accommodate my stay with $75.00 food credit and she was so kind that she gave me a in house box of chocolates too. I felt very safe and comfortable and felt like royalty while staying there. The only thing I dislike was the choices of restaurant selections and tight slot machines and you have to tipped 2 people if you need help from the bell desk. For my next Leisure vacation I'll be booking here again minus the slot machines and eatery.

One of the best hotels on the strip!! Rooms are CLEAN, MODERN, and decently sized (745 sq feet--especially since they are all mini suites)! The only complaint I have is that it is at the END of the strip so walking can be somewhat of a hassle---especially during those awful summer months! Luckily, it is connected to its sister hotel, the Wynn, which further connects to the Palazzo\/Venetian, cutting down time spent in the heat. 

The main attractions at this hotel include the infamous XS nightclub (open Friday and Saturday 10:30PM-4AM and Sunday\/Monday 11:00PM-4:00AM) which hosts famous DJs like Kaskade, David Guetta, Calvin Harris, Tiesto, and Afrojack. They also house one of the most popular day clubs, Encore Beach Club (offering night swim events every Thursday from 10:00PM-4:00AM and regular day club hours Fridays 11:00AM-7:00PM, Saturdays 10:00AM-7:00PM, and Sundays 11:00AM-7:00PM), with various DJs ranging from Kaskade, Zedd, and Skrillex to Lil John, Jermaine Dupri, and Flosstradamus. Be sure to check for offers\/discounted tickets if you stay at either Encore or the Wynn.

As far as amenities go, Encore offers patrons a fully equipped gym open from 6:00AM-8:00PM, spa, golf course, regular pool, and upscale shopping (i.e. Chanel, Louis Vuitton, Rolex, etc.) and dining options (there are ZERO cheap restaurants inside this hotel so you'll have to venture to either the Fashion Mall, located across the street, or towards the middle of the strip where there are a few fast food restaurants and drugstores). I've tried the Wynn Buffet and wasn't too impressed with their overall food quality so I recommend migrating to other hotels and checking out what they have to offer. The suite itself includes a couch, huge bathroom with a separate tub, his and her sinks, a 13" TV built inside the bathroom mirror, touch screen capabilities to control almost everything within the room (i.e. blinds, TV,  and  room lighting), and your choice of one king or two queen sized beds. 

Room service is top notch as well as workers are more than happy to accommodate your every need. Late check-outs are available (at the discretion of the front desk staff) and checking out can be easily accomplished through their TV. 

Although this hotel is a bit more costly than some of the others on the strip---it is well worth it! Views from the rooms are usually quite pleasing to the eyes and I always feel safe as security guards check for room keys before allowing people to access the elevators. If you can find a good deal online I'd definitely recommend giving this place a try!

1. At check in they do not acknowledge you. Then they send you back in line and make you wait even though there are clerks not serving customers st the counter.
2. The line at check in and check out is ling. You will most likely need to checkout in line rather than electronically because there will most likely be errors in your bill.
3. The sell you a resort fee that includes $19.95 Internet and tell you the Internet is free. They then charge you for every device you log on to wifi. This $19.95 per device in addition to the resort fee.
3. Watch the charges to the room. They double dipped my AMEX charge at the cafe with a room charge.
4. There is a guard at the elevator who makes everyone show their key all day. They really should have the elevator work by using your room key like most hotels do.
5. Even with a reservation, the wait for the Jardin restaurant is 20 minutes.
6. Overall, not a high end experience that a Marriott platinum member would expect. I'm staying at Marriott and Starwood resorts in Vegas in the future. This property is definitely a no go!

We took advantage of the Southwest Vacation deal with flight and hotel, and it worked out so that our rooms were really cheap, however the process was a bit of a pain in the ass. That's something else.

Checking in was quick, we got upgraded to the 56th flr, but we didnt have the strip view. Our friends who were on the 37th did and a nice view of the wynn logo. Both rooms were king sizes since they ran out of doubles, but there were more than enough room with an L-shaped couch and a roll away. Mirrors everywhere! i especially love the mirror by the bed that was floor to ceiling. being the blind bat that i am, i need to be a good 3" away from the mirror to fix myself up and being able to sit on the flr made my 1-2 hr make up routine so much easier.

the room also came equiped with an ipod dock which we blasted california girls and freak nonstop.

the layout of the room was pretty well thought out--space for our luggage but it did not interfere with our walking paths. enough room for propped-timer-pics and more than enough room to fit two room of girls for some pregaming fun.

service was great--thanks joseph for working through our mess and organizing our shoes. he even left a note for us :) although we were lucky with our housekeepers, we couldnt say the same for the other room. two of the girls had their bills stolen.

HIDE YOUR MONEY.

also, concierge doesnt seem to understand their role as helping their guests. instead they directed us in a maze to the business center to drop off a package to mail. most other hotels took the package and mailed it for us.

the greatest thing about staying in encore is that we rarely had to leave the hotel. we went to XS both nights and the only time we chose to leave the hotel was for wet republic, dinner at palazzo, and haze (because we were told the lakers were going to be there). your feet hurts? let's run upstairs and change!

overall, great stay at encore. i would definitely try to stay here again, especially with XS downstairs.

I will say Encore is a very nice hotel however it sure does lack in customer service. First reservations were messed up so it took about 45 minutes to check in then once we were checked in and got to our room our keys didn't  work. Though security responded fairly quickly it took at least 30 minutes to receive new keys. Also we were told we could get complimentary tickets to their night clubs at the concierge.....not true. The only tickets they would comp was to their "boutique club".  I was informed that they no longer give out tickets to the other clubs. Funny, when talking to security for club Surrender, they sounded shocked that they weren't giving out tickets. Also funny is that every other hotel on the strip were giving vouchers for free drinks and complimentary passes to their clubs, why not Encore? Also found out that there is a $20 resort fee which you don't even have time to take advantage of that many of the other hotels don't charge. Also very surprised that they don't have hairdryers or coffee makers in the room. Weird considering you're in a suite. Also I found that they had no restaurants that were of any quality. I ate at a few of them and food was gross especially at Stratta (this is technically at Wynn but bad is bad no matter what hotel it is). We paid $17.50 for a spicy pepperoni pizza with tomato basil sauce and cheese however it was more like eating greasy paper with pepperoni. We were wondering where the sauce and cheese were? I could've had better pizza at Domino's. Also drinks were gross my sister couldn't even finish her drink, she took two sips and couldn't take another. When asking our server if she could take the drink off the bill it seemed to be a big problem. Prices aren't cheap and if she can see that the drink hasn't been touched, then what's the problem? The one thing I learned is that I will never stay at the Encore\/Wynn again especially with so many other choices.

Read this note I found on the cabinet where some goodies are stored. 

"Feel free to read the ingredients or count the calories. If you decide to indulge...and we hope you do...items that are removed for longer than 60 seconds will be charged directly to your guest account. 
Placing other items inside the bar may also incur charges to your guest account. 
Refrigerators for personal items are available through Housekeeping." 

For the first class hotel, I thought it was a little tacky note. 

Still,I liked this hotel.
The best!!! Love Encore! Rooms are awesome and XS is always a blast. Encore beach club not so much. Andrea's is great for dinner it's very chic! Prices are not bad for what you get.
This is the best hotel that we have ever stayed at.  You feel like you are on top of the world.  Huge rooms, nice views, great location.  Can't be beat.

My wife and I decided to visit Las Vegas for the first time as a couple. We wanted to stay in a clean, "higher end" hotel and this place delivered. The entire property is beautiful. The rooms are very nice and recently updated (even though the place is still very new). The pool area is very nice and overall, the service is very solid.

We stayed in the regular suites (not the tower suite) portion of the hotel. I liked the fact that all the rooms are the same size and layout. The rooms are good size with floor to ceiling windows which offer nice views. The rooms have a modern design. They have very high ceilings and well placed mirrors to give the feel of more space. The bathrooms are beautiful with a large glass shower and separate, large tub. Lots of marble tile. Bed and linens were of very high quality and the electronic lighting control is slick. 

The staff is very friendly and helpful. Every staff member I made eye contact with greeted me warmly except for what was noted below.

We wanted to see "O" at the Bellagio. I called the concierge desk a couple of weeks before my arrival and Brendon scored us some excellent seats at the base price which was very cool. During our stay, he got us some great reservations at Le Cirque on a very busy night.  Every time I called, he remembered me and got things lined out for us very quickly. I am sure the other concierge staff is as good but you cant go wrong asking him for assistance. There was a huge convention (140k people) while we were there and we were very appreciative that we could get such great service.

Ok.. so why just 4 stars rather than 5? For me, a hotel or restaurant will need to hit a home run for me to give them a 5. Encore did well but they did stumble a couple of times.

Upon arrival, our check in experience was cold. Fast, efficient, but cold.  We knew about the resort fee prior to our arrival (it wasn't included in our package). We were told coldly it was mandatory, however it was either removed from our account later or was never added. We had a conflict with the staff when we wanted to go work out one morning which was uncomfortable. Who wants to argue with a gym attendant at 8 am over a $15 user fee? When it was corrected, it was added back and forward on our account for a mystery amount that needed to be corrected at check out.

We also rented a fridge and had it removed the next day. We were charged for 4 nights use. Again, it was corrected upon check out but I felt like I had to explain all the corrections and it literally took 20 mins to get us out of the hotel. 

Finally, I know this is vegas and I stay in a lot of urban hotels for business so I am a little more used to all the little fees hotels charge you but this property takes it to the extreme. These fees, to me, is more of an annoyance than anything. I am not an expert on hotel pricing but I would rather pay a little more and not have to deal with silly charges. We were charged the following during our stay:

Room at a higher floor - $20 per night. When that room had a funny smell, I took it as an opportunity to change to a room facing the other direction (toward the strip). That upgrade fee kept me at a high floor but added $5 per night to the fee for a total of $25 per night. Really?

In room Fridge - $25 per day

In room internet - $18 per day (unless you get the resort fee). The internet did not work at the pool or gaming areas.

Receiving a package while at the hotel - $15. Yes, just to receive a package plus we had to ask to have it delivered to the room and tipped accordingly (not knowing about the fee).

Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and enjoyed the property. It met our needs. Yes it is more expensive than many but depending on your definition of value, this could meet your needs. It did ours.

When you decide to come to Vegas, look no further...
After the first experience from the pass Thanksgiving weekend with our friends and Family, Wynn and Encore is the only choice in our heart from this point forward.

The reasons are not just the design and the luxury 
but the one thing keeping them on top for all this time is their services and amazing staff! it is unparalleled
They go above and beyond to make sure you have the best time in Vegas and the did for us just that

Special big kudos to our private concierge at Wynn tower suite name Kenny Block who make our time here so memorable :-)

In summery:
Guest Room are equally amazing both Encore and Wynn 
Casino have more action over the Wynn side 
If you like to party with friend I think Encore is the right way to go
But if you here for the family experience Wynn is the one for me
but since you can share the facility between both Hotel I would go with either one without thinking

Or stay at both Wynn and Encore like us and find out for yourself! :-)
Great hotel, but be cautious of the hidden fees. They will charge your credit card without your approval and dislike children staying there.

I love staying here! The only down side is that it's on the end of the strip. It's nice if you only want to go to xs, surrender, or ebc. Which is where most of the headliners play. The rooms are 10\/10 and of course their bathrooms are above and beyond of what is expected. 
Be careful not to knock over any of the purchasable items or you will be charged.

Wow, this place may be as good as it gets when you consider Vegas!

This resort has everything you'd ever need!  Pools are great (does get really crowded), the suite was extremely WOW!  Marble entryway and marble floors in the bathroom, separate shower and soaking tub, great views of the strip!  

Food is incredibly delicious and there are many restaurants to choose from.  Casino floor is large and from a few tables you can see the pool!

Rented a cabana for a day, it was definitely worth it especially when it was 104F!!!

I usually try to stay at different resorts when in Vegas, but after staying here I don't know how I could stay else where!

It's been 5 years since staying the the Encore in Las Vegas.  Since I had a work conference happening at the Encore, I naturally made a reservation to stay there.  What a nice surprise to see an overall improvement from 5 years ago in terms of hotel upkeep, rooms and overall service.  I was enthusiastically greeted by valet staff, bellmen, front desk reception and hotel managers rotating on the floor when I arrived.  When I got off the elevator on the 35th floor, I noticed on the way to my room the carpet was clean, looked and smelled new and the hallway and wall decor was also redone.  I stayed in the same type of room I had 5 years ago.  It was sparkling clean, spacious and had a really nice scent to it.  Bathroom amenities were wonderful and I had a gorgeous view of the Las Vegas strip.  During my entire stay, I found myself not having to stray away from the Encore.  The hotel is filled with shopping, restaurants, swimming pools, bars, nightclubs and of course gambling for those who love that.  Even better, it's connected to the Wynn.  The walk between hotels was pleasant, easy and lined with high end retail stores and merchandise.  Conference banquet service was also on point which added to a great experience returning to the Encore that exceeded my expectations.

Beautiful room and hotel.  This is by far one of the most comfortable stays in Las Vegas.  The rooms are spotless and all the furniture is very new.  Staying at the Encore also lets you get privilege access to XS and Encore beach club in the summer which is major perk.

All I can say is I am glad I wasn't paying the bill for this one.  The rooms are very very nice and everything is elegant to the max, and the price of everything reflects that.  I actually spent time in the room because I loved the view and the furnishings.  Usually, they just want you to hustle on down to the casino and gamble.  I was somewhat taken aback by the warning on the food\/mini bar stuff.  I know that you should pay for it if you use it, but the words were a bit.....harsh (in my estimation).  I really did not want to eat 10 cashews for $11 nor did I even want to open the "intimacy kit" that was perched off to the side.  Intimacy kit?  Everything was sitting on little alarm pads just waiting for someone to make a mistake and look at the stuff for longer than 60 seconds.  I was so put off by the snacks (and a hangover kit too) that I didn't even open the mini bar.  Dang!

Words cannot describe the quality of this hotel. It is absolutely amazing and worth saving up for yearly. I cannot say one bad thing about my stay. 

I stayed in September of 2013 in the Encore Tower Suites. Everyday, my room was made up multiple times, my room was spotless, and my toiletries were organized. My dirty cloths were even folded.  I cannot believe the care the housekeeping crew took.  Daily, breakfast was delivered to the room. It was great food and presented so nicely on amazing dinnerware and a white table cloth. The servers were excellent and insisted one morning that I don't even get out of the bed to let them in.

Tip: Stay in the Tower Suites, book with flight to save money!

I LOVE Travelzoo.  Back in December 2009, there was this air+hotel promotion for Las Vegas.  My boyfriend and I decided to come here during Spring Break, to celebrate my birthday.  Flight & Hotel ~ $260+ per person for 4 nights and 3 days [with $75 resort credit - we later used this to eat at the Wynn Buffet].  This was an offer too good to refuse [seriously!].

We checked in on a Tuesday, for some reason - checking in took awhile [probably because there were some problematic customer].  The receptionist was nice and asked us how many room keys we need, we asked for 2...turns out they automatically PRINT YOUR NAME ON THE ROOM KEY (which also works as your player's card).  SO AWESOME.  We weren't able to immediately check in because the rooms were not ready...until 1 hour later (when they courteously called us to let us know our room was ready).

We finally checked in our room, IT WAS SO SPACIOUS and NICE.  The layout of the bathrooms are very similar to the ones at the Venetian\/Palazzo [probably because they were designed by the same people].  The hall way was lined with mirrors on one side and a large closet on the other (with ironing board, extra pillow, blankets).  The wall of the bedroom portion was also lined with mirrors on one side and a cabinet w\/ refrigerator and snack box (great variety - even though we didn't use it)!  The living room area is partitioned by a wall and a television (that swivels, so when you're in bed you can have it face you or when you're in the living room, you can still enjoy the tv by turning it the other way).  Oh, also really cool was that when you turned on the tv, the main menu would greet the guest by saying, "Welcome Mr\/Mrs. Last Name" and given a variety of options to choose from.  The telephone was similar because it greeted the guest and gave a list of options.  I decided to call concirege and was greeted in a similar manner, "Welcome (Last Name) Party, how can I assist you?"  WOW - tailored to the finest detail, talk about CUSTOMER SERVICE! There is also this master remote control by the bed that turned on&off all our lights and opened\/closed all our curtains [our bellhop taught us how to use it and it was came in really handy].

We had an awesome view of the strip, the pool, and XS.  The only negative opinion I had about Encore was that it was far from everything else - we either needed to 1)walk through Wynn to get to our destination\/the strip or 2)take a taxi everywhere...THIS WAS A LOT OF WALKING [even with comfy shoes] cuz Encore is basically the last hotel on the main strip (not including Trump or Circus Circus), it was pretty darn far...

*What would have topped off the awesome experience would be to have our bags dropped off in our rooms before checking in (especially if they're not ready).  To ensure that the bellhop who helped us got tipped, he could leave his business card or something.

Decor is beautiful all over the hotel, however our room even though it was pretty had frayed carpeting, nonworking and shabby phone from Motel 6 next to the bed, Motel 6 remotes for the TVs and no pen as well as a weird odor from the bathroom I mean come on 5 star hotel with these issues and on top of it all when I commented to the front desk manager on the day of check in she assumed I was complaining because I wanted a free upgrade.

Service is not bad but was much better when they first opened. On top of all this we had made a reservation weeks ago for bottle service at the Tryst $550 and we notified the rep with enough lead time that we changed our mind and were going to rent a Cabana at Surrender $750 instead, upon check out lo and behold that rep tried to sneak in $120 bill for the Tryst and we hadn't set foot in the place!

We spoke to the same front desk manager the next day checking out and she said she would look into it with a very bored expression, it seems like it's regular practice sneaking in charges hoping that clients do not notice.

Needless to say I'm not going back there, I can spend my money in plenty of other places.

I found myself wondering how they could possibly make anything more amazing and luxurious than the Wynn.  

This place will blow your mind!  So stunning, more cohesively designed thank the original tower in my opinion.  

so apparently this is the only place to go now...not to mention a ton of new places to dine and XS...

XS is the most stunning place EVER.  I am a huge fan of Tryst and the service they provide there.  

Tryst had two problems:
1.not enough bathrooms
2.not enough stripper poles

They seriously solved the hell out of both of these problems!!!  Stripper poles disguised as very large chic light fixtures and more restroom stalls than Giant's Stadium.  The whole club is so stunning, no doubt it will be the number 1 spot in vegas.

Yes, this IS as good as it gets. We loved it so much, we picked up the video camera and did a quick tour of our suite which I have posted on YouTube. 

Here it is:

http:\/\/youtu.be\/LojXZN3oeFk

First class place, and top quality at every turn. Once again, thanks to Encore for making this trip so very wonderful.

Thanks for ruining our baby's first Christmas!

Although the Encore\/Wynn looks like a five-star hotel, appearances can be deceiving.  We were excited to stay at the Encore and arrived on Christmas Day to celebrate the holidays and our baby's first Christmas.  Before arriving, we had called to confirm that there would be a crib in one of the two rooms that we booked as well as a mini-fridge to store the baby's milk.  The front desk at the Encore said that both a crib and fridge would be available.

Fast forward to the check-in process, which was neither fast nor efficient.  After standing in line for 30+ minutes on Christmas Day late evening, we were finally greeted by the front desk, which informed us that they had run out of cribs and fridges.  They said that we were out-of-luck and that many other guests were also out-of-luck--as if that was supposed to be satisfactory.  They wouldn't even guarantee that we would have a crib or mini fridge for our subsequent nights.  We explained that we specifically called earlier that day and the front desk reconfirmed that they had both.  As a "consolation," the Encore stated that they would "allow" us to put the milk into the minibar without being charged for using it.

Despite our baby's cries in front of the check-in line, the manager Sam came out and restated that there's nothing he could do.  We explained that a similar situation had occurred to us recently at a Hyatt resort and the manager there actually sent staff to buy pack-and-plays for guests.  Sam stated condescendingly, "Wow.  Well, I'm not going to go out and buy any cribs tonight."  We, of course, acknowledged that this would be difficult on Christmas Day, but he didn't even offer a simple apology.  Sam then said that he would send up a rollaway bed, to which we replied that this was a seriously unsafe situation--a baby can't sleep in a cot, obviously.  Sam said that if we checked the Encore website, we would have learned that a guest's requests are merely preferences and not guarantees.  We pointed out that wasn't the issue because we had specifically called in advance and were not advised of the apparently high likelihood (as described by the Encore front desk) that cribs and mini fridges would run out.  We relied on the Encore's repeated promises over the phone, which one would expect a purportedly "five-star" hotel to keep, to our detriment.  We stated that had the Encore simply been honest with the fact that they don't have many cribs\/fridges and that they often run out, then we could have Primed one to the hotel or checked one in our luggage.  We even canceled a reservation at another hotel specifically because they didn't have cribs.

Sam was completely unsympathetic to our situation, but even worse than that, he was not at all innovative in trying to solve a guest's problems.  He could have tried to borrow a crib from another hotel or of course buy pack-and-plays (they're less than $50 at Walmart) as the Hyatt did.  Basically, he didn't even try.  A "five-star" hotel cannot fail to try.  Thanks to the Encore, our baby had a fitful night's "rest" and a terrible end to an otherwise wonderful Christmas day!

To all other families with small children, Encore\/Wynn does not want your business nor do they even want you on their premises.  Defeated as we were by the check-in process, we were stopped by one of the security guards.  Apparently, strollers are not allowed in the building and there is a sign in the entrance stating so.

Went there with a small group of friends this labor day weekend, and was impressed.  

This place had pretty much everything you could ask for in a nice hotel.  Nice lounges to smoke cigars and share drinks with friends, a nice open floor layout, pleasant and very quick cocktail waitresses, great room service, very comfortable rooms, hot cocktail waitresses, a great crowd at night for XS, hot cocktail waitresses...even their roll-away beds were awesome -- It felt like my roll-away bed had never been used.  

Definitely a fan of this place.

The Encore comes in as Wynn's younger, hipper little sister.  

Its definitely more modern than the Wynn, but with all the upscale amenities that you would expect from a Wynn property.  

Great water pressure in the showers, comfy beds (from what little I slept) and nice views of the strip or golf course.  I recommend getting higher floors to escape the pulsating beats of the clubs below.  

The reason for only 4 stars is the lacking customer service.  I don't know about you, but when I go places I expect killer customer service, maybe because I'm in the service industry myself, but NO should never be in your vocabulary when dealing with clientile. 

We unfortunately lost some stuff and getting it back was a nightmare and hoop jumping, run arounds and the like were enough to get my blood boiling.

Great looking hotel, security staff very friendly and located at every corner of the encore and Wynn. Restaurants one of the best in the world , again excellent service, food taste very unique, having lived in New York and Los Angeles , this place packs a strong punch. 

However, having been at the Wynn on opening day , which was utterly amazing , amazing customer service, currently I would have to unfortunately say that my experience was subpar. 

I checked in several hours before actual checking in  time of 3:00pm , waited till about 5pm , no one called , I asked several times the answer was your room was not ready. I'm very understanding , I never like to complain , I saw multiple people get there rooms after checking after me. Again I try to be respectful and very courteous. However seeing that nothing was happening I expressed my frustration , I was quickly accommodated to a low level no view , room that was subpar clean. Then front desk clerk offered me a upgrade to parlor suite for extra 150 a night!?? Very unprofessional , let's start providing adequate service before jumping the gun. 

I then requested room change they said we will have it ready I a few hours the following day, time comes for transition , responsive was oh we don't have that room anymore. Then after 2 days of frustration we received higher level floor room with a view. 

I realize that in Las Vegas everything has become all about money. If your a high roller you will get special treatment, if you are not too bad.

Updates: things have turned around past several days. Just wish start of our trip was as nice. Will increase stars from 2 to 4

We decided to splurge and stay at the tower suites...they have there own personal door\/ Lobby from the casino and overall there is a SOWEWHAT luxurious feel to staying here...i don't know if we will stay there again. Let me begin by saying that the suit\/room was very clean and the room service cuisine was perfection! That being said there was something missing in that phenomenally exceptional experience we were expecting when we decided to "splurge". This was our second time staying at encore suits and I'd have to say the absolute all star service came from a very FEW people... Melissa at the front desk, is what this hotel should strive for when training future front desk staff!  She is the ONLY ONE that makes you feel like the "VIP's" you think you are when you walk into those glass doors! Other than her the front desk service is a bit meh (I was expecting phenomenal customer service like, oh I don't know...actually remembering our last name). The bellmen at the Encore make up for all the front desk lacks! Christian, Richard and the other gentlemen are Allstars!!!! It's these gentleman that you see when you first walk down and you are always greeted with a "genuine" smile and warm greeting (unlike the front desk). Another great experience was Val in the swimsuit store who was able to help me find an AMAZING suit side note: if you are a new mom and need a swimsuit but don't know where to start, VAL this woman knows her suits and will find perfect one for your body type!) And lastly the person who had the  most outstanding customer service in the Entire hotel, MARKOS!!!! He is one of the many gentleman that is kind enough to open those glass doors of luxury...he is phenomenal and makes you truly feel like a VIP! Overall the stay was good...but  in Vegas you don't want GOOD you want UNPARALLELED (when you splurge)

Frustrated with some of the changes to the MGM mLife loyalty program, I decided to abandon my usual place at the Bellagio and stay at Encore (which necessarily includes aspects of Wynn).  Overall, I would say that Wynn-Encore caters more to the younger crowd (in distinct contrast to Bellagio) but still has the games (at least at the higher limits) to appease the more hard-core gamers.  Encore, however, suffers from a fatal flaw with respect to noise from the dayclubs and nightclubs that would prevent me from recommending a stay at the hotel to anyone.

The noise problem was surprising, having stayed at many hotels on The Strip (all of which have nightclubs) and never encountering a problem.  What makes Encore particularly problematic is that one side of the hotel (the side overlooking the pools and Wynn golf course) is also exposed to two partially outdoor nightclubs (which also occasionally serve as pool dayclubs).  The beats can be heard in the mid-afternoon (which really isn't much of a problem) and then well into the 4am early morning, which would probably be torture for a light sleeper.  I am fortunately a pretty heavy sleeper (I used to live next to the Holland Tunnel)--while the noise was distracting, closing the curtains and turning the A\/C fan on high was just enough to fall asleep.  I would, however, strongly recommend to anyone staying at Encore, if you find out your room is on the pool\/golf course side and the front desk is unable to offer you another room, simply get your bags and head to a different property--there are plenty of other places to stay.

I actually liked the layout of my standard Encore Resort Suite.  While not technically a multi-room suite, a divider between the bed and the rest of the room sort of gives the feeling of a two-room suite, and the flat panel TV on the divider with swiveling base was clutch.  Mirrors on a whole side of the room also give the impression of more spaciousness, and floor-to-ceiling windows provide dramatic views of the golf course, pools, and desert mountains (though they also probably exacerbated the aforementioned noise problem).

Before really delving into the gaming specifics, I will state that the casino floor easily has the most consistently attractive drink servers of any casino I have been to.  If that is something that you count as enhancing your gaming experience, this is a certainly a bonus for Wynn-Encore.

As I mentioned before, Wynn-Encore really seems to cater to a younger crowd, and this is reflected in the table games.  There are an abundant number of blackjack games paying 6-to-5 on blackjacks and hitting soft 17--an automatic 1.61% hit to expected player return.  On the flip side, limits at these tables go as low as $10.  More standard blackjack tables maintain "Dealer Hits Soft 17" up through the $100 and even $200 limits, though there are some tables featuring "Dealer Stays on All 17s" at $100 (though possibly as little as 3--1 in the Encore Baccarat room and 2 just outside the Wynn Baccarat room).  Craps doesn't seem to be as popular at Wynn-Encore than other casinos, but limits are as low as $10 even during weekend-night primetime.  As for video poker, most mid-limit Jacks-or-Better paytables were at 9-5 with 9-6 JoB starting at $10 on certain machines.  (Be aware that 9-6 JoB earns Red Card points at a slower rate--1 point for every $15 coin-in rather than the usual $6 coin-in for most other video poker.)  For Super Times Pay fans, Encore has 9-5 JoB STP multi-play as low as $1\/credit--a game Caesar's Entertainment refuses to offer above 6-5.

Among other observations, I wasn't particularly impressed with any of the casual dining options at Wynn-Encore, and the resort has a dearth of late-night dining, with only the relatively small Allegro open until 6am.  The Nuclear Tipping Point channel loops an hour long documentary on ridding the world of nuclear weapons.  While it's easy to tune it out, the gaming floor music butchers your favorite songs from the 80's, 90's, and today.  And, as you would already be aware if you had taken any cab in Las Vegas, Steve Wynn is in love with his voice:  He narrates the cabs, the website, and the two hotel tour television channels.

Overall, had it not been for the hotel room noise problem, Encore could easily garner 3-stars, and if the food were improved, the resort would probably be competing for a 4-star review.  I wouldn't be totally averse to revisiting Encore but would need some assurance as to my room's susceptibility to the noise.

I usually stay at the Wynn (especially after finding out that Sheldon Adelson, owner of the Venetian \/ Sands, is a right-wing nutjob), but gave Encore a try this past weekend.

Some kinks in the check-in process - they were very full because of CES and the adult film convention, but eventually got a resort room with two queen beds on the 18th with a decent Strip view.  Front desk lady told me that all rooms with two beds face the Strip.

The room is beautiful, much nicer than the rooms at the Wynn, and not just because it's newer. There's a bit of an Asian motif with lacquered wood paneling on the walls, the beds are larger, the couch in the corner is a nice touch (not as comfortable as the ones in the Venetian suites), and the complimentary water bottles were much-appreciated.

A little further from the Wynn than I would like, and the hallway around XS late on a weekend night is crowded. Other than that, no complaints - it's the luxury one would expect from the Wynn, but turned up a notch.

1. Somehow, the reservation name was the name of my room guest (JohnDoe) as the last name, and my own name, (JaneDear) as the first name.¬† As you can imagine, this caused a lot of confusion while trying to book any services in the hotel\/resort.¬† More than anything, this was a frustration with the group I was with also experiencing the same issue with the name on the room.¬† We were told that this couldn't be fixed in the system which we requested it be noted but it was not.¬† Again, frustrating.

2.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†I requested my bill to be sent to me electronically and I still haven't received it. I called and requested it also. I still haven't received it. 

3.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Our bathrooms were not cleaned on any of the days we stayed at your resort.¬† Towels were taken but in some cases not replaced.

5.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†The bell man was called about 20 minutes before we left and we called to check on the arrival time.¬† Not only was the attendant who answered the phone rude about us asking about the status, but the bell man never showed up.¬† We ended up pulling over 14 pieces of luggage downstairs ourselves (group of 6).

Overall, my guests and I felt uncomfortable and disrespected.¬† I understand it is difficult to appease every single guest in the resort, but I didn't even feel like there was an effort.¬† At one point, I thought I was being pranked just from all of the mishaps that were occurring.¬† I cannot say that I would recommend this resort at the price I paid. I've had better service for much much less.

I could not have asked for a better Vegas hotel.  Of all the years I've been to Vegas...I am a Vegas nut...I had the most memorable, stress free Vegas vacation PERIOD.  Hands down, Encore has won my heart.  I cannot and will not stay anywhere else when I'm in Vegas.  You just can't.  I will shell out the extra dough to stay here.  Here's why...  

Customer Service:
This is key.  From the moment we stepped foot into Encore, the staff was courteous, responsive, and genuinely concerned about our happiness.  -
 The Valet guys...
were happy and upbeat.  They ALL said hello...not just the one helping us.  They opened our car doors and the hotel entrance doors...every time.  When we left, the valet even asked if we had a great time and she wished us to come back again. 
  The Frontdesk Staff...
were overly nice...but in a good, genuine way.  Yes, the line was long, but they covered their bases by  having 2 staff members controlling the lines and letting people know where to stand.  They looked put together, from head to toe...not a hair out of place (trust me, I'd notice), not a finger nail chipped.
  Housekeeping....
really did their job.  They just didn't clean around our mess, they organized it.  They placed our magazines neatly on the table.  Placed new slippers next to our beds.  Neatly aligned our shoes.  AND placed chocolate squares next to our bedside tables. DAMN!
   The casino staff...
always smiled and greeted us with a "Hello!  Are you enjoying your stay?"  They weren't trying to have us sign up for some stupid show, nor sign up for their Red Card, nor get us to stay another night.  

Sundries store...
IMPRESSIVE!  Who the hell cares about the stupid sundries store?  Well, we did since we forgot a couple of items...like toothpaste.  This is how I knew S.Wynn got his stuff together.  The sundries store just doesn't sell any ol' toothbrush...they sell the good toothbrushes.  They sell the good candy.  They sell nice jewelry, cups and other Vegas souveniers that you might find irritating, but weren't because everything in that store is just NICE.  I loved it.

The room...
Oh my GOD!  We were on the top floor with an awesome view.  But who cared about the view, with how well the room was put together?  All I can say is there was a remote for everything...even the curtains.  We didn't have to worry about getting up if we forgot to turn off the lights because the remote was at my bedside table.  The fridge was fully stocked.  I bet you'd have to pay an arm and a leg for a stupid Pepsi, but just knowing it was there...yeah, life's good.

Society Cafe...
was excellent.  Service, impeccable.  Food, supurb.  I had the black cod with manila clam chowder.  Our waiter made suggestions.  We followed what he said and were damn glad we did.  BTW...if you order the chocolate cake, make sure you have an extra stomach.  I'm talking 6 layers held together by fudge and white chocolate shavings.  Genius.  I embraced the pig and me.  It was decadent.

Decor...
red.  I'm biased.  I love red.  The red was a bit overwhelming, but it's not like it was tacky.  Details, folks, details.  Red was the backdrop.  It's red, so of course it stands out.  I'm sorry, but I've never seen a red chandellier.  Just the thought of one makes you wonder, but honestly, they were gorgeous.  The plantation and butterfly mosaics were well placed.  Encore put much thought into their decor.  I can't come up with a better way they could have decorated the place.  It's unique and shows alot of personality.

In all, Encore knows what their doing.  Their staff really made a difference.  I've stayed at other hotels in which, yeah, the hotel was nice and we paid alot of money to be there, but money can't buy genuine kindness.  And that's why Encore will be my home away from home when I go back to Vegas.

Bravo!

The view at the encore is pretty awesome!  We were on one of the top floors and you could look DOWN on the whole strip from there.  Floor to ceiling windows, the bathrooms are nice and large.  The service was excellent from the bell captain, to the registration clerk, housekeeping, cocktail waitress, dealers, valet, etc...

I especially liked the Encore as opposed to the Wynn because it was comfortable and seemed less hectic.  MGM feels massive,  Aria feels cold, but the Encore was designed to have a more intimate atmosphere while having an open floor plan.

Sorry Venetian, you've been bumped. This is my new favorite hotel on the strip, and rightfully so. 

The rooms are spacious and spectacular (although the brass was a little off-putting). Do yourself a favor and reserve a room at the upper levels. It will cost a little more, but when you see the view, it is definitely worth it. 

As simple as it sounds, I loved the remote for the curtains, lights and privacy button. It was so nice to control everything with a touch of a button...FROM MY BED! Never again will I perform such mundane tasks! 

Customer service is above and beyond anything that I've ever experienced before. The bellmen, valet, bartenders, cocktail servers and maids were all extraordinary and treated us like royalty. Please make sure you tip them! I'd like to mention that housekeeping, in particular, were ON IT. I didn't see them hanging around our room waiting to clean it at all, yet when we would return a short time later, it was magically clean and stocked again. Truly a 5 star hotel.

This is my favorite hotel in Vegas

Why?

Because you do not need to walk miles through an obnoxious casino to get to your room or anywhere

Has great restaurants between Encore and Wynn

The rooms are spacious and the beds are insanely comfortable

They have  a nice workout facility

It is within walking distance to the Venetian and a few other places

Easy to get a taxi without waiting in long lines

EXCELLENT PLACE TO STAY IN VEGAS!  Great view of the strip from the 59th floor.  Rooms had everything.  Great poker room.  Easy walk down the strip to other hotels.  Walk right into the Wynn without leaving the building.  Great service and resturants.  RECOMMEND HIGHLY.

I stayed here with my partner for 3 nights and 4 days in January. We stayed at the King Suite on the 22nd floor, measuring 750 sq feet. Our room had a decent view at the very end closest to Wynn bldg. of partial strip. On Saturday night at 1am, we discovered that our room was situated on the site closest to XS. Thankfully, the queen bed was comfy enough to fall asleep and try to drown out the constant bass and nightclub noises coming from XS nightclub.  

Room amenities was typical of any luxury Vegas hotel: posh, beautiful lighting, tv in bathroom, LCD tv (with HD channels) that rotated between bedroom and living room. The blinds\/shades and lights could be accessed via a wired control adjacent to bed.

I didn't like how we were charged $14\/daily for internet access or the fact that we couldn't get a "late check-out" of 1pm versus 12pm regular. I guess they prefer us downstairs and gamble in their machines while we wait for airport transportation.

Beware of the magnetically-equipped in-room food service. Turns out that $8 Fiji water bottles and ridiculously-priced ($4 for a small box of peanuts?!) boxed snacks were placed on a magnet that charges the room if out place for more than 60 seconds. Talk about high-tech robbery!

Casinos downstairs and overall decor of hotel was spectacular and over-the-top. Plenty of slot machines and table to entertain even the die-hard of gamblers. I played a few games of blackjack and left empty-handed (damn you Wynn!)

I would've given the Encore a 5\/5 if the XS nightclub noises were more enclosed and if room service would've let us check out a little later than usual... well, after they gave us FREE INTERNET access!!

PS\/ I found a great deal on Travelocity ($550 for 3 nights at Encore with two roundtrip tix from SFO to Vegas). Check it out!

We walked into our room after check-in only to find a used condom on the floor, this is the most disgusting thing I've ever seen. To make matters worse, when we called the concierge, he wasn't even surprised and did not even offer a sincere apology. My friends and I were moved to another room but the incident ruined our first day as it was a common topic that continued to taint our stay. I've always been a fan of Encore\/ Wynn and don't stay anywhere else but this experience has me looking into the Palazo for my nxt stay

All remains accurate in my experiences and past review of this superbly run property on the Las Vegas strip. Everything is 6 stars.

I particular is the attention to detail in the rooms to the restaurants. A high level of consistent, friendly service and anticipation of guest needs makes the Wynn one of the best properties in Las Vegas.

The pool and spa are exceptional.

I just returned from a three-day getaway at the Encore and it was marvelous (yes, I said marvelous). I've been to the Encore\/Wynn resort before, but this was my first time staying. Everything from the service to the hotel room decor and cleanliness exceeded my expectations. The only downside: you have to pay for internet, which I can understand for other hotels on the Strip, but it seems like something Encore would include free of charge. 

Anyways, I walked through the MGM to get to Hakkasan on Friday night and not to sound snobby, but I was a little disgusted. I honestly don't think I'll be able to stay anywhere else now.

Staying at the Encore turns me into a lazy blob because all I want to do is sleep in their cloud of a bed. So so so comfy! I don't know if my friends and I are just stupid, but we kept having an issue with turning off the tv. We'd press the power button and it'd turn on a few seconds later. 

My friend tried asking concierge if there was any way they could place us on the guest list for XS, but I guess they said they couldn't do anything for us. Not too sure how correct that policy is because for whatever reason we picked the inebriated person to call concierge. I was a little concerned that being with a bunch of rowdy, foul mouthed boys would cause hotel staff to treat us a little more roughly; however, everyone was respectful and treated us as sweetly as the older, most likely richer guests. Pretty sweet.

Had the pleasure of spending my Labor Weekend at the Encore in Las Vegas.  From the moment you step foot on the Encore \/ Wynn campus you feel some type of way! The amazing smell of the resort is un-paralleled and the flower arrangement is the best there is.  While you walk through the beautiful entrance there are plenty of helpful security to direct you to where you need to go.  The rooms are ridiculously nice and comfortable and make you feel right at home.  All the detail in the resort puts this place on top. From the tiles on the floor to the way the napkins in the pool bathroom are laid out everything is an A+.  Also they have plenty of wonderful places to grub.  We hit Mizuni on Sunday night which was amazing and can't beat the view of the waterfall while eating some foie gras and sushi!  We also dined at the society cafe which made some elite bloody Mary's and bomb chicken wings. Also took down the buffet on tues which is always one hell of an experience! My favorite buffet in Vegas hands down!  Don't sleep on their gelato selection so make sure you save room for dessert.  Had so much fun gambling at the tables as well. We spent about 4 hours at the War table drinking and laughing and enjoying life.  Faith was our favorite dealer and made sure everyone was having a blast.  Also just when you thought life couldn't get any better laying poolside drinking a coconut mojito the pool staff brings you sliced oranges.  Can't wait to be back on the grounds Nov.6 for my GFs bday.  Thank you Steve Wynn
Great room on the sixth floor.  Enjoyed the pool.  Saw Skrillex at Encore Beach Club.  Played a hand of 21.

It doesn't get better than this. Here's the lucky deal:
Total was around $380, 3 nights stay, 2 tix to Le Reve, $50 dining credit to any restaurant in Wynn\/Encore, $25 gambling play, $50 spa credit.

There's no way anyone in their right mind would anyone pass that opportunity up. The hotel is definitely in the upper echelon in Vegas' hotel classes. Our room view overlooked the pools and at night, you can see XS in action. 

There's only one word that comes to mind, money! This hotel is just that. If you have the extra cash or find some awesome deals, this is an ideal place to stay.

The only drawback is that it's on the far end of the LV strip.

Call me charles dickens because I had great expectations. The service is okay..made us wait 3 hours for our room to be ready? Doesn't make sense. Rooms are nice and spacious..the atmosphere is very calm and not so much ruckus as at other casinos. Ehh meh..I'd stay there again at a very good price, the location is a turn off because you have to cab it everywhere. So so like girls without make up.
Love the vibe here.  Doesn't feel like a typical casino, with open spaces and vibrant colors.  Good clientele, and good dealers.
