Housekeeping was fine, no problem at guest services, in general I had no problem with any hotel staff. Parking wasn't a problem either. My one gripe was that it was like 115-120 degrees in Vegas at the time of my stay, and we couldn't use the mini-fridge to store any beverages or food because it's weight-sensitive. Also, wifi wasn't free. But all-in-all, I had a great time, and I would definitely consider staying there again (at least on weekdays).

My family and I stayed here this weekend. True, the rooms look just as they do in the pictures. It was beautiful. We had a room facing the strip in a high floor. I loved the suite and agreed, the room was clean, comfortable and felt new. However, it was so loud. the party by the pool lasted way into the night, like 3 am... we asked for a quiet room. old people. lol... also, I did not like the attitude of  the staff here. They were polite enough, butI felt like I was bothering them and waiting on them, from the front desk, folks on the phone,  to the security guards... they acted like they did not want to be there and I was annoying them. I wouldn't stay here again. Shame.

I stayed in the panoramic suite in the Encore during my most recent Vegas trip, and I have to say that it was pretty amazing. I'm a bit jaded when it comes to nice hotels (after all, most hotel rooms are the same after you stay in enough of them), but I loved the unique, modern, classy-yet-trendy style of the Encore rooms. Major props to whoever did the interior design for the rooms - I took pictures because I want my future condo to look just like the room I stayed in.

Gorgeous panoramic view of the entire street, mirrors throughout the living room and bedroom areas, giant fluffy bed, enormous bathroom.... Loved it! 

I'm definitely going to be booking at Encore for my next visit, as this is now my new #1 favorite place to stay (with #2 being the Venetian and the Bellagio at a distant #3). 

Stay in one of their suites during your next Vegas trip... I guarantee you won't regret it!

If you are use to 5 star service then run away now, don't walk. I prepaid on their website but failed to bring the credit card I charged it on and I booked it and paid for it so long ago I forgot how I paid for it. Do you have the card Sir? I do not know. If you do not know then I will need to charge you the full rate again on another charge and you will need to call back later for a refund at a later date. Your policy sucks! Don't curse at me Sir. I did not curse at you I cursed at your policy. Sir you will need to come back at 3pm for check in. Is there an additional amount I can pay to check in at 1:30pm? No Sir I already told you that you would need to come back at 3pm. I got the manager to credit BOTH of my credit cards and I told her I did not want to stay in their hotel. She was nice and asked me if she could help me book at another hotel and I said no I was done. If I can't find a hotel I will head to UT for some relaxing time in Zion National Park. They also had to cancel my tickets to La Reve their show and dinner afterwards at The Lakeside. I will never step in that property again. It did look nice but I would much rather get better service at places likes The Four Seasons or The Ritz Carlton, Bellagio ect.. I left their hotel and tried a few places which were all sold out and so I decided to take my wife to Zion National Park where we relaxed in comfort.

Super padre el hotel cada cosa tiene su detalle a d√≥nde vallas caminando , las habitaciones bien nice y c√≥modas, la vista desde mi habitaci√≥n que daba a la alberca y parte de otros hotels era hermosa ,la alberca muy bonita el personal amable, aparte q esta el antro Xs q llegan Dj famosos a mi me toc√≥ ver a David Guetta.

I haven't been to the new ARIA yet, but Encore is by far the best casino on the strip.  It is classy looking, clean, and the watiresses come by often to serve you.  They are faster with the drinks than any other casino I've been to in Vegas.  They also have a lot more slot machines here than anywhere else.  The restaurants are better.  And the overall feel of the casino is just so "vegas".  It gives the high end vegas feeling, not the low brow ghetto vegas feeling.  I would spend the money and stay here.  The club at Wynn is phenominal, check it out if you don't want to go to the newest Vegas hotspot.  

Derek

The Encore has some of the nicest rooms that I've ever been to in Vegas. They are big and clean and comfortable. I've stayed here on two different occasions and they have both been great! The bathroom even has a TV for you! Besides that there is great food all around and you can't talk about Encore without mentioning their pools! It's very easy to get around since it is right on the end of the strip and takes about 15 minutes to walk to Cesar's Palace\/Bellagio. Overall great hotel and would recommend if you can afford it.

I stayed @ the Wynn in December when Encore first opened, therefore I took a look that visit. 

My recent visit, I gambled a bit @ Encore and was surprisingly successful.  

Parking is fairly easy @ this casino.  You don't have to walk a mile to the parking lot like that horrible casino the Riviera...   Parking is also convenient @ Wynn.

Encore doesn't have a sports book which isn't a good thing...

I put a hundred into a video poker machine and ordered a coffee.   It wasn't comped, I had to pay $4 which is Neiman Marcus prices.  This was the first time I played video poker @ a casino bar which didn't provide me with a free drink.  That's bullshit!  Well, @ least I got 4 aces and doubled my money...

Beautiful casino and I will stay there someday soon...

BEAUTIFULLY FINISHED HOTEL\/CASINO LOSES ALL APPEAL BY BEING SO UNFRIENDLY.

The Wynn carries the name of Las Vegas' greatest developer, Steve Wynn.  The Encore is really just another wing of the Wynn, with all the same levels of finish and amenities.  At every turn, a lovely narrated video or other media gives you Mr. Wynn's personal welcome to the property.  This is the only welcoming element of our stay that I experienced.  

To start, Encore loses a star for neglecting to curb cigarette smoke.  It's everywhere.  It's in the casino; it's in the bars; it's in the restaurants; it so pervasive outside at the pool that your clothes will stink from outdoor second-hand smoke.  It's just bad.  There's a Mr. Smokestacks at every turn.

I suppose the reason Encore and Wynn are so behind the times in the tobacco department is that the whole casino seems tailored to attract tourists from China and other distant areas.  What would normally be features of a hotel\/casino that might give it an exotic flair seem more like deliberate kowtowing to the almighty yuan.  If you aren't the child of an asian oligarch, you might as well be a loiterer at the Wynn.

To see for yourself how America's purchasing power has been obliterated, one cheap Walmart sale at a time, take a stroll down the Wynn's esplanade.  The Wynn is home to some of the greatest shops in town.  The indoor mall is practically dripping with designer brands.  About 1\/3 of the store employees speak Mandarin.  Nothing spoils the old European romance that Hermes projects like a pack of tourists haggling in Chinese.

The property isn't as much a hospitality business as a money-collector.  That is to be expected of a casino.  But, here's the rub.  Of the 15 or so individual restaurant or bar businesses my wife and I visited, in only one - Andrea's - did the server say, "Hi, my name is _____, and I'll be your waiter." or, "May I take your plate\/drink\/etc."  The lack of this personal attention will wear on you; probably most noticeably when your table is being bussed as you are sitting at it.  

Everywhere we went - the bars, the restaurants, the tables at the casino - you get pounced by buss boys.  I like the last 20% of my drink.  I slow down toward the end of a meal and enjoy the conversation.  This is not an invitation to take my plate or glass.  But, they do.  It's criminal.  And the effect is that you feel like, "Hurry up and order something else," or "pay and leave."

A hotel should make you comfortable.  The folks at this place know that if they keep you uncomfortable they can get more money out of you.  Maybe it's the same all over Vegas.  But, I didn't feel welcome at the Encore at all.

Stayed here recently for a fam bam trip.

This place rocked my socks off. The only negative would be the long wait for the check-in lines (but what good Vegas hotel doesn't have this?!) Encore, like it's sister (or brother) hotel Wynn, is fabulous with a capital F. 

The hotel lobby and gambling area is immaculate, not smokey and modern looking. The rooms are even better. HUGE room and bathroom. Albeit the shower was a wee bit on the small side and the toilet was a bit "higher" than I'd like it to be (hey, I'm only 5'4!), the room was perfect. I loved that you could control the room settings with a switch of a button. With two quick button presses - voila!  Lights out and drapes closed for bed time. 

If you can get a deal (like we did) and not pay full price, definitely stay here (or at the Wynn). But the Encore was the best hotel I've ever stayed at (in Vegas)

What self proclaimed luxury hotel has cheap, non-existent sound proof windows on the 33rd floor overlooking an obnoxiously loud open-air night club that blares crappy techno music until 5 am? This one.

My boyfriend and I were treated to a Las Vegas graduation trip by his parents. They love the encore and we were given a choice of the Wynn or Encore. The encore rooms looked more aesthetically pleasing so the encore it was.

Room: I really enjoy how theres a wall dividing the living area and the couch area. Its like you have a really cozy suite as compared to Caesars where its one gigantic room that needs more furniture or the Palazzo where you have a "suite" but no room dividers. 2. The couch is incredibly comfortable. I could sleep on that thing. 3. They have a light\/drape control on your nightstand that turns on\/off the lamps\/ceiling lights in the foyer, living area and suite. The lamps also have their own on\/off button so you can really decide to your preference how bright you want your room to be. Note: gotta hold it till it turns all the way on or off. 4. The television swivels so you can watch on the couch or in bed. 5. Privacy button is also on the nightstand control so you dont have to get out of bed to prevent the maid from coming in. 6. Room is probably decorated the best out of all the hotels ive been in so far. Very modern and comfortable. 7. Television comes with a channel guide on the television telling you whats on and also a little paper one telling you which channels are which #.
Bathroom: Shower has an extra showerhead you can pull out. Theres one normal overhead and one you can control. Convenient for rinsing off after a bath or from the pool. 2. Middle of the sink is a makeup mirror and a stool underneath. Its a space saving way for them to have a vanity. Extremely convenient. I love it when they have vanities in the room. 3. Bathroom amenities include: the usual lotion, shampoo, conditioner, hand\/face soap, bath soap, shower cap, qtips along with the not as usual shower gel, shoe polish\/buffer, nail filer, round makeup applicator pads. 4. I forgot makeup remover so i just used those and rubbed some face soap on it and it worked like a charm. 5. Television in bathroom can be viewed very well from the shower and also from the tub. 6. Bathrobes provided. I wasnt that fond of them. Theyre like silk or something on the outside and towel on the inside making them hard to put on. My arm would get constantly stuck in the sleeve.

Hotel is incredible, so much attention to detail. Steve Wynn has a gem! Can't wait for the location in Boston to be opened. A stay can be pricy, but when you walk in the room or through the casino, you understand why! Worth every penny. Room service at 5 AM after a night out highly recommended! Great views of LV!

This review is directed strictly towards the Cocktail Waitresses & valet. 

PLEASE! Don't get me wrong this hotel is BEAUTIFUL! We came here to gamble one night, you know kind of change up the scene, and my cousins friend works here at the encore so we decided to see if he was working so she could visit him, (were from Hawaii so visiting friends in Vegas is a MUST) unfortunately he wasn't working so we decided to walk around the hotel and gamble. 
My husband was really thirsty, we had just finished watching a show and so in between times he hadn't had a drink (water). So he walks up to a cocktail waitress who then gives him attitude. Mind you, we weren't dressed fancy, he was wearing a sweater and shorts, shoes, we weren't dressed ghetto or anything, just not wearing heels and gowns or dress shirts and slacks. The lady (cocktail waitress) ignored him a few times snubbing him when he's only asking for WATER! She then replies this water is taken! Ummm. FOR WHO?  We're spending OUR money on YOUR machines in YOUR casino! He then walks to the bar and the bar tender charges him $5.00 for a small ass bottle of Fiji water. Whole point of this.... JUST because of the way someone dresses, DO NOT assume they are poor, we are not poor in any way, we were spending just as much money on the machines and tables as other people, in fact we could have been the richest people there and that's the way we were treated! Encore and Wynn were on my list to stay while in Vegas, but now i have a bad taste in my mouth for them. 

VALET: We got to the valet and we sat in the waiting room, the BOYS, behind the counter starting swearing up a storm! I'm not sure if they forgot we were in the waiting room, but these guys mouths were filthy! *F THIS F THAT, that F'ing thing!* Dude so FAKE. Another couple came up to the window and they quickly snapped into "FAKE" mode. Also valet here like to crank up the radio. I remember turning it down when we got to valet because my cousin was face timing with her daughter, but once we got the car back it was on 18 vol. 

All in all, not sure if I will be back. Highly disappointed with the service, only nice people were the ones behind the front deck who checked to see if my cousins friend was working... Hate people who would judge a book by its cover.

I agree with the other bad reviews on this yelp page.  I especially agree with what Florio had to say as I had a similar experience with my stay the same weekend! Sidenote: I don't know Florio.  Anyways, this place is a waste of money.  The only good thing about this entire hotel is that XS is downstairs. And beware of the $75 food credit to Andrea's, the place is very overpriced.

We checked in 8\/15\/14 to celebrate two events, our friends getting engaged and my birthday.  The lady at the counter got my information wrong initially, but that was not a big deal.  We checked into the room and I was kind of shocked at how small the room was.  The site made it seem bigger than what it was and I was told that it was about 700 sq. ft.  This room did not feel like that, but whatever right?  We didn't spend much time in the room initially and came back to the hotel kind of late-ish after going to XS.  Around 8am while I was in a sleepy haze I woke up to a disgusting stench of vomit.  I thought maybe my husband threw up or am I just going crazy but it smells like vomit.  I knocked out again and when I woke up around noon I asked my husband did you throw up? What is that smell?  He didnt.  I looked around and right under my nose between the bed and the night stand was small chunks of vomit.  I jumped up and called housekeeping.  The woman on the phone sounded mortified and I felt sort of relieved that this isn't a small deal to them either.  She told me that someone will be up "right away" I asked her okay well do you have an ETA and she said "like right now, right away" I was pleasantly surprised and said okay we'll be here.  40  minutes later, no one was there.  I gave up and went to shower, I finished showering and someone finally came.  So about an hour later after I called.  The nice man who came cleaned it all up and we even tipped him, for something that they should've cleaned before our check in might I add.  Anyways he told us to turn up the AC to get rid of any chemical smell, so we did.  We left to have a late lunch and came back to the room couple of hours later and the vomit smell was back.  I called again and told them the smell was back.  I asked to speak with a supervisor.  He offered me a different room on the same floor or another room on the 29th floor.  Here's the problem with this.  We were on the 51st floor, and we paid extra for the panoramic view.  This was an additional 30 dollars extra per night.  He wanted to move us to a room that was facing the gold course.  WHO wants to face the gold course if they paid EXTRA to see the strip? And who wants to downgrade to the 29th floor? Where you can hear XS right at your ear and again you cannot see the strip! So I told the supervisor really nicely that we paid extra for this view and we're here celebrating and we can't because we have to deal with this stuff.  He said he can't do anything but those options but he could have someone come up and clean the room AGAIN and remove the extra 30 dollar charge for panoramic view.  I accepted the offer and gave him specific instructions on where the vomit was and also suggested that maybe there's vomit elsewhere like under the bed or something like that.  They came in and cleaned the room thoroughly and the smell was gone for the most part.  

As far as staying here to have ease of access to XS, that was the only upside. but to be honest, when I stayed at the Trump which was maybe a little cheaper than the Encore, we had a much better time.  It was right across from Wynn and we had an almost 24 hour shuttle taking us back and forth from the Trump.  It was a really good stay and I felt like I was exploring Vegas more so than when I stayed at Encore because everything was downstairs.  That may be good for others and I thought it would be good for me, but it just wasn't. I will never stay at this hotel if I don't have to. We didn't even get like a bottle of champagne sent up to us or some strawberries, SOMETHING to say hey we're sorry for not cleaning your room properly.  Also what I didn't know till later was that when we first checked in my husband went to use our restroom and there was PEE DROPLETS on the rim of the toilet.  How can you trust a hotel room if the most important part hasn't been cleaned?

Overall, I would never stay at this hotel ever again.  I have stayed at other hotels in Vegas that were less stars than the Encore and I certainly felt like I was important to the hotel.  And honestly if you're staying at the Encore for luxury and ease of access, just don't.  You won't feel the luxury and you will not feel important to them at all.  It's super overpriced and the return is not that impressive.  If they could charge you for breathing their air, they would.  I ordered room service and they charge you 5 dollars for no reason at all and then a mandatory 18% tip.  When I was checking out they asked me how my stay was and I said terrible, I got the "oh im sorry" and that's about i

I'm gonna be one of the few dissenters here and say that Encore is not all that. Why you ask....well....

First, I was SUPER excited to stay at this hotel. From the website and reviews, it seemed like it was gonna be one of the greatest experiences ever in Vegas. What's not to be excited about? Newest hotel on the strip, beautiful decor, huge rooms, amazing restaurants and the hottest club (currently) in Vegas. How can I possibly give it a 2 star rating? Let me explain....

For starters, it's billed as a 5 star resort. As such, I have some expectations on the service that I receive. While at Encore I have to say that the service was less than stellar. Our limo arrived around 11 ish and did anyone greet us? Nope. We were packed for a 2 week vacation and had some luggage. No one came out to assist. Fair enough. Then, the bellhops see that we have this luggage and you think they open the door? Nope. Funny, at the Palazzo and the Venetian the are falling over each other to help. These guys just all turned the other way. Not welcoming at all. Yes, I'm nitpicking, but you know what? You say you are all about the service, yet our experience was that we were a nuisance vs. a guest.

Next, we got to check-in. Like many have already said, it is absolutely terrible. Not nearly enough people working to accommodate the amount of people checking in. Took almost 40 min. to check in. And the lady had a tude, never asked if we wanted an upgrade, if we wanted to schedule any services (spa, cabana, things I specifically asked for when I made the reservation), nothing. Hmmm...def not what I expect in a 5 star resort. 

So, we get to our room on the 60th floor. It's an amazing view....of the Hilton and Circus Circus. Thanks for nothing front desk lady. Now the room itself was actually gorgeous. Super comfortable bed, nice amenities, huge bathroom, exactly what I was expecting. No complaints on the room except the view. Would like to have had a view of the Strip facing all the action, not the decaying part of old Vegas. 

Room service, however, was non-existant. We did not see them for 3 days. 5 star service it was not. Never cleaned the room (not that it was messy) but c'mon at least come in and vacuum, replace the towels and that jazz. Is that too much to ask???

The pool, again, was beautiful but if you get there after 10am in the summer, good luck finding a few chairs for your party unless you spring for a cabana. Frustrating for sure, not finding a place to lay out, but that's our fault for being late not the hotels (but, would it hurt to open up a few of the unsold cabana lounge chairs that NO ONE was using for 2 hrs??)

The restaurants were OK at best. Went to Wazuzu for lunch one day and Switch for dinner. Wazuzu was decent, but again we had a surly server, and Switch was just plain annoying after awhile. 

Never even made it to the casino. Our travel companion went down one night and said they charged him $14 for a drink while he was gambling. What casino in Vegas does that? Encore, that's who. 

All in all, I can't say that we had a great time and that we would stay again. Next time we'll just stick to the Venetian or the Palazzo. I would suggest you do the same too.

I absolutely love this hotel. The service was spectacular with the exception of the front desk. Some of the staff are more courteous and helpful than others. But, the rest of the hotel staff was AWESOME!  I would not stay anywhere else when visiting Vegas that is how nice the suites are!  I usually tend to not do much at the hotel I stay at but Encore was my exception. I ate several nights at their different restaurants and went to their club\/lounge as well. We also had spa services. I swear I didn't want to leave and we stood for a week. You can definitely tell their is an emphasis on customer service and Steve Wynn knows how to deliver a wonderful experience to its customers. I'm planning another trip to Vegas next year and already know we will be staying at the Encore because its that good! 

* The only reason it didn't get 5 stars was because of the front desk staff. But, again the positives far outweigh the negative and thus they have me as a loyal customer.
Worst club ever. Denied me entrance  with my pre paid ticket due to a medication in my purse which I was LEGALLY prescribed. Then accused me of being a drug dealer. Get some class XS.

We are habitual customers of the Wynn and Encore and this last stay was horrible.
We just sent a complaint through the survey from the Encore informing them that while I was walking around the Encore Casino with my wife and son, I was approached by prostitutes.
Also, we were at the 55th floor and we couldn't sleep because at 4:00 am the music from their clubs was ridiculously loud.
This was their response:
_____________________________________________________________________
Thank you for taking the time to participate in our online survey and for your helpful comments and suggestions. I sincerely apologize that you were approached multiple times by undesirable individuals. I deeply regret the noise disturbance you experienced in your room during your stay. We are working with our nightclub management team to resolve this issue. Please be assured that your comments have been shared with our management team and will be reviewed with the highest regard. 

In the interest of regaining your confidence in the level of service normally provided at Wynn Las Vegas, I would like to invite you back to be our complimentary guest for one night in a Resort Room on your next visit to Las Vegas. Please contact our Guest Relations office directly at 702-770-7530, and we will make the necessary arrangements. This offer is non-transferable, based on availability exclusive of holidays and valid for one year from the date of this letter.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Now they are even becoming offensive. I complained because service at the Encore did not use to be like this, not to have their cheap offer of one night at their own availability to "regain" my trust. With this final offer they just proved that they have become just like the other cheap hotels on the strip...

Had a great time this past weekend. Ordered the filet mignon, lobster, New York steak, ribeye, crab legs, and a lot of clam chowder. From the servers at EBC to the chefs in the kitchen, everyone was on point 

Pretty much never left the hotel because we just kept going to EBC, XS, and Intrigue. 5\/5 would come back.

If staying for more than a couple days, don't get a small suite like I was in. Upgrade. Everything within the hotel was fun but if you're in Vegas you better do it right and visit every club, bar, and restaurant you can.

This was my first time staying at this Hotel and it was simply amazing, loved the room and the stores and restaurants and the place itself overall was amazing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great spot, looking forward to visiting it again.

The Encore is nice.  It is a step above the Wynn, but allows for easy access to it so you can easily pass back and forth between the two hotels.  The Tower Suites are nice and the view from the top floors is stunning.    Room service is good and service is excellent.
This place is amazing, staff was great, room service food was very good!!! I recommend it to everyone!

I will NEVER in my life stay at this hotel ever again.  
Let me begin by saying, "Who goes to Vegas for a relaxing vacation??"  If you want to relax, go somewhere quiet... people go to Vegas to gamble and party. 

My friends and I decided to stay here because it was the new Hotel on the perfect side of the strip, plus we'd already stayed at The Palazzo, The Venetian, Caeser's Palace, Planet Hollywood, The Hard Rock, MGM, and Paris.  All of which were good if not great hotels. 

Our suite at Encore was ridiculously small for the amount we were paying (you can get double the size anywhere else).  But it was at the end of the hall where there was really only 1 room to the left of us.  .  We were in the room a total of maybe 3 hours before we went out to the club.  In those 3 hours we got 3 noise complaints because of the music that was playing while we got ready.  REALLY??? Again, who expects it to be QUIET in Vegas.  Then when 2 of my friends came back to the room early, they ordered room service that didn't come til about an hour and 15 minutes later, when they told them 45 minutes.  Then on top of that, the change didn't come until 2 hours later, when they said they would back up with in in 10 minutes.  So, I come back to the room at about 4:00 am, about an hour later a manager knocks on the door and tells us that 2 of us need to leave the room because we got another noise complaint!!  Really, seriously... I hate to say it again, but we're in VEGAS. Luckily, my friend's boyfriend had a room at Planet Hollywood so we just went over there.
I may be a little jaded thinking that most people party when they come to Vegas, but I don't think it's practical to actually try and get decent sleep at an early hour here.  I've been out to Vegas more times than I can even count and have never experienced anything like that before.  We were booked for two nights, but checked out the following morning and stayed the next night at The PALAZZO (BEST HOTEL IN VEGAS)!! 
The only good thing about Encore is its club XS.  It is a beautiful venue, but if you want an awesome Upscale hotel, that won't give you a hard time I would recommend any other hotel on that side of the strip (such as the Palazzo, The Venetian, or Caeser's Palace).

I have never been motivated to write a yelp review before but after an experience during my stay on 4th of July weekend I decided to create an account:

Starting with the negative: my second night of a 4 night stay I went to the club XS (sober) I felt my bag pulled on the dance floor, I look down and my bag was open (not easy to do) phone gone. Clearly a professional.. So yes this is club problem however it is how the hotel handled the situation.  I reported the incident immediately and first security guard was helpful, I filled out paperwork as well as drew on a map where I was located he said they take it very seriously especially because I was a guest at the hotel. So there I was thinking great they will check the cameras that night and maybe catch the guy... 
The next day 2 days I spent hours trying to follow up being sent from dept to dept.and physically asking employees in different depts. Even requesting the security manager to call me. He\/she never did. All I ended up finding out is that security says that they take the matter seriously but they don't check cameras for 48 hours..... Very disappointing. If they had said sorry it happens nothing we can do I would have accepted that but they were very misleading!!!!

Positives:
*very little smoking in casino- very surprising and love it
*restaurants are AMAZING at catering to food allergies (very impressed)
*very nice rooms
*beautiful pools
* room service is quick!

This would have been a 5 star experience even with my phone being stolen it's due to the run-a-round and time I wasted following up on the incident with employees being rude, not caring, or just not following through as presented they would that brings my experience to 3 stars

...like the Wynn but without the flowers, and even less useful shopping venues, and worse restaurants.  Sure it is a beautiful property but honestly I'd rather spend less than half and stay at the center of the strip.  The money saved will allow me to eat at non-Wynncore restaurants.

WOW! this place is wow.. i have been to almost every hotel in vegas and i dont think any other place holds a candle up to this hotel.. Now i know it is vegas and who wants to spend any time in their room, but for the 2 hours that i do sleep in vegas while im there i want it to be the best 2 hours of sleep i will ever have.. It is far beyond.. the bed here is gigantic and extra extra comfy.. almost as comfy as my own bed.. it has black out curtains that are controlled by a push of a button.. this is extra important because i normally stumble to my room at about 730am so blackout curtains is a must.. the showers here are top notch.. you know how most showers in hotels the water is lightly sprinkling out and it takes you 2 minutes just to get all of your hair wet.. yea.. well thats not the case here.. high pressure water.. good sized shampoo and conditioner for those of you who dont bring your own.. did i mention giant tube with jets oh and to top it off a tv in the bathroom to add a cherry to it all... everyone who works here is delightful and are able to mold to different personalities.. i enjoyed gambling here even when i was down.. the people at the table have personality.. and im a big one on that.. they also have some of the best food here in vegas... my only minor issue was that it doesnt contain grab and go places to it.. you know sometimes i dont want to seat down at a 5 star place for lunch.. im hungover and i want some cheap greasy ass deliciousness.. like panda.. but no need to fear.. the mall is right across the street with everything you could ask for.. i cant imagine staying anywhere else after i have stayed here.. this place kicks other hotels in vegas ass.. it rocks and it will make ur vegas trip that much better.. oh and they also have the best club here.. anyone heard of xs?!

Seriously. Stop with feathers. They are not luxurious. They are death. Literally and figuratively. Allergy ridden and just plain nasty. Why do all hotels think feathers are terrific?????

Regardless. Check in was a disaster. Supposed to be in a room across hall from coworker -instead far far away. Even after $20 tip. So flawed. 

Management tried to rectify but then another hassle. 

I thought Wynn encore was superior. Not so sure anymore.

::Birthday weekend Vegas Trip::
02\/18-02\/21

My bestfriend (cbooz.yelp.com)  and I are both born in February, the month of Lovers (but we are not lovers, don't get it twisted)
We decided to do something together considering we just turned the BIG TWO FIVE!! (well that's what he was telling all the cab drivers!)
What better place to celebrate, act a fool, and go balls to the wall than LAS VEGAS!!

We usually stay at the Palazzo, but this trip we wanted to do something different. The ENCORE did not disappoint!

GOOD: 
- My friend asks for a "complimentary upgrade" for our room. A 50 dollar tip later and we got one of the best views of the strip!! (along with an extra roll away bed and a refrigerator)
- The view. As you press the control button to open the curtains, the Strip is in plain sight. Gives you that "This city is mine" mentality.
- The room was so spacious. Four dudes in a suite requires lots of room (we need workout space, runway space, DANCE DANCE space...)

BAD:
- Getting to the rooms at the ENCORE can be confusing. Good thing the guys followed my lead. Otherwise they would always end up getting lost.
- I was the designated bartender that night. Mixing drinks left and right. Got a little too wasted. Remember telling my friend, "you need to get on MY level. My Tolerance is waayy up here and yours is down there"

UGLY:
- As fast as the trip came, it ended so much faster. The weekend was a blur. Time really does fly when you are having fun!
- There's one pic that the four of us guys took that probably won't ever end up on the internet or at least we hope not!

There were numerous moments that I won't forget from that trip. From getting faded in the room, fist pumping, topless dancing (me), some guy throwing a footlong sandwich at another guys leg, then that guy kicking it 10 ft in the air, "bandys" and so much more! 

One moment that stood out was when "Forever Young" was playing.  It reminded us guys that no matter how old we get, we will always be Forever young at heart. That trip was a blast and I am glad to have done "big thangs" with the fellas.

Can I get an ENCORE? 

Most definitely yes!

One of the most beautiful room I've stayed in. Wonderfully decorated, clean and fresh! I love the doorbell by the way. I love the ability to control the curtains, lights, put up the "do not disturb" all by the touch of a finger in BED! YEA...I need to get one at home. I judge alot of hotel room by their bathroom and I love the bathroom. Roomy and gorgeous! Watching tv while brushing my teeth, heck yeah. An incentive to stand there and brush my teeth for the full 2 minutes, maybe more! Mini-Bar is hella expensive though...Staff there is top notched!

I really wish Wynn would offer a little more for their guests though. Ghetto as it may be...I still like getting freebies at these sort of resorts. I mean I got them staying at Venetian and it was soo much cheaper. 

I would definitely stay here again but so many more resorts to try before I decide on my favorite.

Had a truly luxurious stay in the king suite with the panoramic view this weekend. There was a console on the night stand and entrance to control the light switches and drapes, very modern!  I could just sit on the sectional and stare at the view all day. We were on the 60th floor and were able to see the strip, golf course  and the mountains all around. Unlike other hotels, the room walls are well insulated. I did not hear anyone next door or in the hallways. The housekeeping also do a very awesome job, the room was spotless!  I also loved the vibrant colors of the main parts of the hotel  and walkways.  Will definitely go back again!

I'm on a flight returning and thinking the there is nothing in Vegas that would really want me to go back...Except for the Encore.  This place was Heaven on earth.  Every room is a suite and we got upgraded to the 62nd floor and somehow were given a $100 resort credit to spend.
 The Dream bed is beyond belief.  All around a nicer, smaller hotel than the Wynn...Although the restaurants could have better quality food for the crazy high prices they charge...The food at the 3 we tried was just average.  Still gets 5 stars though because the only thing I can say that was truly bad about our experience was leaving the luxury and going back to the reality of a tiny Manhattan apartment.

Celebrated two birthdays for kids ages 21 and 23 from Thurs to Monday at the Encore. Arranged for two online resort rooms (two Queens and one king).  Went when off peak summer rates started on June 2. Paid 339 for Thursday 424 for Fri, Sat. + 254 for Sunday. We invited a friend to join us so we tried to get two doubles daily one week before we left but due to convention Queens were gone.  That morning i called they said there were some Queens available at upgraded rooms but that we would have to request that at check-in and I could not secure it over the phone.  The woman at registration who helped us seemed pretty young, Briona.  I tried waiving a $50 bill in front of her to see if we could get a complimentary upgrade. We thought we had a chance since we were celebrating 2 bdays and when I had called that morning to check on the Queens they told us they were only at 50-60% capacity.   Disappointed to learn Briona offered no free upgrade but instead a comp cot since we were celebrating a bday (value $50 a night). Tried to see if we could upgrade at least one room to a tower suite because then you have access to the tower pool, exclusively for people staying in the towers. Stayed at Caesars palace and Mandalay bay and we know how crowded the pools can get so if you rent a space for one day with a couple of lounge chairs and an umbrella it is like $1000 so we thought it would be a good investment if we didn't get a comp upgrade to take advantage of any Wynn insider special that we could get (sign up at the Wynn website). Briona offered an upgrade to the encore parlor suite which is a step above the encore tower suite and usually $1000 a night for a discounted rate that averaged an addl $250 per night. We tried to get the room with two queens upgraded but the Queen suites were not available (which was sad since they told me that morn when I called that they were).  We upgraded the king and ask them to take the cot there. This gave us the chance to give a "tower" key to everyone in our party so they could go to the tower pool. We tipped Briona $25 (rather than 50) since we didn't get the upgrade but the free cot saved us $200 and we did get more than the regular 15% off of our room. She told us there was no need but we gave it to her for all the time she spent with us and she did go back a couple of times to speak to her "manager". I read about upgrades for people who were celebrating a bday in a month so if you don't get it don't feel compelled to tip, we were feeling generous.  There was lots of great stuff for tower people. First you have your own registration area with like 5-6 people working.   We didn't register there because we were "resort" people when we walked in, but we registered on a Thursday at 230 so there really was no line, unlike Fridays where it gets busy. In the tower registration we saw one person wait Friday and two on sunday, other than that no one waited. You have 1-2 personal concierge people there as well to make dinner reservations and answer your questions. You have your own entrance where you can have your cab or town car drive you to\/from the airport. They have their own bell men.  The rooms are as amazing as everyone else has reported on yelp. Our resort room was on the same floor so all we had to do was walk out the suite room and walk through a couple of doors (we were told you would need a key to enter the suites area from the other wing but you didn't) and we were three doors away from our resort room. The suite had a bedroom with a door separating the sitting area and two bathrooms with a massage room that we never used. An 80 min massage at the spa is $290 in the room it is $400.  It was nice but the resort rooms are pretty nice too, even though they don't have as much square footage. We had a refrigerator in the suite and they didn't. The suite was ready when we checked in and they told us they would text us when the resort room was ready so we just went to the suite, the bell man brought all the bags. We went to the family pool by the registration area.  You show your card and you are offered two towels each, a beer was $9.  The European pool was right behind it with only sculptured landscaping separating them. No security checking ID's.  The one at Caesar's was like Fort Knox.  They had a bar and plenty of gambling tables.  At night it is transformed to the outdoor part of a club (xs) so they remove the lounge chairs and bring in comfortable seating.  The resort room wasn't ready until around 7pm. Our daughter is a vegan, and unless you have a vegan family member you do not have any idea what it is like to brainstorm breakfast, lunch, and dinner when you are out of town. Every restaurant on the Wynn properties had amazing choices for vegans to include the Steve Wynn burger, French toast, pastas, and desserts galore. Chocolates were sent to our rooms the next day from Briona for each of the kids. About 70% of the employees were 5 star but we found 30% were not impressive.

The Encore is the standard by which I compare all others hotels too. Hands down, from check-in to check-out,  from the valets to the house keeping staff and everyone in between this is absolutely the best hotel bar none and the only place I ever stay in Vegas.

What to add to the 5 star  rating. ...... From the whimsical lobby with the beautiful blown glass chandeliers it pairs and compliments the Wynn . The bedroom interior is more spacious at the Encore than Wynn , decor is more grown up colors of creams, gold, and black. The seating area is larger with an L sectional so plush. The tub and restroom as always is marbled with  charm and The view at the Wynn has a great sunset with panorama  Canyon view while the Encore has more back strip and canyon views. I did like the pool at the Encore better than the Wynns, but either hotel is a win, even for the discerning  aficiando ~

Just finished four spectacular day's at Encore. My husband and I stayed at Encore from Thursday to Monday. This was our first stay at a Wynn property. Previously we have stayed at Belagio,The Hotel at Mandalay and Palzazzo. This was by far our favorite. Everything from restaurants to pools were excellent. We did venture over to a few other hotels Fri and Sat night but we were very glad to be returning to the serenity of the Encore.

Stayed on the 37th floor with the floor to ceiling windows(amazing views) and the magic controls by the front door and beside the bed to control the lights, blinds, sheers, etc.  The room was a suite and is very nicely appointed.  Bed is comfy with 6 pillows, bathroom was spotless and the 42" flat screen didn't hurt either.

The Encore's personnel make you feel welcome and appreciated from check in to check out.  I needed some shoes shined and called down to the Bell Desk at 5 a.m. and a person answered straight away and had someone come up to the room and pick up the shoes. When I returned the shoes were back in my room and had a shine on them like i've never seen before.

The only reason the Encore doesn't rate 5 stars is due to the expense of food within the hotel and distance from all the action on the strip.

My husband I stayed here for our honeymoon in March. The hotel was beautiful but the experience was just so-so. First we checked in and went to our room , which we paid extra per night to upgrade to have a view, and when we got there our door wouldn't open. They sent a very unfriendly person to help us. The door was jammed. Once we got in we found that every time we needed to open it we would have to push or pull extra hard to get in. We were not offered a different room. The pool below us was blasting music at 9am and woke us up and continued all day and night. Was like being at the actual pool. Not very romantic for our honeymoon. Not once were we congratulated on our marriage even though my husband called weeks before to let them know why were there to be sure it was a flawless and magical honeymoon. This hotel did nothing above and beyond to help us celebrate or feel special. When a newly wed couple comes to Vegas over all other possible destinations, they expect a little more than your regular trip. This was very disappointing. The guards at the elevator NEVER smile when you pass them. We spend hours and lots of money gambling there each day and RARELY a had a cocktail server come by to serve us. We ended up going to the Mirage for gambling since they had many friendly servers available and our luck was much better there. Overall the hotel is just fancy-looking but the service and experience is poor. We are planning our next trip in the fall\/winter for our birthdays but will not return to this hotel. We plan to find a hotel that will make our "Redo Honeymoon" the way it should have been originally. This hotel is over priced for what it actually is. The buffet is the only good thing here.

We just came back from staying at the Encore for two nights and overall, it was really great.  The five star review comes with a caveat -- we stayed mid-week in the middle of the summer, so our king suite was just $200 a night -- a steal that must be done. *** Without the suite, my review would drop down to a 4.
Why 5-star?
1. The service is top-notch and we didn't have even to glance up to have people swarming us every second to ask if we needed anything. Check-in and check-out took five minutes.
2. The decor and layout are amazing. I'm not a fan of Jeff Koons but there was plenty of other art and cool stuff to look at (fountains, waterfalls, carousel -- even the carpet is pretty cool!) as you waltz through both the Encore and the Wynn, which are connected, and the adjoining high-end stores (Alexander McQueen, Louis Vuitton, Graff, etc.) that connect the two hotels.  It was fun to window shop!  
3. The room was just perfect: the Dream bed lives up to its reputation and now we're saving money to purchase this bed for ourselves so we can have this experience every night. We were on the 59th floor (definitely opt for a high floor if you can) and the sweeping views from the floor to ceiling windows kept us entertained at all hours.  The mini-bar was *fully* stocked (including a "pleasure pack* -- yes!) but there was no coffee machine (understandably -- a waste of space - who drinks that stuff any more?). The wi-fi was pretty good, but not perfect.
4. The luxury here is the newness of the facility, the cleanliness (spotless mostly) and the amenities that are available. 
5. The pool is lovely and a much needed respite from the 106-degree heat. Definitely get there early to score chairs in the shade. They provide towels, ice water (yes!!) and while we were there, we got free grapes and bottled water.  If you're feeling spendy, there are killer cabanas available that surround the pool, where you have lounges set up and cool water sprayed into the cabana -- nice....also, you can reserve umbrellas and chairs inside the pool.
6. The casino was fun and not too smoky (compared to other hotels we went to) - we even won a little, so that was cool.  One of the slots I had let me play poker for 15 minutes on a dollar.
7. This is not a "family-oriented" resort (thank you!!), but rather a playground for adults. The restaurants clearly state that children under 5 are not allowed in the dining room.  For some reason, a lot of today's parents do not understand that children under five should NOT be allowed in a fine dining establishment, so this rule was MUCH appreciated.  As a result, there were no screaming kids anywhere in the resort. Excellent!

All this comfort costs money, so take some moulah!  Drinks inside were $12 each, at the pool - $15.  Double lattes + bagel + muffin = $25. Just a heads up!  Mostly, food was pretty good, although expensive for what you get. Our lunch at society cafe was good, but not great (my turkey "pastrami" sandwich was kind of gross even though the waitress had recommended it) but the best part was when the chef came out to discuss my husband's tree nut allergy (wow! didn't expect that) and we went to the Buffet for breakfast (all-you-can-eat - two of us - about $50) and the corn pancakes were ice cold and inedible, even though we arrived when the Buffet opened. I know...strange, but there it is.

***Part of the luxury besides the deal on the room mid-week was that it was not very crowded when we were there. Friday, it started to get a bit crowded, so I highly recommend staying during the week.

Would I stay here again?  Yes, provided we stay in a king suite. ;)

I booked 3 days here after receiving an enticing offer in the mail (although I'm not sure how they got my name and address since I had not signed up for a players card with them or stayed previously) for discounted stay + 2 tix to Le Reve.

I had no problems checking in and getting a room right away early in the morning.  I was told I also got 1 free buffet per day.  When I checked out, this turned out not to be the case -- so minus one star for incompetent desk staff misleading me (I think she may have confused my offer for another offer?).  It would be two stars if management wasn't willing to meet me halfway, so that's something at least.  I suggest that you only follow what you've been given in writing, if you stay here.

Pros - Soundproofing from outside and from other rooms is very good;  Temperature regulation is great;  Much to my great shock, I did pretty well at the slots here (hey, it does make you feel better about the whole experience when you win); Generous selection of toiletries;  Blackout curtains were effective (would be even better if they overlapped a little at the center and didn't leave a small gap, though this is the case with 99% of hotels -- however THEhotel's curtains work this way, and I've seen it a few other times);

Meh - Room decor was not appealing for me, and I prefer when the bedroom is separate;  I'm normally not a buffet person (and can no longer eat more than a non-heaped plate or two) and while this is probably the nicest buffet in Vegas, I would never have paid for it for what they're asking, maybe half that, it was just okay, the menu did not really change from day to day, some items were tasty but many were not, or were cold or over- or undercooked, and most of the desserts were way way too sweet (and this is coming from a very devoted dessert fiend); Shower pressure and temperature (this was way better in their spa with the same equipment); Cell service not too good from inside room.

Cons - Wi-Fi was slow and unstable; soundproofing from out in the hall not so great -- and Saturday night was awful with people making noise out there all night and the room next door having a nasty screaming fight around 2 am (of course, this can happen anywhere); drugstore\/sundries shops are about as expensive as the minibar in your room (i.e. highway robbery); Bathroom seemed reasonably clean overall, but bath rugs were nasty and crunchy feeling, like they never get washed & mysterious black streaks on the bottles.

Le Reve was great, and it was awesome not having to pay to see it (and no issues on the billing on that front).  I would probably stay again if I got a similar deal and had someone to take up to Vegas with me next time.  Otherwise I will probably stay somewhere else more relaxing.  Encore (and Wynn) had much more of a loud party atmosphere than I expected, and that's not what I'm looking for.

My favorite hotel anywhere.  Clean, beautiful, and quiet.  Service is top notch, great views, and lots of natural sunlight.  I love the large windows and how every detail has been thought of in advance.

New hotel.  Large rooms with sitting area.  Across the street from a shopping mall and food court so you can actually eat cheaply.  One of their pools is for topless bathing, so no kids there.  Beautifully decorated lobby areas.  

Entrance to the parking is off the Strip itself - a good thing to know if you're driving because going around the block takes forever because the blocks are so large here.  

Attached high end shopping mall.
Great hotel. Rooms are huge and many advanced technological gadgets. Weekend brunch buffet was amazing and worth the price! Will definitely stay here again.

It was my first time staying at encore in March and I have to say this place was stunning! My bf and I fell in love with our room. The double sinks, the tub, the shower, and the list goes on! I was offered a 2 night package deal which includes 2 nights stay with 2 tickets to the show La Reve and 2 complimentary lunch buffet. The line to the buffet was too long but the show was very good! I definitely would be coming back here again!
A great place to stay! The 5-star rooms are absolutely beautiful! The dinning experience was only average for this 5-star hotel and the restaurant prices were far too high.

All I can say id just book it. This is by far one of the best hotels in America. Everything is upscale. The bathroom is BEAUTIFUL and the room was superb. Bring your bubble bath because the tub is spotless and welcoming. 

We stayed at Encore from Monday to Friday in room 5441 with a view of the mountains. Opened the drapes every morning with the push of a button from the bed. Called the front desk or housekeeping and they refer to you by name. 

I also enjoyed the Euro pool- topless of course. I have never gone topless in a public pool but I was in Vegas and they designed the pool for people to go topless. Don't worry, if you are not as bold they also have a family pool. 

One thing, get ready to pay for the luxury. A small bottle of vodka in the fridge in the room is $29. My husband went to the liquor store (3 minute walk) and got the same thing $12. The restaurants are also pricey but we were on vacation so we ate at each at least once. The yogurt with granola and fresh berries was my favorite ($11) at Society and the steak and eggs were good. My husband enjoyed the frittata and the frosted flake french toast   

I can honestly say that I enjoyed my stay at Encore and look forward to going back.
Yeni a√ßƒ±lan bu otel s√ºper isterseniz odada bile pizza i√ßiyorsunuz. Very cigar friendly.

If you can sum up Encore in one word, which would you choose? Baaaallin'!! My first impression of the place wasn't great because of all the different valet locations they had. I literally had to hit all 3 until I got to the right one. They had one for the casino, one for the suites, and one for regular rooms. If you go straight back, you'll hit the self-parking garage.

We checked in Friday afternoon and were given many different options on rooms. We finally decided on a queen bed but at a higher level in the hotel. Everything was super high tech. From the controlled doorbell (instead of hanging up a do not disturb sign, just hit the privacy button and the do not disturb phrase will display by the doorbell), remote controlled lights and curtains, and the separate shower heads. 

Their beds were ultra comfortable. Double comforters?! It's like sleeping on clouds! Whenever my head touched the bed, I knocked out. One of the nights, I woke up at the foot of the bed. I think I fell asleep watching TV? Speaking of, their TV is awesome. You can turn it 360 degrees, so you can watch it in bed or on the couch in the living room. They have all the channels you'd ever need and they also had channels strictly for music. This was super convenient when we were getting ready to hit the clubs.

I was totally feeling the red, black, and white colors used throughout the hotel. The red chandeliers hanging in the casino added an interesting touch. I noticed the casino didn't have the usual cigarette stench. It was really clean and the air wasn't stuffy. 

They have two different pools. The main pool was family-friendly, whereas the european pool (21+) was off to the side where XS is at (which is THE Vegas club right now). We stuck to the main pool since it had more chairs. Drinks were expensive, but darn good. Get the Miami Vice if you want to get a good buzz going.

I'd recommend this hotel to couples or older people. Since it is at the end of the strip, it's not as popping as say Palazzo and Venetian. Their casino wasn't as busy as other casinos. All the celebrity sightings weren't bad too (Hugh Jackman, Usher, and David Spade). Encore is as good as it gets, everyone needs to experience this hotel at least once.

Excellent room, great employees, and nice gym. Warning: if you will be going to bed before 4am, please ask for room facing the strip as the other rooms face the pool and the encore beach club that is opened all night? The music and base noise can be heard from our 9th floor room. Even worse were our neighbors who were smoking pot on non smoking floor who kept us up til 5am. We asked for room switch and initially were told no rooms were available. Hours later, the encore came through with a new room facing the strip and normal neighbors. Our keys were reprogrammed in seconds and we grabbed our stuff and went right to new room. Never had to go downstairs to check out. The process was amazingly quick and we thought it was customer service at its best. The employees there made you feel like royalty and truly worth commending. We will surely come back and stay here again. Only negative thing is you have to walk to the wynn for almost everything including poker room, buffet, and sports book.

They really redeemed themselves!! Mr.  Curtis Borja called to apologize and make it up to us.  This is the level of professionalism that is expected from 5 star hotel.  Thank you so much for taking the time to reach out,  listen and make it better.  We will definitely give this beautiful hotel another chance.  Thanks again

If you're looking for opulence, bright colors music and luxury Encore could be your place. Room rates are not bad if you start your stay on Sunday through mid week.

Your arrival:
Driving in through the valet is convenient but of course there's the daily parking fee, 

Restaurants:
Food at restaurants is decent and the ambience is above par but be pre-prepared to play to pay "on the strip" prices

Rooms:
Fabulous!! See my photo

This hotel is gorgeous but overpriced.  Here's my take:
Rooms - really nice, clean & spacious
Service Overall  - meh
Front desk  - meh
Reservations line - my experience calling was always pleasant 
Bars & Lounges - nice but too expensive
Clubs - didn't go
Restaurants - nice but too expensive
Pools - ok
Resort fees - annoying
Spa - fantastic!
Shows - saw Le Reve and enjoyed it
Shopping - no way!  $250 for a pair of swim trunks!!

I don't see the difference between this resort's much higher price tag on everything compared to that of other Vegas hotels.  Except for the spa I was not impressed with the level of customer service through out the resort.  The Wynn & Encore boast their 5 star rating but I remain unimpressed.  Service is just OK to mediocre.  

I've stayed here twice with similar results.  I would only return if I had a special packaged deal or comp'ed rooms.

The resort grounds itself is great, however the service is definitely not 5, 4, or even 3 star.
Heads up---The resort credit can NOT be used towards upgrades, even if they told you at check-in it could be
David one of the wanna be security guards (checks to make sure you have a room card before getting on elevator) is very abrasive and unprofessional.

Do NOT order room service if your planning on getting a HOT plate.

Overall, it's unfortunate that such a beautiful resort is not customer service focused

Definitely will not be back, Wynn the sister resort appeared to be more service oriented.

Steve Wynn has blessed us with another great hotel and casino. If you are planning to visit Vegas, you must stay here! From the moment you walk in, the staff treats you like the king and queen of Zamunda. You won't get flowers at your feet or pesos with your face on it but a genuine smile and do appreciate your business.

Love the vibrant red colors, butterfly accents, and chill down tempo house music. Down to the gardens of flowers to the casino ceilings, extreme attention to detail is given throughout Encore. You feel ultimately cool just by staying here. 

Our suite was just as glamorous and sexy. We had an amazing view of the Wynn and the strip. No outside food or drinks are allowed, only purchases from the Wynn and Encore. Room service is available all day or even try one of restaurants they have to offer.

When you walk through the lobby, guests have immediate entry to the pool area. There are two separate pools, one for families and conservative guests and the European pool is for the 21+ and topless sunbathers. I got distracted by the ebony statue who was swimming laps. Anyways, for the freek-a-leeks, cameras are not allowed in this area. The waitress are very attentive and the staff works hard to keep this area neat and organized. 
 
If you have to do any last minute shopping or are hungry, you right across the street from Fashion Show Mall. You can't go wrong with 250 shops and restaurants and seven department stores! 

When you stay here, you might come home broke but it is well worth the stay!

We stayed in the Tower Suites at the Encore. Rooms are beautiful, nicely appointed (though I agree with the reviewer who noted that Wynn really cheaped out by not allowing you to even use the refrigerator without a fee). Soap and amenities are nice, not fabulous. Bed is to die for and I love the curtains that you can operate from the bed. Rooms are clean and comfortable with lots of drawer space. The staff is nothing short of spectacular and accommodating: they get 5 stars. 

Now..the not so nice:  Initially we were put into a room overlooking the adult pool area and night club. Most of the day and night, despite being on the 26th floor, we were subjected to the bass thump. Most annoying. We mentioned it to the concierge who mentioned it to someone and they moved us to a North-facing suite. Delightful. But seriously, anyone who overlooks the pool will suffer through the techno-beat in the daytime as well as at night. Also, Wynn is clearly trying to attract the young, trust-funder or otherwise Red-Bull-fueled, trucker-hat-wearing, recently-rich crowd with lots of money and absolutely no class. I mean, I enjoy a drink (or more) and a good time but this crowd was so bad the hotel personnel had to apologize for their behavior to other, less inebriated clientele. I felt bad for the staff having to put up with their behavior while still being polite. And I hate to think of the mess they must leave in the rooms. Eww. I can understand wanting that demographic to blow their parents' money or their recently earned tech\/oil\/etc money in your hotel, but really can they not have an "adults only" experience? And I don't mean x-rated, but you know, adult. 

Take-away: If you want a 5 star experience, don't stay here. The hotel suites and staff are 5-star, the clientele they cater to is strictly B-movie\/in-your-face\/porn star.

Hey kids! Today's review of Encore Las Vegas is brought to you by the color: RED.

It's perfectly true and I'm not mistaken when I say -- that Stephen A. Wynn consistently raises the bar with every subsequent property he introduces to the world famous Las Vegas Strip.

Let's take a jog down memory lane to familiarize ourselves with this man's accomplishments in Sin City, shall we?

1989 - Mr. Wynn's The Mirage resort opens.  It's the most expensive hotel and casino project ever built at the time at a cost of $630 million (keep in mind, this was '89).  The Mirage is often considered the grand-daddy of today's Las Vegas, for igniting the building boom trend of themed mega-resorts and jump-starting tourism back into Sin City at a time where Atlantic City was becoming the hot gambling mecca in America. Way to turn the tables back around!

1993 - Steve compliments The Mirage with a similar tropical-themed sister resort right next door: Treasure Island.  Featured the first free strip-front live entertainment show and a unique theme that brought kids and their parents in, during a period when Vegas as a whole was appealing to families.

1998 - Opulence and modern luxury is born on the Vegas strip with the most expensive hotel and casino built (again) at the time.  Wynn's magnificent $1.6 billion Bellagio resort heralded in a new era of posh and exclusivity to the strip that 11 years later, is still unmatched by a majority of properties in town.

2005 - After selling off his interests and ownership of his previous properties, he takes the money from the sale and sinks it into what Vegas junkies and visitors now know as Wynn Las Vegas.  Taking the ultra-luxury concept of his Bellagio resort and magnifying it two-fold, his $2.7 billion dollar baby is so influential that room rates elsewhere on the strip are priced accordingly to the rates set here.

Late 2008\/TODAY - Ah. Here we are. To the topic at hand.

ENCORE.

and the color RED.

Now, I haven't stayed at this hotel as a guest, YET. This is mainly a review of the casino and its public areas, which I've had the delight of enjoying.

The first thing I noticed when my eyes took in the grandeur of this hotel's casino was how BOLD and DAZZLING the decor it is. The color red (and other 154 color-palette variations of it) is splashed EVERYWHERE. From the detailed butterfly-print carpeting to the lavish wall drapes, from the lighting fixtures to even the outfits worn by some of the resort employees. RED RED RED.

It's the polar opposite of the typical gorgeous, but rather vanilla casino  that you'd experience at The Palazzo or Bellagio. Though very elegant, Encore's decor is so loud, that you might just want to put on those shades hanging on the front of your shirt.

Encore takes design cues from her sister hotel with unrestrained use of glass EVERYWHERE. This results in natural light filtering into the casino and public areas, which lends to a very "airy" and calming environment. A big stark contrast to casinos like at The Mirage, where you feel like you're betting money inside a dark, monstrous cavern.

Suspended intermittently from the low and intimate ceilings in each of the four gambling quadrants are stunning (and extremely expensive) elaborate hand-blown glass murano chandeliers, custom tailored with a unique color --- Wynn "tulip," created specifically for this casino. I toured a well-known hand-blown glass manufacturer and dealer (specialized mostly in chandeliers) on a trip to Venice last December, and a custom chandelier of similar size easily ran over $20,000 A PIECE (a light fixture that costs as much as a brand new car!). There are more than 179 of those floating around in the Encore casino alone. Now do the math. No expenses have been spared here, people.

Just a testament to how much effort they put into the "show" of this place, as I strolled through the Encore shopping esplanade, I was taken aback to see a resort employee on a miniature forklift vacuuming the dust off the leaves on one of the indoor palm trees lining the walkway. WTF? That's attention to detail, to the EXTREME.

The casino floor here isn't very big. It's got more of a boutique vibe to it, where a smaller and more intimate gambling experience was envisioned and executed, as opposed to a massive sprawling casino floor that stretches on for what seems like miles (like @ MGM Grand).

I love new casinos. All of their slots were high-tech and spiffy, with those little LCD screens that displays slot club information and point balances and were a lot more engaging and interesting to play.

Cocktail waitresses are extremely friendly, quick to bring your drink, and part you with a smile. Can't say the same about the wenches at The Venetian casino.

It also doesn't hurt to credit this casino that I won $200 after a few spins at a 5 cent reel machine. :)

Hopefully I'll have the opportunity to stay as a guest here in the near future.

We went to the Wynn hotel for a couple getaway and left impressed with the luxury of the hotel and rooms. We always remembered the rooms being the best we've experienced in Vegas. 

Encore lives up the the hype of our first experience with the Wynn. We stayed in an upgraded King suite and the room and linens were of premium quality and the flat screen HD tv was nice. The room was the nicest I've been in in Vegas. 

The housekeeping service was prompt and courteous. The employees were all courteous and helpful. The only negative was that the tv remote was not working when we arrived (but was quickly replaced by housekeeping) and the line to the front desk was busy and went to voicemail. 

The casino felt smaller than some of the other highend casinos on the Strip and they did not have their own poker room so we had to go to the Wynn which wasn't a big deal but something to keep in mind.

The Encore is as high class as you can get in Vegas. Some of the best restaurants and best night clubs in the world are in this hotel. You will not find many families with kids here, this hotel is for the singles and couples without children folks. XS and Surrender and Encore Beach Club are the night\/day clubs here and if you have ever been to any of them you know that they have some of the best parties in Vegas. The amenities at Encore are outstanding, the pool is luxurious, the suites are large and spacious, the golf course is amazing(from what I've heard) and the view from the rooms is breathtaking!
 
However, I have one gripe, which probably was a one time thing, I'm hoping.  I had reserved a double queen suite for Memorial Day Weekend two months in advance, but when I got there to check in they told me they gave my room away and it was "first come first serve". You can just imagine how pissed off I was. I'm not paying $400 per night to argue with the hotel front desk about what I reserved and what they think I reserved. I even showed them the email confirmation that showed I reserved a double queen suite(the regular single queen suite is almost half the size of a double queen suite and costs $50 less per night). The girl at the front desk and her manager refused to acknowledge that the single queen suite was $50 less and obviously played dumb. After some arguing, I finally convinced them to knock off the $50 per night. At that point it was all about principle. If you are going to give away my room that I reserved 2 months in advance the least you can do is give me the correct price of the smaller room? For a Five star hotel, the front desk employees should be able to recite the pricing on the website from memory. The next day a double queen suite opened up and we moved to the new room which was much much more spacious, which is why I reserved it in the first place. 

Other than that misunderstanding(it was the busiest weekend of the year), the Encore is top notch and I would stay there again just because it is one of the three nicest hotels in Vegas, hands down!!  One thing I forgot to mention, if you are staying there and want to party at Encore or Surrender or EBC, just talk to the concierge and ask if you can get tickets.  Most of the time those parties are sold out, but if you are staying at the hotel you get privileges!  Also, if you don't get one of the high end suites, I highly recommend the double queen suite.  It has so much more room and square footage than a king suite.

I LOVE ENCORE! the rooms are beautiful! and huge! hugh tv! amazing view at night from you room. a bunch of my girlfriends and i stayed here and it's very convenient to have connecting doors. There are mirrors all along the hall way and the whole wall on the other side is also a mirror, great for a bunch of girls getting ready to go out. So you don't have to fight over the bathroom mirror, everyone can get ready at the same time :) which means more time to party and less time to get dolled up!! there are pretty good clubs to go to that are near by when your looking for a fun night out. XS and Surrender nightclub is just downstairs so no need for a taxi. The wynn is right next door so there you can go to Tryst night club or enjoy their buffet in the day time. The mall is right across the street and is walking distance so again you dont need to waste money on a taxi. To stay at encore it can get a little pricey but there are always deals online so you just have to check. Considering it's a fairly newer hotel you get what you pay for. I would definitely come back especially in the summer time for all the fun pool parties :)

I refuse to stay anywhere else while I'm in Vegas, and, once I check in, will hardly leave since the hotel has all the stuffs that I need--fine dining, casual dining, a Sportsbook, tables, slots, cafes, a pool, an adult pool, several bars, XS (which is Tryst, but gaudier), great service, friendly patrons, and guest rooms with walls covered in floor to ceiling mirrors. It's one of my favorite places. Probably because I associate it with morning shots, fine food, and drunkenness.

The rooms are comfortable and spacious with a living area, a couple of flat screen TVs, floor to ceiling window, and a king sized bed. Restrooms have a tub, vanity, his and her sinks, and shower. The place is pristine. Customers of the Wynn and Encore can easily travel back and forth between the two. Also, the hotels are right across the street from the Fashion Show Mall and the Palazzo.

Notables: Well ventilated casino and hotel so that smoke and other irritants in the air are minimal. Wynn may have better ventilation. Older clientele who aren't as chaotic, obnoxiously loud, or disrespectful as those who sometimes roll in droves to the Venetian or New York New York. Though, on 3 separate visits here, younger men have approached me in the casino area to subtly ask me if I was a prostitute.

Gorgeous spacious room but overshadowed by:
1. No in room coffee maker. You don't want to know how much I paid for room service coffee. 
2.  Have to pay for internet access, per device!
3.  Poorly designed air\/ventilation system recirculates stale air only in the living area, the bedroom doesn't even get recirculated (let alone fresh). I spent all night rebreathing CO2.

I've stayed in most of the hotels in vegas.    By far this was our favorite.   It was elegant, clean , and customer service driven.   The meals we had were delicious.  Room service came in a timely manner. I have nothing to complain about.   Next time we stay in a hotel we will be staying at Wynn or encore. :)

Ok - although the initial "welcome" to the property was lacking, I must admit - the Encore is pretty spectacular. Related to my check-in situation, property management kindly contacted me to empathetically address my experience. I was very appreciative of the candor and professionalism by the individual I spoke with. Overall, I got to know the property pretty well: I dined multiple times at Jardin (the lobster benedict is amazing) and the Lobby Bar & Cafe, danced at XS, and utilized the Encore Spa. Overall...Encore's amenities\/restaurants and service earn top marks. I will undoubtedly elect to stay here again.

SIMPLY AMAZING!

You can officially called me spoiled after my 5 day stay at the Encore. Ive been to a few other casinos on the strip and the Encore is simply the best.

Our check-in on Monday was flawless. The entire Wynn and Encore staff is top notch often calling you by name. Our room a Deluxe King Suite was as usual spectacular with over 600 square feet of space. On this trip we decided to take advantage of what the Encore has to offer...

During our stay my wife and I dined at the Society cafe for dinner and Tableau for breakfast. All the food was amazing! They now offer vegan specialties if you want to eat healthy. Yes, the prices are high but this is a boutique resort so you have to expect it.

My wife also had the opportunity to use the salon and spa. She couldn't stop raving about it. She was in Heaven! So much so that she practically begged me to use the spa which I did. Its spectacular and a great place to recover after a night of partying on the strip.... A MUST go if you are a guy or a gal.

We also had a chance to use the pool. There is a public area and a European area for adults. We chose the European side at its sunnier and quieter. The pool is perfect and just the right temperature. Very relaxing if the spa hasn't done that already.

Lastly I want to thank some of the staff that helped us during our stay as they made our week...Alexis in Tableau who made the reservation for my wife, Garrett in Concierge who helped us with Jubilee tickets, Ashely by the pool who took good care of us, Vin at the bar who pours a mean Scotch and the countless other staff who made us feel special. We cant wait to come back!!!

We stayed in the double king suite with a panoramic view.  It was amazing!  The room was so spacious.  We had two sofas, 2 king beds, several small tables, a large desk, and a huge bathroom with shower and soaking tub.  It was the perfect place to crash after goring on food and falling into multiple food comas.  The beds were really comfy.  The panoramic view was really nice.  We really felt VIP staying here.

I've never stayed here because I'm not rich but this is far and away my favorite casino in Vegas to gamble at.

First, the Encore is a beautiful building both inside and out.  Upon walking in you immeadiately feel classy and begin to walk with more swagger, because this place is just that baller.

Next, they have the best staff in Vegas.  Dealers, cocktail waitresses, cashiers, bartenders, everyone treats you with the utmost respect and courtesy.  They treat you great even if you happen to be incredibly lit up, and since this is often my last stop after a night of raging in vegas (I often hit up the Wynn between the hours of 3am-7am), I am often quite wasted when I come through here.

This place is also always crawling with beatiful women; early in the morning, late at night, and everytime in between, so you know that's a good thing.

Finally, on my last Las Vegas adventure I won a bunch of money on one of their craps tables late night that made up for some losses I'd took earlier in the trip.

I need to remember that the next time I'm in Vegas I should spend more time here, and less time everywhere else because the other casinos don't even compare to the Encore.
