When requesting to speak with a manager to ask what happened to the previous recipe they never came to the table. The busser asked if the manager had come and we said no and again we watched the busser go to the manager and let them know we would like to speak with them and still they did my come to the table as they were both too busy setting tables in the restaurant.  Maybe 15 minutes later the server asked if everything was ok as she saw I was not eating my vegan eggs Benedict and asked if everything was alright. They removed the charges for the dish however this is not what I would expect from a 5 star hotel. On check out there was a charge of $25 for putting a soda in the fridge as it is weight censored and the front desk agent seemed unfazed when I thought this was a ridiculous charge.  Had I known there would have been this charge I would have been happy to not use the fridge and use ice instead, most expensive soda I have ever had!  Make sure you don't put anything in the fridge!

Just stayed there three nights recently.  I have stayed at the Palazzo, Four Seasons, and MGM suites in Las Vegas, and I have to say that the Encore is just as nice if not nicer than the rest of those establishments.

Service: Impeccable.  Everyone we ran into from housekeeping to valet were extra friendly and provided us with first class service.

Room:  Again, amazing!  Top-notch room with all the amenities that you could want.  Was very relaxing, it was almost a bummer that we had to leave the room it was so peaceful.  Beds, bathrooms are beyond luxurious!  

Food:  The restaurants in the Encore are just as great as those found in the Wynn itself, which are all pretty much first class.  None of them are cheap though, so if you are trying to find a cheaper bite don't stay around the hotel.

Casino:  The casino is one of the down-points about the hotel.  The casino floor is very small.  Not a lot of table games, and the entire feel seems to leave you expecting more.  The Wynn is less than a five minute walk away though, which is perfect for gaming.

Pool:  The pool is very much mature-adult themed.  Two wade pools, no lazy rivers, waterfalls, or anything of the sort.  One of the pools is a topless pool, but there was only one woman who braved the judging and went around topless.  Great place to relax and soak up some sun, but not the party-type hooking up place in Las Vegas.

Sadly, the Encore is no longer the 5-star resort it once was. I have been witness to a steady decline over the past decade. This last visit was the icing on the cake tho . . . from the incredibly aggressive woman who I spoke to in reservations, to room service, to management, the experience fell short of all expectations. Long black hairs all over the bathroom (YUCK!), my room being entered into even tho the "Privacy" sign was clearly illuminated, management being unavailable at the front desk, management later taking 1 week to respond to my email, and on and on. After having spent well-over $1K on a two-night stay within the Encore, all that management offered as a consolation to the short-comings was "an upgrade on my next visit." Huh? First off, as an American Express member, I get "upgrades" all the time. It's really no big deal. And furthermore, how does this remedy all that went wrong during the weekend? Even the quality of the food at the restaurants has gone down! Given the infinite options that are available to anyone who travels to Las Vegas, I feel confident that I'll be staying elsewhere next time.

I love the Encore!! They definitely have more unique rooms and designs than other 5 star hotel suites. We stayed in the Resort Suite. There is a floor-to-ceiling mirror right next to the huge, comfy bed. If you look at the pictures, there is a wall separating the bed from the "living room". The wall is cut out so that the huge TV is right in front of the bed!  I also love the fact that the rooms here are so high tech. One remote controls all the lighting in the room: from the hallway lights to the lamps, and even the blinds, there is no way one would not want this feature in their own home! 

As for the Casino itself, love love love. Connected to the Wynn, there is so much going on here. So many clubs and lounges, restaurants, luxury shops, etc. Sure other hotels have these features too, but not as many and not as classy as the Encore.

The rooms are lovely and well appointed, but the hotel is so annoyingly cheap, due to their nickle and dime policies.  Everything in this hotel is extra including certain seats at the pool, mandatory "resort fee", random "additional" charges on every bill, etc. .  If I had a dollar for every time I was told something was "extra", I would have made up for the entire cost of the trip.  Nickle and dime policies are very disruptive and feel predatory.  I am unlikely to be coming back.

The Encore! Oh yes, it is different than the Winn that I love, but have to say that the rooms and the stay for the three nights here was so so grate.
 As always of what we had  expected from staying previously at the Winn, the Encore deliver all our expectations from customer service to having a wonderful stay.
This combo is bad, because when your leaving is so hard to do. you want to think of ways to stay longer.
The rooms were spacious and the glass windows are amazing to sleep and to wake up to. The tub and bath rooms are big and you stay in there for hours.
Soaking, shaving, watching TV while soaking in a 110f  tub, drinking a cold beer! That my think for the morning! 
The location and the amenities at the hotel lets you stay the entire time, with out leaving if you want.
I come to relax and this is what I got , time to relax  and get cough up sleeping and recharge. I not sure, but i think the beds and sheets or everything they though about in the room makes rest and relaxing peaceful.

when i get back to reality, its 24\/6 go go go..
Thanks Winn and Encore for helping me recharge and escape the grind!

Checking in took about 20 minutes. The girl that helped us at the front desk was less than friendly. She missed a lot of details. We had to pay $50 to get two queen beds. Couch wasn't very comfortable. TV is oddly placed. Had a great view of the strip on the 57th floor. There are red glittery butterflies and dragonflies everywhere. It looks like a 10 year old girl decorated the lobby and casino. I won't be staying here again. 

If you want a variety of nice restaurants, and to go to the beach club, and xs nightclub, and don't care about having any cheap options like walgreens and food court, then I'm sure you'll like it. Otherwise, stay at the palazzo.

I would like to give this place a 4.6 - b\/c I mean things can always be a little bit better - but since that's not an option, 5 it is!  Wynn & Encore have a special place in my heart - I immediately fell in love with the design and the beautiful chocolate color of the buildings the first time I saw it. 

As soon as we walked into the hotel I jumped onto the beds and screamed for joy as i looked out onto the beautiful strip.  I've stayed in some pretty bad hotels (think Imperial Palace), somewhat bad hotels (think Harrah's), somewhat okay hotels (think Treasure Island) but this was the best hotel experience ever.  They even have a desk for working\/studying.  Fancy points!  

One day while the rest of the girls went to go eat I stayed back and took a nice bubble bath, while watching TV in the bathroom and eating hot cheetos (ya I'm low class).  

This place is super convenient because after clubbing at XS you don't  have to walk outside to get back to your hotel.  The only cons are that the minimums at the gambling tables are too high for my risk-averse self.  I honestly don't know if I can stay at any other hotel now after staying at Encore (except maybe Wynn I guess).

Decided to spend my anniversary night at the Encore Hotel. Once we arrive in our room dropped off our room in what appeared to be a clean room. Upon returning and further inspection we notice that our nightstand had a puddle of what appeared to be  KY lube- so disgusting! It was late so because we didnt want to go through the process of changing rooms we cleaned it ourselves. 
At around 300am the music from the club downstairs was going strong and could be heard loud and clearly in our room-because of that we had a horrible night sleep! 
Wish I could have given this place a 5star rating maybe next time things will be a little better.
****update** After reading my review a Encore hotel.manager contacted me to discuss my stay. He was very understanding and stated that the take cleanliness very seriously. Thank you Encore for reaching out it shows that you are truly interested in guest satisfaction.

Encore Part 2:
We also had a problem with a broken shower, and the promise of the maintenance guy to show up in the morning slipped through the cracks. After I called again and he did come, he basically blamed the guests for breaking the shower when the bellhop had never explained how to use that knob in the first place, so I am guessing the previous guest who broke it also did not get an explanation. To switch from the handheld shower to the overhead by turning off the shower and not pulling the knob is NOT intuitive. Also, the concierge told us we could request an airport shuttle when we had our bags held at the bell stand the last day, but the bell hop said too bad, we had to do that 24 hours ahead of time. That is a huge piece of miscommunication between what the concierge tells the guests and what the bellhops are willing to do.
There is a sort of arrogance that this is how the hotel works, as in a "why don't you know this" attitude, but as a first time guest, with no one communicating things like the turndown "rules" or the way the shower knob works, how are we supposed to know? Also, if a concierge tells me something, why is the bellhop telling me something different? There needs to be better communication - that is the weak link in this beautiful hotel's system. For instance, we got an offer in with our Le R√™ve tickets for a free drink at Blush, but then they would not let us in unless we paid $30 for my husband, because according to the girl at Blush, free admission and the drink were "only for the ladies." If those are the "rules," that's fine, but print it on the card so people will not be mislead when reading "just bring your ticket to receive this offer" It should be "just bring your ticket if you are female, and be prepared to pay $30 and not get the free drink if you are male." Btw, we did use the free drink and appetizer offer at Society Cafe, and the bartender basically rushed us in and out of there, whereas we saw him constantly topping off the champagne glasses of a bunch of girls at the bar with free refills. Hubby overheard that they were friends of the bartender. Not that I would have wanted a refill, as Freixenet is not actually champagne (I was surprised an upscale establishment like the Wynn\/Encore wouldn't be more careful with their wording - and Freixenet tastes vile to me), but it did take away from the special upscale feeling when we saw not every guest was being treated equally.
We tried a couple of times to see the free show by the waterfall, but could never find the free viewing platforms mentioned in guidebooks. And when we saw the show it was like, is that all? (A couple of glowing balls made a baby ball with some music.) Finally I found someone who told me there were several different shows, and the upstairs outdoor caf√© area was the "free viewing" area, (slightly obscured by trees). So we saw it a second time and there was a flamenco-themed video projected on the rock wall. Not as entertaining as the people watching as hundreds lined up to get into the clubs. If you want to go, pack a skin tight dress with a skirt up to your crotch and 5-inch hooker heels, and you'll fit right in, lol.
To conclude, comments by the employees about what "most guests" do makes anyone with a question, problem, or request feel like their uniqueness is being brushed aside - at a "5 star" hotel, no guest wants to get the impression that the staff has no intention of changing how they do things that aren't working, so if they didn't tell you something you needed to know on your first trip, too bad for you, but they don't really care because they see too many people. I answered their post-stay survey because I thought they wanted to be the best and could use our comments to get from an A minus to an A plus in customer experience, but I feared I might have been wasting my time. And indeed, no one ever contacted me about my comments. I really don't expect them to change the way they do things, although improving the housekeeping communication would be a great step in the right direction.

This place is outrageous. As far as the prices, I can understand that. The front desk staff were nice, but the security and the coffee cafe are rediculous. They wouldn't serve me a coffee or food in this cafe next to the elevadors because I was wearing a tank top. I was on my way to the pool. Come on! That's just stupid. Then, I was with a bunch of friends at encore beach, and they left me and one of my buddies with all of our stuff which isn't a big deal, but the security staff wouldn't let me into the very hotel that I'm staying at because I didn't have a t-shirt. How am I suppose to go to my room? Then they offered me a t-shirt, but wanted me to pay for it. Stupid! Even asked for the the security supervisor, and he basically told me I couldn't go inside. It look me over a half hour to get in the doors after one of security guards got a shirt from my room. Really! My friends and I spent a lot of money at this hotel and they treat you like poop. Watch out for the lame policies and the hidden credit card charges. Did I mention they over charge you at the pool if you get bottle servive. They tell you a price, but its basically doubled. Be prepared to spend a lot of money and get treated like your staying at motel 6. Actually I have had better experiences at MOTEL 6. Lame hotel.

I finally got the chance to stay at Encore and holy beejesus, the rooms are absolutely beautiful.  There really aren't words to describe how gorgeous and luxurious the rooms are.  I've stayed at almost every single big hotel on the strip and this is the nicest by leaps & bounds.  The rooms are big, the bathrooms are big.  Even the hallway from the door to the bedroom is longer than my last apartment's.  We had a beautiful view of the pools.  The bedroom and living room are separated.  I can tell the casino was definitely decorated to appeal to Asians.  Everything is red and gold, with dragons, lucky dogs, and butterflies everywhere.  If I could afford to, I'd stay at Encore on every one of my trips to Vegas.  I'd give it 20 stars if I could.

We stayed five days four nights at the Encore. We loved everything about this hotel. The rooms are beyond comfortable. I've never spent in a more comfortable bed. The sheets, pillows and comforter were heaven at the end of the day. My only issue with room is there's no refrigerator in the room. They really need to put a small refrigerator as opposed to a wet bar. Be aware of touching anything on the wet bar they will charge you if it's removed longer than 30 seconds. What I especially loved about the Encore is it is the very end of the line on the north end of the strip. They don't allow non guests to bring in strollers so you're not going to get a bunch of kids running around. You're also not going to get a bunch of drunk idiots as the food and drinks are very expensive. It seemed to me the only people walking around are the guests staying there. The drinks are bare minimum $9 for beer and 15-17 for cocktails. This keeps people from over indulging I believe. The pool at Encore was beautifully kept. We preferred the over 21 European pool to the general one. It was  relaxing and the staff was very friendly and attentive. Restaurants all delicious but very expensive. If you have a loose wallet and want luxury this is your hotel. You will not feel comfortable waking around this hotel in tshirts and flip flops  if you're not swimming so bring nice clothes! We loved our stay and would definitely stay again. So in short if you have a decent amount of money for your Las Vegas vacation you can't do better than this hotel.

This is a review regarding our experience with the drink waitress on the Encore's casino floor. We've always stayed at the Encore ,but decided to stay at the Wynn this time over our 4th of July weekend. It was our last day (July 3rd around 9pm) and though we gambled every night we stayed at the Wynn, we decided to hit the Encore's casino floor after dinner because we still had about an hour to spare before take off. I had finished my final round of plays and was waiting on my partner to finish up. We were approached by a drink waitress so my partner asked if we could have 2 drinks one for me and one for him and with this request the tanned asian waitress in a very rude tone of voice yelled "You have to be both playing to get a drink!" We both looked at each other a bit appalled because we had never experienced such service from both Wynn\/Encore property. We couldn't believe the attitude she was giving us and we couldn't help to wonder if this was same property where one of their staffs on the floor walked us to the concierge's desk from the business center when we let them know the business center was closed and we needed our show tickets printed out. To our surprise she returned with the 2 drinks and we tipped her despite her unprofessional attitude. She gave a sleazy ungrateful thank you and walked away. This negative experience left a bad aftertaste and it annoyed us that such a experience came from a great property such as this especially on our last few moments of our stay.

Stayed 3 nights for a conference and all I can say is wow! The place had amazing trendy details and the rooms were quite the display overlooking the vegas strip. We went to the waterfall, the beach club, the rose garden, and there was shopping a crossed the street. We were super impressed with the hotel staff and the 5 star service that was provided. It was defiantly a great experience and we will be back.

Clean, modern, upscale rooms.  If you're staying on a weekend and want to rest be sure to get the rooms that are not facing the pool\/XS.  The music pumps until 4am.  Small gaming area that's not too smoky.  Table limits $15 and up for card games and craps.
Bar\/lounge near the elevators doubles as breakfast and coffee stand in the morning.  Easy self park.

Encore Hotel ohlalla~
It was great how the inside of this wonderful hotel seemed like.
There was an big open view when you press the open or something button near my bed the curtains flow across the window and I could see Las Vegas!
IT WAS WONDERFUL
i couldnt go to the swimming pool since it was closed so that was the bad part. BUT when i ate at a near by inside restraunt i ate the most DELICIOUS pizza there! it was so HUGE and great! 
hope i can visit again and again! :D and i got kinda confused where wynn was and encore but i got the hang out it haha(:

It is a Friday night at the Encore and the place is packed so why is it that the first 3 bars I went to at midnight were closed? Steve - pay a few more people and open the bars, it shouldn't be such a challenge to get a drink and a seat. Typically I sing the praises of this place but this is the second time this month I have stayed here and was wondering why the bars are closed. Feel free to let me know why

Stayed here last week and it was such a beautiful hotel unfortunately I went to the encore Beach club and had my purse with my iPhone on one of the Lillypad's wrapped in a towel and towards the end of the evening staff member started cleaning up the bag with the phone fell into the water,  as I want to speak to the staff members Who dropped my purse into the water they were very rude to me as I was only looking for an apology not much more and they said it's not their problem I didn't pay for the Lillypad and to get over it. I contacted the hotel and filled out an incident report and they were very kind as today I spoke with the claims department they said they will not be covering the phone and purse that has been extremely damaged during this incident. I am disappointed that the encore does not take responsibility for the actions of their staff members for situations such as this I was a guest at their hotel and went to an event at one of their pool parties and I was treated very unfairly during this process. I would just appreciate respect in the fact that the staff members will take responsibility for their actions in damaging guests property but it doesn't seem like that will occur at this hotel.

1 star or less for check in and front desk staff. The process takes forever and the people there are not always trained as rest of the staff. 

Day 1 front desk lost reservation that gaming made for me and I lost my room and went somewhere else that night. 

Next night line is 25 deep and took close to an hour and a half to check in with only 6 registers open and every now and again one of the 6 left for awhile. 

Went down at midnight to extend a few night. No line. So straight to girl at desk. Took a half an hour for her to extend my stay. No joke. 15 minutes into the wait I said forget it I'll do it tomorrow. She said "I'm done. Just swipe card and you can sign" as she continues to type and it takes another 15 minutes. So annoying. 

Rest of hotel is great

Beautiful and clean hotel. In-room dinning great for late night eats when you're too tired to go downstairs. Great restaurants and drinks at both Encore and Wynn. The several pool choices at both hotels are nice too...Encore spa a must!

Let me start off by saying the hotel was beautiful, and so was our room but the overall customer service was below average for me especially for the amount of money we were paying per night. We stayed in July, so it's super busy around that time in Vegas. We were in town to celebrate my mom's 50th birthday and were expecting to only have a great time the minute we landed. Check in process for Las Vegas hotels is hell on earth and that's to be expected especially checking in on a Friday. So we're given a key to our room, the minute we walk inside we are welcomed to a room that has clearly not been cleaned out by the previous guest. Wish I would've taken pictures of this. Food containers everywhere, an unmade bed, and sheets all over the floor. Ok...not exactly what anyone wants to deal with after a long flight into Vegas and and even longer wait in line to actually check in. My mom calls the front desk to let them know the situation and the front desk lady says the best she can do is take off our resort fee and give us the next available room that was just like the one we were supposed to check into. Yup, that's right they didn't even offer us an upgraded room. Woohoo, I mean we were a good amount per night there. Taking off the resort fee was actually quiet comical to us, but whatever. So she tells us we don't have to come all the way back down stairs to re-activate our key she could do it right from the computer. She assigned us our new room and we were on our way. Well, at least we thought we were. We get to the second room, and what a surprise our key doesn't even open the room. My mom had to ask one of the house keepers if she could go in the room they were cleaning to use the phone to call downstairs. It took about 20 minutes for someone to come upstairs to let us into our room. My mom calls downstairs to talk to the manager, and Im not sure if this lady took any real training on how to manage a 4-5 star hotel but this lady was beyond rude. She basically said that there's nothing else they can do besides take of a $35 a day resort fee (total $70 since we stayed for 2 nights). No comped dinner, no comped night, or anything extra at the hotel. Beautiful hotel but I definitely won't bother staying here again. Learn to treat your guest that are paying a lot of money a night with respect and at least try to find ways to make a bad situation that was the hotels fault better. Like seriously, it would've been super easy for them to offer us credit at one of the restaurants at the hotel we obviously would've ended up spending more money there so in the end that's more money they would've made. Moral of the story, their customer service here sucks horribly.

I loved this hotel - friendly staff, incredible rooms, wonderful service, beautiful (in the Vegas style of beautiful which is over the top) public spaces.  Yes, it's expensive, but I've been getting mail with special offers from them since I stayed at the Wynn 4 years ago for a conference, and I'm glad I finally took them up on it.  I paid $129\/night.  Worth way more than that...

I stayed here in June during the most popular time of the year to be in Vegas. If felt very extravagant from the moment my friend and I walked in. We were very pleased with the ambience and staff (with the exception of the security staff for the XS club.) Yet it was not overcrowded and we still had the "on the strip" experience.   

We loved our room and the "strip view" we had. The only thing that was annoying, was the noise level from the club. I was surprised that we could hear it even from the high floor. Normally noise doesn't bother me too much but I was exhausted and could not sleep. 

It was a great experience but I think I would opt for the Wynn. It's a bit closer to the strip and you don't have to deal with the noise from the club being so close.
Beautiful hotel with friendly and courteous staff BUT poolside service virtually nonexistent and La Cave disappointing.
Very nice rooms.  Good service.  A bit far from other hotels and the crowd is a bit older.

We stayed at the Encore on our recent trip to Vegas.  It is a very large hotel and I get overwhelmed in malls\/Ikeas easily so perhaps this wasn't the best choice for me.  

But anyway, when we checked in I mentioned it was my fiance's birthday.  The two women who checked us in (one was in training), Shaily and Ashley, sent up a box of chocolates later to say happy birthday! How nice is that!  

They offered us a room upgrade for $30 per night and we took it.  Our room was large and had a decent view (although not amaaaazing) so I am overall glad we went for it.  I also liked the features for turning on\/off the lights.  It made the hotel room feel very modern. 

The gym is smaller than I expected it would be.  It is also a little confusing to find.  I got confused by the spa and how the outside of the gym looks a little too fancy to be the gym.  

Also, the Encore just feels like a hike from other things on the Strip.  I know it is all relative and it is really close but perhaps it was the cold weather that made me feel like a 4 yr old asking "are we there yet?"

Last time we stayed at Treasure Island and I think overall that was a better experience.  I felt more comfortable given the size of TI v. Encore and I even liked the gym more.  I don't think we will stay at the Encore again.

For service, comfort, and a sense of quiet in the 24\/7 beehive that is the Vegas strip the Encore wins hands down. I read a ton of complaints regarding the club music being loud in rooms facing the pool, so we requested a room facing away, and after an attempted up-sell we were accommodated, and never heard club music. 
The restaurants are nothing spectacular, but it is good food and service was consistently great. My favorite was the room service cheddar macaroni, I ordered it twice.
We went out several nights and coming back to the Encore was a breath of fresh air both literally and figuratively. 
Definitely going back.

This place was amazing. My friend and I did not stay here but we ate at the botero restaurant which is part of Encore. Their food was amazing. We had the veggie sandwich wrapped in sourdough bread with sweet potato fries and it was so fresh and tasty. I LOVED walking around this place. Red is my favorite color and I loved the vibrant feel of the hotel. I wanted to stay there the whole time- great spots to get your upscale shopping on too:) They had a pool party going on too when we were there. The staff was helpful when we asked questions about which places to eat at and visit. 

If I go back to Vegas this would be my place of choice. Encore!! tres bien:)

Encore performances often are just quick hits to pacify the fans with one last song before calling it a night, but the Encore Hotel is a 2nd verse as good as the first. It matches its sister the Wynn with class, fun, and style.

Elegant Rooms and Amenities
Nightclub Nirvana at XS
Complete Customer Service
Outstanding Beach Club
RItzy Casino and Stakes
East Asian Atmosphere

If you are planning to hit Surrender, XS, the Encore Beach Club, or any of the things at Wynn like Le Reve or Tryst then it's hard to imagine a better place to stay than Encore Las Vegas.
Housekeeping has been so rude today, but Leonard was the one who really made our night he was so nice and he really didnt rush us.

This really is a beautiful hotel. I didn't really stay here. I just walked through and wanted to stop at the bar and have a drink. The bartender, Miguel, was pretty annoying. I didn't even enjoy my drink.

I treated myself to a few nights here in the middle of a long trip to Vegas and I was not disappointed. The rooms were absolutely stunning, as were the views. The pools are nice, as well with there never being a shortage of waitresses to take your drinks order (which is an important detail). It is also surprisingly reasonably priced for such a beautiful hotel. I will definitely be staying there again!

For me it's either the Encore or the Wynn. The Encore is the more contemporary of the two, with rooms that are modern in style. Restaurant choices are slim here and it does connect to the Wynn, making it easy to get around. 

Tip the help and you will get even better service!

If I had a choice, I wouldn't stay anywhere else.  Encore is always my first and only choice while visiting Vegas.  Their customer service is quite stellar and the housekeeping beckons to your call with your every need.

They print your boarding pass for you and everything is taken care of.  They also call you to make sure you received the item.  Your room key is your player card as well.

The only thing they could improve on is upgrading their iHomes.  They are out of date and kind of faulty.

Otherwise, everything is a one stop shop and in the summer, it is conveniently in the same building as Encore Beach Club.

I have died and gone to sophisticated interior design heaven. This hotel is absolutely gorgeous. Steve Wynn has impeccable taste. I'm officially gonna go home and make a vision board of my dream house that looks exactly like Encore. I am in love and in awe. Steve, you are the man and you smell like Money. I could sniff you all day.

EDIT on November 5, 2016: Shortly after I posted this review, a manager reached out to rectify the issue. I was given appropriate compensation for my poor experience and offered a complimentary upgrade should I visit Wynn\/Encore in the next year. I am changing my review from 1-star to 2-stars because of this, although it's a shame that it took a flaming review to get them to resolve the issue.

-------------

My stay at Wynn\/Encore was the worst hotel experience I've ever had out of any hotel claiming to be a "luxury" hotel. Encore may look luxurious from the inside, but their service and code of ethics would easily be outdone by a lower class hotel like Motel 6. In fact, my overall Vegas experience would have been better had I stayed at a Motel 6 instead of Wynn.

My misery began upon check-in on the evening of September 8, 2016. I had booked a Resort King Suite at Encore. During check-in, I could tell from the attendant's facial expression that something wasn't quite right. He typed away for a couple minutes, and then exclaimed, "I've found a great room for you sir!".

He said it's only a couple minutes walk from there, and on the Wynn side. I asked why I was being sent to Wynn when my reservation was for Encore. He told me they didn't have availability at Encore, and the Wynn room was equivalent to the room I had booked. I asked if it was the same size, and he said that it was 700 sq feet. I asked if I'd get a credit since he's putting me in a smaller room, and he told me that that's not possible, since the room I was getting was actually at a higher rate than the room I booked. This was all very strange...why am I not getting the room I had reserved and paid a deposit on? How is a smaller, older room, have a higher rate than a newer, bigger room? He told me that if I wanted, I could contact the front desk in the morning to see if any Encore Resort King Suites had become available.

Although I was suspicious, I was also tired, so I relented, took the keys, and went to my room.

Much to my surprise, the room was not at all similar to the room I had booked and paid for. It was a single room rather than a 2-room suite with a divider, and it was substantially smaller.

So let's review so far:

1. The hotel booked more rooms than they had available, intentionally to maximize their revenue, knowing full-well guests would show up and they wouldn't get the rooms they had reserved. ETHICALLY DEVOID and CORRUPT.

2. The attendant attempted to deceive me with this exclamation of "We've found a great room for you!". HE LIED.

3. He told me it was 700 sq feet, when it was 600 sq feet. HE LIED AGAIN.

4. He told me that the rate on the Wynn room was higher than the room I had originally booked, so there would be no credit. I checked online when I got up to my room. The room I was sent to was about $100\/night less than what I booked. HE LIED ONCE AGAIN.

5. He put the onus of correcting the issue on ME rather than the hotel, by telling me I could call the front desk the next morning. Any hotel with any semblance of "luxury" would be proactive and not only contact me the next morning, but offer amends. INADEQUATE SERVICE.

The exciting first night in Vegas turned into one of fraught with anxiety. Nothing irks me more than knowing I've been taken advantage of. And the con of Wynn\/Encore was just beginning.

The next morning, after a mostly sleepless night fretting over whether I was going to get the right room, I ate some breakfast, and headed to the front desk.

First, I spoke to another front-desk receptionist. I explained the situation, now for the second time, and she told me she'd put my name on the list of people to get an Encore Resort King Suite after the rooms were cleaned. I asked for a credit for having been downgraded the prior night, and she offered me a credit of one night's resort fee ($35) for my "inconvenience". 

Really? A whopping $35 for my inconvenience?

How about compensation for your incompetency? For your lies? For all the time I spent dealing with this nonsense instead of enjoying my trip?

I asked to speak to a manager. 

"Danny" the manager came over, and fortunately he was already aware of my complaint. "Danny" seemed like a reasonable person, until he started talking:

"You weren't put in a lesser room...it was just a smaller room."

He eventually agreed to credit me the resort fee for all 3 nights. Satisfied, I walked away. Upon check-out I looked at the bill.

No credit. 

When I returned home, I called the Billing Department and left a voicemail.

My call was never returned.

I hope somebody sets Wynn and Encore on fire.

I love the win. It's on the north end of the strip so it lends itself to more of a quiet vegas feel. The casino is busy but not over crowded. It has good bars and pretty good food. I always enjoy staying here.

What can I say?  We had this trip planned for some time.  My fiance had received a coupon for a deal in the mail, which is how we decided to stay here.

I'm guessing we are not their target audience because it's clear they want us to gamble a bunch, which neither of us do not.

The rooms were beautiful.  The pictures others have posted were completely representative of what our room was like and we had a decent view which we really enjoyed day and night.

I really enjoyed the fact that this place is so nice they don't have those annoying vendors that ask you to go to a show, etc.  After about four days of that, I'm done.

This location is right across the street from the Fashion Show Mall, which is convenient if you need to pick up a couple of items.

There is also a Walgreens and a liquor store within walking distance of the Encore so you can come back to your room and pregame before a night on the town.  

I always bring a hotpot with me when I travel in case they do not have a coffee pot or anything else in the room.  It's very convenient to have some coffee and tea and a few snacks in the room with you.  They have the weighted food and drink in the room (if it's off the scale for a minute it's an automatic charge)  I don't go for that kind of thing.

Another thing I didn't really care for is the huge signs in the lobby that say your bags are subject to being searched for contraband (ie, outside food or drink...what is this a movie theater?)  For the record, that never happened and we followed in people carrying boxes of beer so I didn't feel to bad but, I mean really you are paying for the room so what is that all about?

There is an additional charge to use the pool and work out facilities which was included in our package.  The pool was beautiful and very relaxing.  The weather was the nicest on the last day so we maximized our time before check out at the pool.  I'm sure when summer comes it will be really jammed there but we had the are all to ourselves.

I did really enjoy the non smoking rooms and non smoking floors.  The ventilation in the casinos themselves was really good and not nearly as smokey as some of the older casinos.

The wi-fi was supposed to be free with the package but every time you tried to login you were not able to.  The 3G for ATT didn't work very well inside without it.  We could have investigated it, I suppose but I let it go.

I would like to say we'll be back but I'm thinking without some sort of great deal from Mr. Wynn, it will be out of my price range.

I will not stay anywhere else in Vegas.
The spa is to die for.
The atmosphere is the classiest out of Vegas, which is not difficult.  This place needs competition.  

They do need a one card black jack table so I don't have to go outside to gamble.

The only other place I might try is Cosmopolitan from what my friends are telling me.

SERVICE WAS TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! please read....

What a confusing trip I had to the encore this past weekend?!?! Taking a birthday trip with my girlfriend and some friends for the weekend thinking wow this is going to be great: the encore hotel, great food, great gaming, great dinning, great clubs, well......

Arrival typical friday evening travel a short flight over from San Diego. After checking in, we begin to walk through the hotel to hear people throughout the hotel speaking of NO HOT WATER! For a 5 star 5 diamond club hotel not to have hot water is ridiculous. They were right! Thanks for the preface at check-in that there was no hot water.  (First problem of the trip) Couldn't complain yet because when I called down to the front desk so many other people were complaining at the same time I could not actually get a live person on the phone and the machine prompted me to call back later (strike 2!). 

Next morning housekeeping used their key-card and entered our room without knocking. (Will spare the details of how bad that timing was).
(3rd service flaw) 

After that incident decided to say something to the hotel staff about the housekeeping incident and the hot water - comped $100. ($50 for each separate incident) Thinking maybe things are on the up!

4pm get hot water and finally shower. 

Ate dinner at their sushi restaurant Wazuzu. Food was good, service was poor again. (#4!) Ordering sake became the most complicated thing to do. Not sure exactly how it went down because I was so frustrated I gave up and let friends try and order. 

XS WAS AMAZING! EVERYONE GO THERE! Best club in Vegas
Only flaw, concierge closed at 9pm in Sin City, or a city "that never sleeps".  Well the concierge at the Encore definitely does.  Nothing sinister like happens in vegas before 9pm anyways?!?! Wanted to get hotel guest passes or ladies passes and unsuccessful at both because they were closed.

Sunday called down for 1pm late checkout after friends in room 3 doors down said they got 1pm late checkout. Called the front desk, Kelly said they were not offering 1pm late checkout to any of the guest. Well, after haggling with Kelly for 20-30 minutes she spoke with another gentleman, James, one of the managers, and agreed to offer 1pm late checkout. Admitted they actually did offered my friends a late checkout which she orgianlly said was not an option. (#5)

All in all, food was great. XS was great. Ambience and decor was great. Little on the pricey side for food and beverage, but service  was TERRIBLE. No one was helpful except for the bellman when we were leaving hahaha! Talk about a sign....

When what you control is who you hire to represent your hotel, Encore falls miserably short. And with word of mouth being best referral, I would stay somewhere else to avoid the service issues of staying here. Dine and go to XS and get out!

My boyfriend and I decided to celebrate our 5 year anniversary along with Memorial Day in Las Vegas, so I made sure to plan a fun weekend getaway. When in town, we always tend to party at XS, Surrender, & Encore beach club because they simply are some of the best clubs on the strip. Beautiful hotel with nothing but smiles all around, no doubt about that. 

We arrived on 5\/28\/16 for our 2 night stay & we were both looking forward to the activities we planned. Once we checked in, our room was great, it was a panoramic king suite on the 60th floor, I loved it. This wasn't going to be our usual partying weekends in Vegas, so I was ready to experience Encore like I've never had before. We skipped the usual party at the beach club because we don't really care for Avicii and I just wanted to relax. We went to the regular pools, which were pretty packed, we couldn't find chairs in the 21+ section, so we settled by the main area. It was relaxing, comfy tanning beds, we ordered salads & a pitcher of some vodka drink.. But the chicken in both salads were kind of hard and chewy, felt like it had been in the fridge for a while. Flavors were good, but I couldn't eat the chicken. 

Around 5 I had a reservation to get a blowout before my night started, at the Claude Baruk salon, the staff was great, it was fabulous inside, and my stylist was fun. It was all great, the champagne, and the products they use, but my actual blowout, ehh, I've had better plus it didn't even last all night. My curls were dull to begin with, I knew it wouldn't last but the experience was nice & I was content with that. 

Around 7:30 we went to Andrea's to have dinner, nice ambiance, & the drinks were good. The food was excellent until I found a piece of hair on one of the sushi rolls. Really? & It was a pretty long piece of hair at that. Nasty. Spending all that money to find hair on my food, I doubt I'll ever go back, I can go anywhere if I want to spend that much money to get disappointed. They didn't charge us for that specific roll, bla bla, doesn't matter the damage is done. 

Following dinner, we had tickets for La R√©ve, it's an entertaining show. 

I will not be reviewing the clubs, it's always a good time, plus we always get a table so there is really nothing to say. We went to Surrender Saturday night.

Next morning, room service breakfast was good, they were prompt, we ordered the salmon Benedict, pancakes, scrambled eggs, a smoothie & tea.... it was satisfying. 

Around 3 we went down to the spa for our couples massage, the spa itself is separated for woman & men, it is European style. We had scheduled 2 aromatherapy massages with the hot stone enhancement in a private room for both of us to be in. By the time we were changing to lay on the beds, the lady kept knocking on the door. Like dude, relax, we said 1 minute.. I was trying to take off my jewelry and it seemed like she just didn't want to wait. Not the best massage, it could have used some more work, but the oils were great, I was relaxed. Then we both went our separate ways inside the facilities, it's gorgeous, but the cold towels outside the sauna & steam room ran out. I tried to find someone to tell, nobody in sight. 30-40 minutes passed, still no cold towels. Really? I had to the use the ice from the bowl to cool myself off! I just left after that, & nobody even cared to ask about my experience. 

I had asked for housekeeping to take care of the room while we were gone, & ummm? I don't know what they did, just close the bed? Who cares. They didn't even restock anything in the bathroom or take the room service table. Why did you come? I don't get it. 

We skipped our dinner reservations & decided to stay in the room to relax. That night we had a table at XS. 

We never left Encore & Wynn, and we didn't need to. After thousands of dollars being spent on amenities, tables at the clubs, gambling & food, you would think the least they can do is take care of your car. We never drive to Vegas, ever! We just wanted to drive my brand new BMW from LA & I regret ever making that decision.

Valet is a joke. A bunch of hoodlums racing the cars up & down bumping music. Stupid little boys happy with other people's cars, speeding & braking so hard, I couldn't believe my eyes. Before my car arrived I was already mad at what I saw. Something told me check your car Christine, & of course, it's scratched. I was so furious, so furious, and I wasn't the only one! There was Another car damaged, unbelievable. 

Bottom line, there was hair in my anniversary dinner, I left the spa because I couldn't last in the sauna without the cold towels, housekeeping sucked, and my brand new car got scratched. Are you kidding, I'm pissed!! Thanks Encore!

Usually love to stay here but not this time.  I reserved two rooms, one for myself and the other for my brother.  When I checked in, I added his name and told the receptionist that he will be paying for his own room.  My card got billed for his room even as we were going up the elevator.   I called Front Desk to dispute, talked to the manager, Lemual and he had the audacity to say, " I will TRY to get this resolved".  Huh?  They already have my brother's card and they billed my card so I would term this as double billing and he will "TRY" to get it resolved?  Then he had the audacity to tell my husband that this is not a reflection of the hotel!! ??  Every employee of the hotel is a reflection of the hotel when they are working in the hotel.  I used to love the Encore but this really has left a bad taste in my mouth.  The error did get resolved, but not by Lemual, the manager, but by a very nice professional young lady at the front desk, Liz.  Don't know how Lemual got to be manager but he desperately needs customer service retraining.  His attitude gives Encore a bad name.

Stayed in the Encore Suites for 5 nights...

4 stars because the food wasn't so good and the vibes at the tables in the casino were not so great. Also, it's on the edge of the strip so we were a little far from the center so getting to and from on an Uber\/Lyft\/Taxi was a drag during certain hours... there was lots of traffic! 

Stayed during Memorial Day weekend which traffic was expected but the Lyft took forever and racked up a high fee going a mile over to the Bellagio, so we decided to just head back. 

But our entire stay there, the service, and our room were excellent. Everyone was super nice and attentive.

The Hotel is beautiful and well maintained.

Really impressed with this hotel. Gorgeous, swanky, and excellent customer service. I'm no princess, so this far exceed any expectations I had :)

The pool is actually a little small but really fun. It seemed pretty swarmed both days, but we didn't actually have any trouble getting seats. While we were there we hung out with our pals, Beyonce and Hugh Jackman (I got to swim with Wolverine!!), and we heard JT (Justin Timberlake) was on his way. This is just to point out, this place is HOT! Apparently XS is *the* club in Vegas right now...

I was in the Double Queen Suite and actually spent 2.5 hours napping in my ridiculously comfortable bed before a legendary dinner at Picasso (Bellagio). A siesta is *highly* recommended in your Encore bed, and you will need it after a day in the sun! I also had a really cool view of the strip. The room came with a living room and foyer area with huge mirrors, was perfect for three girls dressing up :) The room service was delicious, however the already added 18% gratuity was a little annoying. The only other thing was, there was no internet access in the room! We desperately wanted to twitter our fab weekend to make friends jealous, but couldn't!

Lastly, the Spa at Encore.
If you're a spa junkie (like me), do yourself a favor at make an appointment at this Spa. It's serene, tranquil, and a serious pampering session. It's not cheap, I got the Good Luck Ritual ($250 before gratuity) but its worth every single penny of it. There's a steam room, suana, dipping pools (a must) and waterfall showers. All of this is included with the spa service, or you can pay $30 for it

I totally recommend this place if you have the money!!

Beautiful hotel!! Our room faced the mountains which was perfect for us. I love the red and black decor and all the butterflies throughout the hotel! Food is great but you get what you pay for!! The only downside is it's a haul to get anywhere on the strip but I'd definitely stay again!

Hands down my favorite place to stay in Vegas. Everything about this hotel is 5 star. The private tower is a MUST because the rooms are absolutely gorgeous. This hotel consistently goes above and beyond and really sets the bar high for luxury hotels in Vegas.

While not a huge fan of Vegas, this place certainly makes it better. Have stayed at many spots in this town but would say this is by far the most comfortable. All the rooms are suites. Clean and comfortably appointed. Room service, while slow was shockingly good --- likely one of the best breakfasts I've had in a while (equals the Sunset Grill in T.O.). Casino wasn't too busy and staff was very friendly. Had to check out early though --- but to no hassle. I'd definitely stay there again. +ives: New, clean, comfortable rooms -ives: can get pricey but hey, it's LV.

I've stayed at a lot of hotels in Vegas, but this is by far the nicest one I've seen. The Hotel is classy yet trendy.  The suite I've stayed at in particular was really gorgeous! Our view of the golf course was breathtaking!! And the bathroom... WOW!! It had a huge glass shower, hot tub, 2 sinks, a vanity and flat screen TV!! I would definitely stay here again!!!!

We would never go back to this hotel!

At the 11th hour, there was a problem with our credit card ($177.00 due on our bill ) and instead of trying to reach us, they locked us out of our room and we couldn't get in the room to get another credit card.  They did everything to make us feel like crooks (only thing that they didn't do was to handcuff us).  We always spend around $5000 each time we go there for a few days!  At the end, they tried to apologize but my husband and I will not go back..... Going to stay at the Four Seasons next time we go to Vegas.

We checked in and all was great. After arriving in our room and went to shower before dinner there were clumps of long black hair in the shower. We called downstairs and they took care of it after however we went to dinner without showering. The management staff made no effort.

Probably one of the most beautiful hotels in Vegas. Comparable to The Bellagio in decor. It is simply fantabulous!
I think I may be addicted to red. And the theme here is red, luscious, divine, sultry, sooo amazingly red.
The rooms are outstanding!
The service is outstanding! 
The clientele is a bit pretentious, but you get what you pay for right? With stores like Chanel and Louis Vuitton lining the corridors, you have no doubt where you are.
I love it, and I would stay here anytime!
That's a hint~

I was so impressed by the decor of this Hotel it gave me a big smile! I'm so tired of boring, drab decor and finally a Hotel does something out of the ordinary with their decoration. Hooray!!
 
I loved it! The bright red wake-up chandeliers, the beauiful large bright red flower pieces on the walls, the butterflies in the marble, the trees inside....it's a hotel I think my friends would also love! (I went with my fiance...(he was happy that I liked it so much.)

The food in the cafe was delicious and I did enjoy the decor there too. :)

This is a solid 3 star hotel do not let anyone tell you otherwise . The suite I stayed in was dusty. The walls are very thin and you will hear the doorbell ring from the rooms next to you on both sides. Lots of door slamming early. You will hear lots of chatting from house keeping early in the morning as well. Not what you wanna hear from a long night partying it up ! I would expect this from cheap Vegas hotels\/motels not a sister of the Wynn .

The staff is extremely nice in the main bar lounge outside of elevators. Casino staff are crabby- no smiles. 

I prefer The Wynn, nicer rooms & much more peaceful sleep.

Encore was everything I hoped it would be and more! The entire property is beautiful, modern, and well maintained. It is in the action but has enough space from the other resorts that you get a space when you return to the property. All of the staff members went above and beyond to make your stay care free and easy. I loved the fact that you could share amenities with the Wynn next door. One of the biggest perks to me was using the concierge to get tickets into XS and Encore Beach Club to skip the lines and start in on the fun faster!
If you think noise will be an issue you for be sure to request a room opposite from XS. I got a beautiful suite on the 14th floor that had a great view of the mountains and zero noise from the clubs below. Can't wait to stay at the encore for my next Vegas  trip!
Pretty awesome hotel so far. The room is spacious, clean, with French windows and great view of the strip. Fairly luxurious, would put it on par with the rooms I stayed  in at the Venetian.

Absolutely spectacular.  Spinning flat screen tv, best pool scene in vegas.  hottest clubs.  from start to finish this was an amazing 'ultra casino'.  As the name Encore suggests...I would do it again!

This hotel gets a solid 4 stars and this is why.

1 for people watching
1 for XS
1 for the suites
1 for the room service

-1 for the pool

Ok so I saw tons of beautiful people in the pool are, thongs and fake tits left and right but the pool itself is tiny and the European pool is even sadder, the only naked people I saw were old woman and all the kids were drunk and acting like dumb shots so I couldn't even relax, I hope that when beach club opens they charge a fee to get in so the cheap ass college kids can stay out and not ruin it. Besides that the place is awesome, not very kid friendly but awesome for adults. Must check it out at least once.

My wife scheduled a spa appointment which was the only reason she came on the trip with me.  She went to he appointment. Once she was ready for her massage she informed the employee she was pregnant but confirmed with her doctor that it was ok for the massage.  Prior to our visit we review all of your material and it stated that if you were pregnant to consult your doctor first.  It said not about not doing treatments if you were pregnant.  I understand the policy that I was told due to your liability however this is not what was on your website or papers. If this is your policy it should be written that way.  Because of this I received a call from my wife crying because your spa did not communicate this policy.  I was invited by the hotel as a guest.  I have never been to this property before and after this experience I will not be returning and ensure that I inform everyone I can about the poor service we received.

IT'S GOING TO BE TOUGH STAYING IN ANY OTHER VEGAS HOTEL AFTER OUR RECENT STAY HERE!

Let me tell you:

- rooms were fantastic with an entire wall of VIEW!

- resort is so huge we literally did not leave it (we were in vegas for 4 days)

- excellent customer service and delicious choices in dining... just be prepared for prices if your on a budget.

- you will literally MELT in their beds,, 

I loved the decor and the Steve Wynn style and detail  to making each and every location of this casino resort feel like a different experience!

p.s Try the Parasol down bar... order a "Lake of Dreams" martini... yummiest drink in vegas

After another relaxing stay at the Encore at Wynn Las Vegas, I must state that this place is amazingly beautiful.  

The brilliance of colors throughout the property and the rooms are soothing to the eyes.  If not for the slot machines and table games, you wouldn't know that you're in Las Vegas.

The pool areas and landscaping are perfect.

The lush flora is on display everywhere you turn.

The tile and marble art are masterful.

Everything from the restrooms to elevators, perfect - just perfect!

If you're planning on visiting Las Vegas, make Encore or Wynn your choice to stay and play. Whether you're looking for relaxation or excitement and fun, you'll get it here.  You truly need to stay more than one night. 

Worth every cent! 

Be sure to sign up for the Red Card, where you'll earn comps on hotel stays and meals as well as free play.  There really isn't a better player card around.

I would like to personally thank Mr. Steve Wynn for creating such a beautiful resort.  (I hope this reaches Mr. Wynn)

Encore!

OMG! This is a beautiful hotel. I saw the showstopper show here. Refer to my separate rating of the show. This hotel was the gateway to the fashion mall. I also enjoyed the dinner buffet here. Refer to my separate rating of the buffet.  As with all the luxury hotels come with high end retailers.  I gave a 4 star rating because I didn't stay in this hotel, but I would definitely consider this hotel on my next visit on the Vegas strip.

A fitting encore to Wynn Las Vegas (no pun intended) is encapsulated in this stunning resort known as Encore at Wynn Las Vegas.  Branded as the cooler, hip sister of Wynn, Encore offers the same level of service, attention to detail and customer first mentality of its predecessor.  The difference between the two hotels is simply that one stands on the South end of the property and the other (Encore) is to the North....obviously there are some slight differences that I will cover below:


I've had the pleasure of staying at both Wynn and Encore and have noticed that Encore is quieter (except for one thing, to be discussed in a moment) and of a more relaxed feel than Wynn.  Located behind Wynn and a bit further North on the Strip means that the foot traffic in the Casino is far less than that of Wynn and the crowds are not a problem or a nuisance like they are at Bellagio or Venetian.  The Casino is surrounded by natural light and gardens near the pool and is a fantastic place to gamble and people watch both in the day and night.  Wynn's Casino can sometimes feel cramped and busy with all of the foot traffic, this issue is resolved at Encore, even at peak hours in the evening.


Where Encore does have large crowds is at Encore Beach Club which is an open to the public outdoor pool party venue with an enormous pool, private cabanas and tons of people (think Tao Beach at Venetian, multiply it by 5 and there you have Encore Beach Club).  The noise from Encore Beach Club, mainly the pounding base from the music represents Encore's only drawback and can be clearly heard even on the highest of floors (39-up) in Strip facing rooms.  The noise continues into the night well after EBC closes and then comes from XS nightclub which opens onto the pool at EBC.  While you should be up late since you're in Vegas, if by chance you do need a good nights sleep this can be a bit of a hassle.  It's far from a deal breaker or huge detractor from choosing this hotel, but it is a much complained about point from most guests.

The Standard Resort Suite at Encore is impressive to say the least!  At 700 sq. feet it is leaps and bounds ahead of it's nearest competitor, the Bella Suite at Venetian\/Palazzo.  The bathroom is enormous and decked out in fantastic marble and the main living area is separated by a half wall with a 40 inch flatscreen mounted on a pivot so you can enjoy it from either the bed or couch which is situated near the floor to ceiling window.  Just like at Wynn, the lights and drapes are electronically controlled and you get the pleasure of sleeping on the same Wynn Dream Bed found next door at Wynn.

Choosing between the two can be difficult, but if you're looking for a more low key, under the radar Vegas experience yet still crave the need to party and have a great time, Encore is the place for you.  Encore gives you the ability to be away from it all but at the same time is just a step away from the controlled chaos and fun that is Las Vegas!  You will not be let down if you choose to stay here, enjoy!

I always prefer to stay at Wynn hotels.  Before MGM bought out the Bellagio I stayed there every time.  The Wynn is awesome and has been a five-star experience every time I stay in Vegas.  Understated elegance and attention to the small details is what has always set Mr. Wynn's properties apart from the rest.  Encore is a great hotel and is worth the stay but surprisingly comes up a little short on some of the small details which I found surprising.  
The great - 
Large room, nice flat screen, large bathroom, separate bath and shower, quality linens (all apply to the regular room).  The room is also well soundproofed from your neighbors.
The good -
The hotel feels like a much smaller hotel than it is.  Everything is grouped together and easy to find.  You don't have to walk a half a mile to get to everything.  This sounds minor but you really do notice it after awhile.  
The eh-
Valet pickup is absurd.  You have to walk from the front to the side of the hotel, down a narrow stairwell with your luggage, and wait for ten minutes for someone to bring your car.  The exit does avoid Las Vegas Blvd. however which saves you time.
Room service - two personal cheese pizzas and two orders of chicken lettuce wraps - $106.  I expect some markup but give me a break.  You also may not bring outside food up to your room.  You will be stopped at the elevator!  Hookers?  OK.  Drugs? OK.  Fast food takeout?  No dice.  Very, very disappointing.
Mini-bar restocking person: I'm sorry that your hand-held device did not show that we paid $100 for a late checkout Sunday, but you could be a little nicer to us after I explained what happened and not treat us like degenerate squatters staying past checkout time.

Great hotel.  It hurts me not to give it five stars but there is some roughness around the edges that I found surprising.  Also, iPhone 3G doesn't work on the clock\/radio although other istuff does.

Of course the hotel is gonna be beautiful; it's the Wynn...
My review is of the security of the hotel...
Actually, those "bike security" that bike around the property.

I went to EBC for it's grand opening and like an idiot, I forget my keys...in the ignition without knowing til hours later =( 

I have a friend drive me to and from Encore to get my spare and the battery is dead...DEAD =(=(=(

Thankfully, hotels have everything! I asked one of those bike security if they had jumper cables; and even better, they had a jumper box!!! So, my problem was solved in 20 mins.......after my stupid key, battery dying experience.

Thank you, Encore and Wynn for have a jumper box on site and for George on bike patrol =)
Love this place.   We always get the royalty treatment everywhere we go. From check in to check out it is always amazing here.  One of my favorite hotels on the strip.
Nice hotel. Disappointed because we weren't able to check in at 3pm when we were supposed to. Garth Brooks show was the best!
Very nice hotel. Pretty much top notch everything and not too expensive either. The customer service was pretty bad which is why I am knocking them 2 stars. More later

You can throw a ton of superlatives at Encore, and I feel like they're all deserving. As much as Vegas prices have crept up over the years, there are very few places in the world where you can get a true resort experience for only a couple hundred a night. With a room at the Encore, you're getting the whole Wynn property, so even if Encore is "smaller," the facilities should be considered together. Encore's interiors are a burst of powerful red, while the Wynn flutters out with its floral array of colors.  

ROOM: Beautiful view of the strip, the King suite is such a well-designed space, as comfortable as home but as swanky as a hotel can be. Easily my favorite room in Las Vegas (12 different hotels to-date). You realize how little it really costs to move up from a solid Vegas room to something truly luxe. 

POOLS: Enjoyed the Encore pool, but that Wynn pool! Gorgeous. 

BUFFET: I'd say the best but I haven't tried a couple of the more recently popular ones. Crab legs are amazing, fresh, and worth the spend, but too many dishes are "just okay" in buffet dining, even at Wynn. Spice Market at Planet Hollywood is much less expensive and I've found a wider variety of tasty items there, but the Wynn space is so elegant that my memories of eating here are better. 

TERRACE POINTE: Worked very well for us as a straightforward and, as expected, lovely looking cafe with a nice view. Stopped in for a delicious french toast late one morning. 

CASINO: The action at the Encore tended to feel empty and quiet, so we usually gambled on the Wynn side, where things were usually more lively. Beverage service is nearly non-existent, my only true ding on the service here.  

So after praising all the facilities, their beauty and class, I do have to note that despite the spaghetti and bikini straps ingressing and egressing XS and Encore Beach Club, the overall feel here is a bit stuffy, definitely money, and there's more of a cocoon-feel protecting the property from the roughnecks carousing down the Strip. I happen to be one of those roughnecks most of the time, and I appreciate the energy of being right in the middle of, you know, Amurrrica. That's the beauty of Vegas, though, which keeps me coming back to enjoy its highs and lows. Encore is definitely a high, if not the high.

Wow where do I even begin? This place left us so shook from the time We had step foot to the time We depart the entire time We had here was truly a 5 star experience like many had said. I have always wanted to stay here since it had opened back in 2008\/2009 but we never had gotten a chance cuz it was a luxury to have the money to stay here. Luckily enough We had singed up for a red card account a couple of years ago and just earlier on this year We had gotten a letter from the wynn that was a package deal for 2+ nights, 2 free buffets, and 2 tickets to la reve which was a really great deal in my opinion so we had decided this time to do it!! We booked for the half of the first week in July I was so excited. When upon the day for check in we gotten an email saying that if we wanted to upgrade to panoramic room and the kind lady at the front desk had gave us options of able-to-do upgrades (rather than doing the $20 trick)  we pick the panoramic strip view after all and boy that was really worth it cuz our room had one of the most spectacular views I had seen in my travels nothing compares to the view. The room itself was bigger my  room and had the best bathroom with even a tv!!! I mean who has that in their bathroom at home lol. There was silk robes, detail cleaning shower, it's own separate water closet (again a 5 star experience people). beds were comfy af and everything was automatically controlled and even the quality of the furniture was there even though that's a minor thing to focus on but still. Pools were heated and big as well with great service and nice people serving us. La reve was something else of its kind because the show was unique and the production was done very professionally with a lot of acrobatics and synchronize swimming. Now unfortunately there are a few downsides but not too many. 1 a loud thumping of the beach club I can still hear from the 30th floor (wasn't too loud it's just that it went on for a while) 2. Our room was right next to the elevators and we can hear it going up and down constantly. And 3. I know it's something that's not changeable but man!! there's so many godamn 21+ pool areas in this property like it only limits for me to limited access to certain pools and also I can't even walk a shortcut past the casino areas to get to our room quicker without some fatass gaurd\/security stopping me for some ID which is so extra. Regardless of my experiences Me and my dad still made the best out of it considering I still had 3 more years until now to finally be free. You see vegas for people who are in their late teens is kinda miserable for them mainly because ur an adult but not an a full adult yet to do all the fun stuff and that's what really frustrates me. The atmosphere of this property kinda gave that feel  to me too that I don't belong cuz I'm not 21 yet because of how intimidating it was. But the question is will return to this property? Yes and no. Yes because of the luxury 5 star experience, rooms, pool, food and the architectural design but a no because of how the atmosphere and feel doesn't feel very family- friendly you say.

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Encore hotel during the summer. We love that the room is sleek, large, and overall comfy. I love the spacious bathroom as well as the clean modern lines in the decor. Even some of our friends that hung out with us in our rooms ended up sleeping over since they were so comfortable with the space. I have stayed at other Vegas hotels over the years and I find Encore the best.

The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was check-in since it was overly crowded and took too long to get our rooms. Next time I will reserve a tower room if the price is right. Other than that, no complaints. We will definitely stay in Encore again.

Me and my wife went to this hotel for our honeymoon. My wife picked the hotel because the rooms looked nice and because it's brand new. 
First impression when walking into the hotel was wow. The place looked beautiful. The casino was nice and clean and very fun yet professional looking. Our room was a nice size and very modern. 
The main thing that we did not like about the hotel was the $750 deposit we had to pay upon check in. We were there on our honeymoon and that along with relocating across the us, we didn't have a ton of extra cash. But after going back and fourth we were able to have them only take a $250 deposit so we had more money to just give them anyway in there casino. Lol. The deposit is $150 per day. 
All in all, this is still one of the best hotels in Vegas and if I ever go back there, I will deffinally stay there. I will just have to be sure I have more cash. Lol

Of the three places I've stayed at (Excalibur, The Mirage, Encore), this place is easily the best one. It looks and feels upscale, but the price my friends and I paid didn't make it seem TOO BAD. It's full of fancy shops that many people gaze at but rarely enter. The staff is friendly and will greet you as you pass by. The biggest problem we had during our stay is we got a smoking floor, so certain nights the hallway leading to our room smelled like an ashtray. Our room smelled pretty bad the first night, but I guess we adjusted to it, so it wasn't so bad after the first night. Also the rooms looked very nice and they even offered a couch just in case you weren't comfortable with spooning your best friends (we were all very comfortable doing this). The view was also very nice, though our window looked out to the Trump Hotel and the empty plot of land that will be the next hotel\/casino. 

The dealers were also very nice, though I suppose they are in the business of attracting players. One of my friends and I would always find the emptiest craps table and we'd always have a good time with the dealers. They let my friend and I continue betting $10 after they raised the minimum to $25 because we had been playing at the table for a while. Overall, we had a good time sleeping, showering, and playing table games here and I would not mind staying here again.

As soon as me and my girlfriends walked, I thought "Beautiful," loving it already. However, the service was horrible and we will never stay here ever again. Where do I start..?? The registration desk was not organized at all and very small. And it was in the middle of no where We expected the room to be bigger. It was nice, but expected much bigger, especially for what we paid for. Room service took forever. My girlfriend and I ordered a salad and Dumplings @ 3am. They told me over the phone that it was only going to take 30 to 40min. It took 60min and I was really upset. I mean if it was going to take that long, we would have just not ordered and went to sleep. When the food finally came, we of course gave the nice gentlemen our money, but needed change. He said that it was going to take 10min for him to come back with some change. Guess how long it actually took? Almost 1 hour. Jezz, again the nice man should have told us how long it was going to take. I called In Room-Dining twice and they promised that it's on it's way. The last time I called, they finally told me the truth about how my change will not get to my room shortly. They said they will quietly put it under the door. Basically, my girlfriend and I waited a total of 2 hours for our food and my stupid change. Finally, going to bed @ 5am in the morning with the rest of the girls. We get a suprise @ the door, it was security. The said that we were getting numerous complaints. They asked how many of us were actually staying in our room. Me being realistically, I told them 4 and they told me that 2 of us had to leave. OMG! It was 5 in the moring, they couldn't wait until noon to kick us out??!!Good thing my sisters friend's boyfriend was staying @ Planet Hollywood so the two of my girls left and stayed there. We are were so not ecstatic with the drama. We decided that morning, 5am to check out later that afternoon and plan on staying @ Palazoo (beautiful hotel btw and wonderful service). We were not going to pay another night and risk of getting kicked out.
The next morning, the housekeeper opened our damn door w\/o knocking. We did have a "Do not Disturb" sign up. So brainless I guess. We have stayed @ Ceasers, @ the Venetian, Planet Hollywood, and experienced much better service there. We will never come back to Encore.

I'm giving it four stars.  But first the bad.   Another all-red unaesthetic casino.  And do not -- even if you are on the 25th floor -- pick a suite with a strip view.  Opt for the downtown view.  Why?  The thump thump of the night club goes right to your bones until 4 a.m.  (We got back at 12 for our one night there, went to sleep, and woke up and switched rooms at 1.)   

That being said, the rooms (ours was a small suite) are beautiful.  They look like something out of Mad Men, or the Chrysler Building.  Nicely styled, understated, really very decent style.  You feel like you are in the Vegas of Sinatra, or at least Swingers or the Hangover.  The fitness center and pool (while not as nice as the Cosmopolitan's) are nice.  Like the Bellagio, you do not have to walk through a smoky casino just to get to check-in.   You can get there straight from the parking lot.  That is something.    It is at the other end of the strip.  I like how we did it:  2 days at one end, a break into scenic Nevada and Utah for some  . . . scenery (what else), and then back for one final night at the other end.

We would NEVER stay at "Encore" again!  The rooms were not overly luxurious (for the price we expected much more!), we didn't find ANY restaurant (including Allegro, the Buffet) that was even GOOD - let alone EXCELLENT - and all were way, way, way overpriced!  Drinks at the pool were watered down and $20\/each!  Waitress service at the pool was S.....L,,,,,,O,,,,,,,W!!!!  AND, when we complained all we got was "sorry."  NOT. GOOD. ENOUGH!

Stayed at the Wynn 12\/3-7\/2016 to attend a medical meeting. My husband and I, each disabled, brought a service dog with us. We had informed the hotel prior to check in that we would be being these certified animals along with all of the appropriate paperwork. We were having a lovely time at this hotel until I was visited in my room by a hotel manager and security guard accusing my dogs of inappropriate behavior and putting me on alert. I let them know that their accusations were patently false and then was warned to not leave my dogs alone (whichever i hadnt, and didn't intend to) and informed that I would be supplied no more towels as I had used some to dry my dogs off after rinsing filth from the streets off of their feet so that they wouldn't soil the hotel. I was made to feel uncomfortable and feel that the Wynn does not truly honor the spirit of the Americans with Disabilities Act. This is the first time I have travelled to Las Vegas and the first time in my life I have ever had a visit from hotel mgmt.  I would like to add that all if the other employees of the hotel as well as other guests were extremely complimentary towards my service animals. I will not stay at the Wynn again.

Best hotel in Vegas.  

Decor, atmosphere, cleanliness, and service are all at the top when compared to others.  It is all about luxury here, and there's plenty of shops like LV and Vertu to uphold that status.

The rooms here are great and all have a ground to ceiling window so you can see out of your room.  If you are able to get the front view, it is amazing as you can see down the Strip to the South.  It is spacious as well, and the super amazing bed... oh man... you will never want to get up.  

The pool is grandiose too.  At night, it serves as the place for XS but during the day, go down and mingle in the Euro-style pool or have a swim in the other.

Two super clubs here: XS and Surrender, both taking advantage of the pools around Encore.  Lines do get long so... prepare to wait if you come late!

Food option can be limited.  There's really nothing "affordable" here as most restaurants will cost you a pretty penny.  There is a sort of cafe near the walkway to Wynn but it's not that cheap either and the food isn't that great.  Just head over to the Wynn Buffet?

One thing I will knock against Encore\/Wynn is that their Red Club, which is the player's card, gives HORRIBLE comps.  Of course, if you gamble big, the more comps and VIP service you would get, but gambling the same amount here versus MGM or Harrah's is definitely not the same in terms of earned points.

Just held a 3-day conference at the Encore and experienced absolutely superior service, high quality food, attention to detail and vibrant, beautiful surroundings.
