I have stayed in a parlor suite on several occasions and have been very happy with the accommodations. Also, during the warmer months, I recommend the Encore pool party - a real fun time. Stay here when in Vegas - you won't be disappointed.

Excellent stay!! Loved the suite and excellent staff. I liked the option of using the Wynn pools if I wanted but the Encore pools were more than adequate. I still vote Mandarin as the best hotel in Vegas because of the privacy but Encore is a close second.

I've been fortunate enough to stay at the Encore due to business a few times for a week + length. After staying here, I've definitely become spoiled when it comes to hotels. 

My advice - DO stay here if you want impeccable service & to be treated like a Queen (or King). It's a nice departure from your typical Vegas scene. If you want to experience "Vegas" a la Jersey Shore style then this isn't for you.

I love their large rooms with a sitting area and spacious bath tub. I always make sure to bring a Lush bath bomb to enjoy. 

All their restaurants are amazing, room service is no exception. When staying at Encore, there is no need to leave the hotel. It has everything you could ever imagine.

Stayed here during November and I thought it was great. My rating is based on two things: the room and customer service. 

The room was extremely nice, the halls were quiet, the room was cleaned well every day. 

Customer service: I called in a few times and each time I was greater with Ms."my last name". The customer service rep was always respectful and fulfilled my requests. 

Although this hotel is located at the end of the strip, it is worth the walk !

Well first of all I'd love to say that I am absolutely in love with the Encore it is so beautiful the red is so dramatic so classy rich and elegant the pool is amazing restaurants staff is very classy and amazing definitely will be back there's no place I'd rather be

Great facility, loved the spa, excellent restaurants, nice pools. Room was ok, could be better. $25 just to use the fridge in the room. Bathroom wasn't that great. All staff interactions were pleasant.

This is a nice hotel and I enjoy staying here, the rooms are very spacious and nice. The Decour is funky and I enjoy it. 

Parking is free 

The pool is ok not great 

Not family friendly, not good for young kids

Absolutely gorgeous!

I booked at the Encore trusting that it would be a nice, modern, chic place to stay, and it definitely turned out to be! I am in love with the decor here.. all the bright colors that pop out, and lavish designs that come with it!

Other reasons why I love this place:

-the parking garage is very close to the rooms, and there is a digital sign indicating the # of spaces left. Useful!
-NOT OVERCROWDED! you can actually get in and out of the hotel in a snap!
-XS Nightclub.. duh!
-beautiful pool area, although I never got to make my way down :\
-beds are amazingly comfortable.. plus the down blanket that makes you feel like you're sleeping in a cloud
-everything is VERY new and updated. They have a control center where all the lights\/drapes\/privacy signs are at a push of a button :)
-Huge window which opens up the room a lot more
-Wynn resorts have all-access hotel keys that you can use to charge anything to the room and gamble with for rewards points.. plus it's personalized!

The ONLY problem we had here was waiting in line at the front desk (twice behind one guest ahead of us) for seriously 20 minutes just to activate our room key (we moved from a king to a double queen) or to ask for an extra room key. How can it take people 25 min to check in??

Btw, their lobby cafe has an AMAZING Salmon Danish in the morning!

Definitely would stay here again.

Beautiful resort! Loved the colors within the hotel.   Nice roomy area in the queen panaramic view room. A few disappointments though. The in room dining is quite expensive with all the additional charges; service fees and delivery charges. And in addition the food was not that great! Also another issue was at checkout time, which is 12:00, housekeeping was knocking at our door. We said it would be a couple minutes. 10 min later the front desk was knocking to see if we were out, mind you were were out of the room by 12:20. So if you need a LITTLE time past noon don't stay here!

I have stayed at the Wynn Encore over 200 times and it is by far, my favorite place in the World.  The service is impeccable and always have fun and a memorable experience.  Steve Wynn is a class act and seems to always treats his employees and customers with respect...

Wow called the fucken host and reserved a table with 2 bottles. Showed up and the motherfucker stopped picking up his phone. Then we waited like 40 minutes in the booth line while everyone going in general admission was getting admitted in. The bouncer was "checking if there was tables available" when we got in it was dead as fuck! Come on a Wednesday night. So we waited another 20 minutes they put soda water, orange juice, coke and ice on the table. They delayed us another 20 minutes til our bottle service girl came and dropped the tab which read $2480 for two bottles of Hennessy privilege. Are you fucken serious? Lol that's more expensive then EDC weekend. She tried to explain to us that a bottle of privilege costs $775 each plus 20% gratuity. Lol send these bottle girls back to basic math. $775x2 = 1550 + 20% gratuity is an additional $310 even with tax the bill should've been $2,000 or less. And the piece of shit bouncer in the front asked us to tip him $200 in the front just to get us in. This place has to be the most shady spot I've been to. $2,500 for 2 bottles of Hennessy privilege - that's XO price! They will never get any business from me again. Everyone was general admission and they were treated better  then my group who would've gladly paid the cost.

Would give 0 stars if i could. Ruined my vegas experience.

This review is for its Valet Parking and Security Department:

My husband and I drove our 2-month-old brand new car (it is my first brand new car ever) from California to Vegas for our wedding. Before we left, we went to a dealership for a routine car wash and everything looked perfect. 

The trip to Encore was smooth and fine. We arrived around 10pm and gave our car to the valet parking in front of the lobby and then checked in.

We stayed in Encore for 4 days. After our celebration of wedding and a happy stay in Vegas, we claimed our vehicle and drove back to California ---- we should have taken detail pictures of the vehicle before and after we left it to Encore. Unfortunately, we did  NOT: only because we trusted Encore and thought they would take a good care of the parking.

After another smooth trip back to home, we drove to the dealership again for a car wash. Surprisedly, a deep, serious, approximately four inch long scratch is on the rim of the right front wheel! The dealership said only a very strong hit to the right curve could cause this damage. We were so shocked as we have never ever been involved in "hitting a curve" issue.

I contacted Encore immediately and followed their procedure by submitting a detail report with pictures. Today I got their response:"We are so sorry that you did not realize the damage that has been there before you arrived Encore. It is not our responsibility."

I then insisted to see their camera photos proving that they are "not responsible", but they said "Sorry we cannot disclose it to you. Your insurance agent is the only association that we can provide those photos to."

You know what? According to the dealership, the total cost to fix this damage is around $150. If it is not Encore's fault, my husband and I would never ever spend hours and hours on phone calls, paperwork and emails (and then ended up with a response "Sorry but it is not our fault. Maybe you did not realize when the damage happened") just for that amount. Yes we are both students. Yes we are not that rich. BUT WE ARE HONEST PEOPLE AND ARE ALWAYS RESPONSIBLE FOR WHAT WE ARE DOING. Unfortunately, it seems that Encore has nothing like that.

And yes we did not have any "direct proof". Because the only thing we have, as most customers, is our trust on your hotel.

This is my first, and definitely the last experience with Encore and Wynn. And a lesson we learned: Take pictures of EVERY DETAIL before and after we leave our vehicle to any third parties.

I want these rooms for my next home. The black lining on the edges is something I saw a while back in Domino magazine. I spent most of my time gambling here, i felt it was the most spacious and therefore enjoyable. I dont like crowded smoke places.
We had dinner at Sinatra and that place needs work.

Rooms are very nice and comfortable, staff is great! I was there for a meeting on a Sunday through Tuesday and the room literally shook all night from the XS night club music! I ate in 3 of their restaurant's that were good but stupid expensive, go down the road to Morton's for a superior steak for much less. The pool was nice but also way to pricey! $8 beer? $16 house maggie? WTF???

This hotel is great. The decor is pristine and how can you argue with a tv in the bathroom positioned at the right angle so you can soak in the tub and watch Family Guy. 

What's even more awesome is that I step out for am hour or two and within that time, the maid had already come and cleaned. 

The high tech room was also a big plus. Closing the drapes from my bed adds a nice touch. 

The only gripe I had with this hotel was the high priced tables. I know, I know... You're staying in a high class hotel you can't expect to have five dollar tables. That's okay though because I just meandered over to circus circus where dice dollar tables abounded.

Steven Wynn knows exactly what he's doing because the energy at this casino is amazing. The gorgeous red decor makes this one of the more unique casinos on the strip. It is so classy yet modern. And of course, Encore Beach club is the best daytime pool party that you can find in Las Vegas. It is not extremely crowded like Rehab is and you won't be on line forever like at most other places.

The Wynn\/Encore can best be compared with the Venetian\/Palazzo as both are two-tower hotels with a large adjoining dining and shopping complex, and both are all-suite hotels with a separate seating\/dining area.

The Encore tower has a more contemporary design, with a nice touch of casual elegance. The floor to ceiling windows are awesome.  I like the large work desk here but I like the dining table setup at the Venetian much better.  The floor plan here is ok, but again I like Venetian's sunken seating\/dining area a lot more.

The Wynn\/Encore complex has a lot of "red" and bright colors, which really doesn't appeal to me. It also has a lot of Asian and Asian fusion restaurants and the Asian theme is so over-whelming that it becomes excessive.  Even the soap and shampoo in your bathroom are scented with BAMBU desserts.  While I do like the lemongrass shampoo, I don't need Asian dessert smell in my bathroom.  

I do like the Encore better for its compactness which requires a lot less walking from the valet parking to the room elevators.  The casino area is also more compact and more easily accessible from different areas of the complex.  I like the Encore side casino more because it is less crowded than the Wynn side.  It's good if you are there to gamble and not for the party atmosphere.

The Wynn\/Encore Red Card program is very generous in terms of comps if you bet enough $$$.  We pretty much had most of our meals comp'd during our 2-night stay there.  And this, I like a lot more than Venetian's Grazie program.

Service has been excellent from everyone we have encountered, except for the valet when we arrived.  After I have unloaded my luggage and stepped out of my car, the valet wanted me to move my car forward.  A good valet at a 5 star hotel would have walked the 10 - 20 steps and moved my car himself.  But I guess this is just one isolated case.

Overall, a solid 4-star experience and I will definitely consider staying at the Encore again on my next trip to Las Vegas.

Question:  When you book a $2k a night suite at Encore, are you expecting to have things in the room completely non-functional and ventilation issues that make one whole side of the unit smell like fried grease and food?  This is aside from the non-existent soundproofing from the sideshow running at Encore Beach Club.

And it's how Encore's front desk handled all of this that makes even less sense:  Instead of righting the situation, they only offered apologies.  For a Steve Wynn property to charge this kind of money for a 2br apartment, offer it in this condition and then only express their most sincere apologies...  Well, I'd say that's a nice slap in the face.

Clearly, I'm better off at Mandarin Oriental at CityCenter.  There's clearly a reason they rank higher than any Wynncore property.

I got one of those letters in the mail offerring the moon and the stars to come stay here. I thought it was too good to be true so we called to find out what the "catch" was. No catch, so we made the reservations. When we arrived, everything was in order and they gave us even more comps then they had originally offerred. A very nice and unexpected bonus. Our suite was very nice, although maybe a tad smaller than when we stayed at the Palazzo. Some differences I liked  is that drapes controller never got lost because it was next to the bed and the shower had a little bench built in. I do wish the vanity had been a separate area from the sink but, oh well! I enjoyed a nice bubble bath in the oversized tub while watching tv. The closet space was ample for our trip. Service was excellent by all the staff we encountered. I'll definitely come back, if they'll have me!

Absolutely loved our stay here. We booked two rooms (king and queen suite) with panoramic views. The decor is impeccable and the fact that the room was huge was a huge plus. Service was prompt and attentive. Only negative was that nothing came with the room (except the bathrobes) and everything cost more ...but then again, all these hotels seem that way. 

Pluses: 
1. Great coffee\/ pastry place in the morning downstairs 
2. Vanity in bathroom accommodates a woman's need well with a lighted magnifying mirror, a cute stool and loads of counter space
3. Very comfy beds

Minuses:
1. Bath tub soaks need to be requested
2. Changes in room (higher up, view options etc) all seem to cost increments of $20\/ day\/ each

This is an overdue review! Stayed here summer of 2009 and decided to yelp since I've be going to Vegas again at the end of the month.

Encore has this sophisticated feel to it. Seems a little empty compared to other hotels, maybe because its so far from everything else. My boyfriend and I stayed at the 25th floor and for an extra 20 bucks to get a view of...Circus Circus. 

Anyways, the room is very pretty with nice interior design. My favorite part is the bedside controller for the lights and drapes. The room comes with a mini bar and if you pick up an item more than 60 seconds, you will be charged. So I suggest if you don't want to get charged look at the item for less than 60 seconds. Another plus I liked was that it wasn't smoky as other hotels were. 

Overall, Encore is a great place with all the beautiful design but I would rather stay somewhere else closer to the middle of the strip.
Casino floor is beautiful and elegant with friendly staff.  The suites are really nice too.  I'd totally come back here again.

In vegas, anything can happen, even booking a room at 5 in the morning. Everything from the bed to the bath was just what the doctor ordered.

The only thing i would ask is that they improve the air quality of their ac, the room is very dry.

Very nice.  One of the newer hotels I've stayed at.  The rooms compare to the Venetian with a more modern spin to it, so if you're into that you will appreciate.  The building itself is 60 something stories so you can get a room way up there and feel like you're on top of the world.  The negative is the prices of food and drink.  Also, if you like to play slots or some electronic blackjack, don't expect to win anything!  The odds are terrible and trust me this hotel doesn't stay as nice as it does by letting people win money.

I am a 60 year old professional. I stayed in a Parlor Suite at the Encore Nov 6-8. Prior to the reservation, I contacted the manager of the valet, whom subsequently identified himself as "Phil." He told me that upon my arrival, I had his permission to park my motorcycle inside the valet garage. After driving approximately 600 miles, I arrived at the resort and was told that I could not park my motorcycle inside the garage. After approximately 20 minutes, a valet attendant finally believed that I had previously obtained Phil's permission to park inside the garage. Almost immediately after parking my motorcycle inside the almost empty garage, Phil emerged from an elevator. In my presence, the valet advised Phil that my motorcycle was parked inside the garage. Phil immediately denied giving me permission to park inside the garage. After I had an approximately 5 to 10 minute conversation with Phil, he relented and I was able to keep my motorcycle inside the garage. During my conversation with Phil, I had to beg him for permission, which I already obtained. During the reservation process, I asked the employee if she would articulate on the reservation that my reservation is contingent upon my ability to park my motorcycle inside the garage. I also told her to document that Phil had already given me his permission. She told me that she did include my request on the reservation. Therefore, if she did her job there is a history that can be obtained. It is obvious to me that Phil neglected to document the permission he provided me. He also failed to notify his staff. The fact that I had to convince Phil he previously granted me his permission, is extremely irritating. In addition, upon my arrival I was tired, hungry, thirsty, dirty and had to use the restroom, however I was required to beg Phil for his permission. I understand the reason Phil needs to project authority over subordinate employees, but to do so with a guest of the resort is inexcusable. Consequently the attitude he exhibited towards me was as if he is royalty. Because there were several other guests of the hotel inside the garage when I had the conversation with Phil, it was a very demeaning experience. Maybe the Encore does not truly care about transgressions, but with social media, a plethora of professionals riding motorcycles, maybe they should. Although my experience did not ruin the stay, it convinced me to not only take my future business elsewhere, but to use social media and inform prospective guests that the Wynn properties are not hospitable to motorcyclists. On a side note, the Platinum Hotel is very motorcycle friendly and I recommend it to  other motorcycle enthusiasts. The  accommodations are similar as well.

Every time I come here I feel so VIP.  They go the extra mile to make your stay comfortable.  From the reception area, to the door men, the Fitness area to the spa, the pool area, the buffet & even the shops!  They are very professional & to the point.  I also must say, the housekeepers are truly sweet, they need some credit too. :)  Truly nothing bad I can find, awesome experience every visit.

One of my favorite hotels in Vegas.  Especially with Encore Beach Club and XS.  Great times.

One minor problem on my last visit, though - we asked for nonsmoking rooms but were given smoking rooms.  They were sold out and couldn't move us, and they didn't seem willing to do much else :(

The Encore is not a place to stay if you are a gambler. The odds are terrible. The Blackjack tables only pay 6 to 5 odds for a Blackjack. The Craps tables only have 2 X odds on all numbers. Come on Steve Wynn at least offer 3, 4, 5 X odds. It's impossible to win any real money in the casino. You have to go elsewhere to any number of casinos that will offer much better odds. The rooms are very nice but are ridiculously expensive and the so called strip view is laughable. We had dinner at 3 of the restaurants, SW Steakhouse, Wing Lei and Sinatra's. All were extremely expensive although the food was decent but not even close in comparison to New York City restaurants. The wine list was extensive but even the lower end wines were between $60 and $100 per bottle . The restaurants are not worth the money. There are so many other resorts in Vegas to choose from, I would only choose Encore if somehow you get a bargain rate and you don't gamble.

Best hotel in Las Vegas and I've stayed at most of the upmarket ones.  Only Mandarin Oriental would be on par.  Super lux right throughout the hotel, from the rooms to the lobby to the casino to the pool area.  Stayed here many years ago as well when it first opened and the hotel has held up very well over the years.
